review name: Perfect Single Cup Coffee Maker - Excellent for those who grind their own beans!
review text:
I got the Instant Solo Single Serve Coffee Maker a day ago. I've always had Keurig machines and used the My K-cup reusable pod. I purchased this maker when my old Keurig died. I was looking for a more affordable option that would last longer than the Keurig machines that rarely last more than 3 years. After reading the reviews for the Instant Solo, I decided to give it a try. My first impressions are as follows:
1. The machine is well made and well designed. I really like the light touch buttons.
2. Cleaning the machine and getting to the various components is easy.
3. I really like the reusable coffee pod that comes with the coffee maker. Please note that other generic reusable coffee pods won't fit this unit.
4. The taste of the coffee I made with the reusable pod was far superior to the coffee brewed using the Keurig machine - I think that is because the brew cycle is a bit slower and the grounds are hit with a bit of water to prep the coffee before the brewing starts.
5. The first brew which was a brew with fresh water after unboxing was a bit of a chore as the machine kept erroring out. I figured it was due to the fact that the water pump was dry and needed to be primed. I just unplugged the machine and repeated pressing the brew cycle a couple of times and eventually the coffee maker started working. Also, there will be a bit of a plastic smell the first time the coffee maker is used. That smell goes away completely after the initial run through with fresh water. I ran a plain water cycle 5 or 6 times to make sure the machine was completely flushed out.

As far as durability goes we are in the early days but so far I am very happy with purchase.

When my Cuisinart single serve died, I needed to replace it, but the $149-$159 cost was out of the question, so the search began. I've had 3 Keurigs and was not pleased with them, so that brand was out. I wasn't sure about Solo but it was reasonably priced and had good reviews. Now, after almost 3 weeks of using it, I can say I made a very good choice.
This single serve brewer takes up far less space on my countertop. Although I wish it came in a stainless steel finish, it's attractive in black.
Operation is simple. Tap the power icon, tap your cup size (8, 10, or 12 ounces), and you're done. There is a bold option you can also tap where the brew is longer to extract more flavor. I haven't used that yet because I'm pleased with the strength of the coffee without it.
The cup brews quickly. There's maybe a 10 second wait time before coffee begins flowing into the cup. The machine is quiet, and when I remove the k cup it is not drippy. Most importantly, my coffee is hot and the flavor is excellent.
Cleaning is easy. I haven't had to run a cleaning cycle yet, but cleaning the exterior is a breeze. Far fewer cracks and crevices where the coffee splashes gather. My Cuisinart splashed a lot. I was constantly wiping the unit behind where the cup sits and thought it was normal. This unit hardly splashes at all.
The water reservoir holds 42 ounces and I thought I'd be filling it all the time. My old unit held 72 ounces. Yes, I have to fill the Solo reservoir more often, but not where it's a bother and I realize that my water is fresher.
Finally, the top on the reservoir is round. No big deal, right? Well, it is a big deal, surprisingly. When I was in a hurry with my old unit, if I didn't put the top on just right, it would drop into the water reservoir and I'd have to fish it out. It happened pretty often and it was irritating. The reservoir top on the Solo does not and cannot fall into the reservoir because it is round. Such a little thing, but so very nice.
Now that I have experienced the Solo, even if I had money to purchase a more expensive brand, I would still pick the Solo. I am well pleased with it and highly recommend it. The Instant Pot people have another winning appliance!

review name: Measurements are a bit off but I would buy again.
review text: Purchased a his and her set on sale. Ran both units through a couple tanks of water and both are consistently off by the "ounces" brewed. The 8 oz brews 10 oz, the 10 oz brews 12 oz and the 12 oz brews 14 oz. In going through this process, I can make sure that I set expectations and set out the right cup sizes to accommodate the actual minimum. I'm fine with the "actual" sizes and actually prefer them. I also keep these type of water units on bar mats to capture any overflow so, was prepared during the initial startup test. I replaced our Hamilton Beach Flex Brew single-serve matching units, we wanted something smaller with reservoirs for the coffee bar. These do brew a very hot cup of coffee. I have previously owned many Keurigs units they used to be my preferred gifts and I bought one for the office. My first Keurig was great, the subsequent units were not reliable so and given the price, I no longer purchase those. We'll see how these units hold up but either way, it's cheaper and less painful than replacing Keurigs... I only took off one point because of the size inaccuracy but I would buy again.

I was So tired of getting a Kuerig and it dying in such a short time. The last one never lasted a year. I don‚Äôt care where kuerig makes their coffee pots but if they don‚Äôt last that is a huge waste of my money and I don‚Äôt have money to waste. Shame on them. Anyway, this is a great coffee maker. I am very pleased with it. I use my own coffee in the refillable pod which is made of stainless steel -it will last me quite a while. Mine is small -perfect for a single person. I have used the 8oz and 10 oz setting only. Making coffee w-a new maker always takes a while to get the hang of it. I am happy. It is Fast too.
I visited my daughter at Christmas and she had a little Keurig. I noticed she had used a larger one but it died. I told her to get the Instant coffee maker and kuerig was a bad one now. She disagreed. I was visiting her at Easter and I noticed she now has a Huge Instant coffee maker. Her new kuerig she had at Christmas had failed. Guess she remembered what I told her. Lol.

I made my coffee for many years using the pour over method. I was convinced it was the best way to get a good, rich cup of coffee. I don't know why, but one morning I decided I was tired of heating up water for just one cup of coffee.

I did a lot of searching on Amazon and other retailers comparing features and prices of small coffee makers. I am very happy with my decision to buy the Instant Solo Single Serve Coffee Maker, (from the Makers of Instant Pot.)

It has a very simple and straight forward design, it's easy to clean, and the cord isn't annoyingly short. It has a slim profile so it doesn't take up a lot of space on the kitchen counter. The water reservoir is an ample size and is on the back of the unit, not on the side. (Which is one reason that I chose this coffee maker.) This coffee maker makes a great cup of coffee in a minuscule amount of time! Truly! It's super quick!

Highly recommend!

review name: Be aware - reusable pod is NOT compatible with any generic pods
review text:
While i was browsing differen k cups cofee machines, i wanted to be sure that i pick up the one with good reviews and it would be compatible with standard k-cups pods. I had an impression that using this one, I can use my generic reusable pods, different for tea and for coffee, as i always did. Nope.
Look at the shape of the bottoms on my photo - this machine will not accept any generic pods. Black one is instant pod. So you have to be aware that you will have to buy exclusively instant solo pods, $13 each, instead of paying $2-3 for generic pods.

I bought this having gone thru 2 Keurigs
over 5 years. Their price is way too high for the quality.
The Instant solo makes a great cup and takes half the counter space. I like the bold setting button too.
Only problem is that excess water collects in the pod section. At times coffee starts to drip then stops and makes a whooshing sound as steam spews out. Restarting works but dump the original out or the cup runs over. Water also drips out after removing the pod.
I like it overall after a learning curve.

After our Keurig died after 2 yrs I was searching for a new one that would fit under my upper cabinet. Our cabinets are rather low. So after searching through all the K-cup coffee makers on Amazon I saw the Instant Pot model!!! I know Instant Pot has excellent customer service as I own 3 of their Instant Pot digital pressure cooker and am very pleased with them. Well this coffee maker not only fits (sitting on a sliding unit, but it is sleek and really attractive. It holds 40 oz of water and is easy to fill. Brew 3 different sized beverages. Easy to use and so far thrilled with it. I make Lipton sweet ice tea K-cups to make ice tea. I can place a 2 cup glass measuring cup that is almost half filled with ice under the brewing unit and it fits perfectly. I push the BOLD button and 12 oz and i get a full 2 cups of tea! The Bold function allows me to get more tea out of the k-cup and makes great sweet tea! Oh, and did I mention - its RED!!! I love it and think you will be happy with it too.

This replacement was for my four in a row (K) that stop working . It‚Äôs hot, quick and quiet! The top that goes down has nice light up buttons and a low little chime when it‚Äôs preparing. It‚Äôs has a nice feel In weight when you push down (as opposed to a hollow cheep plastic feel). It punches the cup without effort. I‚Äôm pleased with the quality. I looked at it for a long time and chose because off the small space it takes up. It‚Äôs very nice, simple to operate because the setting are on top. I made a good choice, love the selection on Amazon.

review name: Not only a great value, but one of the best solo coffee makers I have owned.
review text: I was looking for something less expensive than a Keurig. I have had several little known brands and they made a decent cup of coffee but were slow and did not last long. This maker is fast and makes a great cup of coffee. It has a 40 oz reservoir so you don't have to add water for each cup. There are lights and beeps, three sizes to choose from, and a bold button for extra flavor. Love this machine. I have it in red.

Hurrah for the Instant Pot folks. This is a well engineered, efficient single cup coffee maker. I bought this unit as a replacement for my more expensive single cup Keurig machine, the pump for which died. This device is hand's down a far better bargain. It brews quickly. The flavor is superb. It is easy to use and the after market "K-Cups" work just fine. As a bonus the unit is very small and fits nicely on the counter. If you are in the single cup regular coffee market check out this appliance. Well worth the price!

Got this from Amazon Warehouse. First off read the instructions. There are high altitude steps. Who knew. I've used both k cups and my own grind in this maker. Excellent results. Once you master the buttons you will very quickly have a hot cup to enjoy. Cleaning is easy and the shape of the water reservoir was easier for me to hold onto and fit under my water cooler tab than other makes I've had. Overall I'm quite pleased. Excellent for the price.

The temperature of the coffee is much hotter than other coffee machines have produced. It‚Äôs compact and very unnoticeable on the counter. I like that it gives the option for making a bolder brew. I have started using the included ‚Äúfill it yourself KCup‚Äù using my own coffee grounds and it works so well I might not have to buy prepared K cups. Good job, Instant Pot!!!! I love your products.

review name: Stupid registration process for good item
review text:
Just got the Instantpot Solo coffee maker. After many years of using "THE" name in pod coffee makers, I got tired of the same product failures over and over. The water reservoirs for the Keurig always fail after a couple of years of use. Since a replacement reservoir is $35, it was a no brainer to try the Instanthome single use coffee maker (on sale for $60).
As usual item came on time and in good shape from Amazon. Set up was a breeze. After the usual clean up and flush of the unit, I made the first cup of coffee. Results were excellent - good strong brew had just what I expected in terms of flavor, etc. Coffee seems a bit hotter than from the Keurig AND brewed a bit faster than from my Keurig Supreme.
DOWNSIDE: An other example of a manufacturer that places their ease of manufacture ABOVE the customer's ease of use. In order to register the unit you have to enter a long registration number AND DATE code.
The information is on the BASE of the unit. Probably easier when the line produces goods to put it there BUT it is NOT anyplace else in the item. NOT on the box, or manual or whatever.
Once the unit is set up to my liking, I am annoyed by having to remove the water tank and flip the unit over to get the information.
All they had to do was ADD a line in the manual - "PLEASE, BEFORE set up, CHECK the registration number and product date ON THE BASE OF THE UNIT". Since there are 3 pages of disclaimers, IT would NOT be difficult to add ONE line in BOLD face type to the manual. Older people have trouble with holding such things steady, and writing down a long string of numbers at the same time. I hope that the unit lasts at least as long as my several Keurig's - bought over too many years. I am surprised that a CANADIAN based company did not think this through. They usually are better than that.

So glad I payed attention to the reviews on this coffee maker! I purchased this to replace an HB flex brew Kcup coffee maker that took 5 to 6 minutes to brew a cup of coffee. Ridiculous! I cleaned this and put it to the test. Amazing, quick, good hot coffee, and very nice on the counter top. Very happy I chose this one!

Works way better than keurig brand. The water tank arrived damaged but I had not opened the box until the return window had closed. I contacted customer service and they shipped me a new water tank at no charge! Very pleased! Now I can drink all the k pods I never used because the keuirg made watered down coffee and broke within a fee uses. I'm very pleased with this insta brand!

Replaced my oversized heavy Keurig after the top no longer stayed closed while brewing. We used another mug to weigh it down but I kept getting more grounds in my coffee. I wanted something with a dark or bold button for my hubby. I like that it comes out hotter. My only small complaint/suggestion is why not make the water reservoir as tall as the front of the unit? It would only add a few ounces but less often refilling would be nice. I would buy this again for sure. It made me wonder why the other one was so heavy, to make it feel more valuable???? BTW that was our 3rd & last Keurig unless they stop making this. The last replacement was due to wanting the strong setting while that last unit broke.

review name: It's a nice product but one problem
review text: My problem with this product the water runs really slow into your cup that's a no no but everything else is a plus

review name: Kind of disappointed but still use it every day.
review text:
I really like the instant pot products and was in need of a new coffee machine. There was a really good sale on this so I thought why not?

First thing I realized is that they have a proprietary pod. Yes, the pod design is useful as it makes sure you seat the pod the correct way. However, even if its slightly off, you'll get hot water/coffee flying out of the front. That was annoying at first but was a mistake that I def learned from.

Second thing I noticed is that the nozzle sprays a little more than the keurig models when it starts up. It's not the end of the world but I have to clear up a little more.

Other than that, its a decent machine that makes a decent cup of coffee. My only major gripe and the sole reason for reducing a star is because spare pods are impossible to find. I've been looking for a month and a half and they're either out of stock or someone is charging a kidney to sell you one.

If this breaks down and no one has made a knock off pod, or the company hasn't released more for sale, I'm moving on to something else.

I like the shape and style and it makes a decent, but not great, cup of coffee-though we are still playing around trying to get the best coffee brand, grind, and water ratio. The plus side-looks just like photo and fits well in smaller space, quick enough brew time, water reservoir holds more than my last keurig machine did so you fill less, and you can play around with coffee to water ratio as well as with coffee pods verses fresh ground coffee to reach your coffee preference. The cons, it splashes much more than my last machine did while brewing, leaving coffee splatter all over the machine, cup you're filling, wall near the machine, and coffee and sugar canisters near machine despite how you put the pod into the machine. It also has a terrible chemical smell and taste if the machine stands for more than a couple of hours without using. To combat this problem I empty the water tank and refill before every brewing session and run a cup of water only first before adding a pod to brew my coffee. I've tried running a cleaning cycle through it multiple times, but the chemical smell and taste remains to the first cup brewed after more than a couple of hours of standing without use. Because of this chemical issue, I am concerned with what we may be consuming by drinking the coffee brewed from this machine. All in all it's an ok machine, but I'm not at all thrilled with it. I am interested in how long this machine will last. I had been a keurig user for years because my first one lasted forever and worked great. However, the replacement keurigs I purchased did not work or last anywhere near as long as the first, hence why I ventured to this brand machine. I'll update when I can speak to longevity.

Been using this instant solo single for almost a week and I am really happy with this purchase. The taste is great, small footprint, easy to clean, appears to be well made. Happy with the white. Works and tastes better than my high priced, fancy brand name, coffee maker that only lasted 2 years.

If you fill the insert really close to top coffee will run out. That‚Äôs the only issue.
Would love for it to have a larger tank for water. I really have enjoyed it

Works great! Immediate hot water in one of three size cups. 8-12 ounce. Extra Bold by push of the Bold button. Power off and on. Easy to fill with water without taking out of machine and holds 3-12 oz cups of water. Has a fill with your own coffee grind included holder. Love this machine. A great buy!

review name: Works better then I thought would, Fast HOT
review text: I've had a GE 5cup drip for 15yrs took time to make coffee but for price and flavor I was happy it was slow to make coffee. . My sister brow beated me into this type because she always in hurry. I thought price was fair compared to the other bands like this. Really only takes a min or so to brew on Bold feature 12oz. I'm thrifty so never will use the pods type and I'm a recycle freak. The do it yourself is wonderful and easy to use. I'm not sure why my favorite flavor coffee is not tasting as good. Maybe using the Bold and water is WAY HOTTER then my old pot. I love a brand that has cinnamon and chocolate notes to it and they aren't coming thru even in the smell ?? So will need to play with it a bit. Reg type coffee I'm very happy with. If it last 3 years with fast brewing I'll be happy. Kept GE in my laundry rm just in case I can't figure it out when I'm craving my flavored coffee. Be careful this coffee comes out scalding hot compared to my other pot.

I‚Äôve had the Instant Solo Single Serve for about two months now. It‚Äôs a vast improvement over any of the previous single serve brewers I have used in the past. Although I‚Äôm not that concerned about how quickly it brews, it is definitely pretty quick. Easy to clean, easy to use. The most important thing though is that the coffee is brewed well, and you can actually taste the difference between good coffee and less than good. The included basket for using your own ground coffee takes a little bit of practice to pack it properly, but the results are a cup of coffee as good as something you‚Äôd get from an expensive coffee machine. So as long as 8, 10 or 12 ounce servings are adequate for you, this is an excellent choice for a very reasonably priced single serving machine. Highly recommended.

Awesome product !! Brews instantly. Threw my broken Keurig mini away after many issues of not working properly for months and I will Never go back to Keurig after using this Instant Solo. Who also makes instant pot. And you can see in my pix, I use the drip tray to hold my silicone coasters. Excellent product abd would buy again!!

Much better than then the Keurig I had to return.
Only complaint is when the cup is filling with coffee, it splashes small bits of coffee on the counter.

This thing starts making hot coffee instantly from a cold start, doesn't need time to warm up. Works with any brand of pod. A good size reservoir, 3 cup sizes and bold setting is everything I want in a coffee maker. Keurig is cutting their own throat with their new crap.

review name: Hot and flavorful coffee, small footprint, pretty design, easy and quick to use
review text:
I was looking for a new single cup coffeemaker but wasn't willing to pay $100 for a unit. When this unit dropped to $60 on sale, I read the reviews again and decided to give it a try. It checked off almost everything for me - white or silver design, pretty, small footprint, easy/one-touch use, and makes a very hot and really flavorful cup of coffee (which my old unit never did).

This unit adds a reservoir (I never minded pouring in daily water), a bold setting (I will never use this because the regular setting with my dark Italian roast is just fantastic) and brewing in 90 secs.

The only thing I miss is being able to brew more than 12 oz in a single round. My travel and tall mugs are at least 16 oz, so that's disappointing. I can't give a 4.5 star rating, so I split the difference.

I saw a number of reviews about sputtering and overflow from the top, and sure enough, after doing the two initial cleaning runs, I scooped the provided basket full of coffee, and water bubbled over during brewing. Per physics, I guessed there wasn't enough room for both the steeping water and all of that coffee in the well for the basket. Sure enough, when I actually followed the instructions, I only added 2 Tbsp of ground coffee to the basket. That was below the first line of the basket (and I'd filled mine to the brim with coffee!). With the proper/smaller amount of coffee, the next cup was just as bold and hot, and there was no overflow of water. I haven't experienced any of the spatter others experienced with any size muges.

I really like this unit and am very glad it went on sale! It makes morning coffee fast and delicious. I already am a devout Instant Pot user, so adding this to my happiness with the Instant brand.

review name: This is an excellent k cup machine.
review text:
Purchased this machine used as it was a very reasonable price and I had been intrigued with this newest offering into the k cup world by Instant Pot.
The high points are the generous reservoir, the size selections, the way in which it preloads the water into the heating chamber, near silent operation, brews at a hot temperature resulting in a hot cup of coffee, and the overall design is pleasing.
There are no low points.
It seems to me that this machine is a great value whether purchased new or used.

This Instant coffee maker is amazing! I have gone through two Keurigs over the last two years and neither is comparable to this machine in both quality and taste.

I ordered this machine to replace my broken Keurig as it was on special ($79; Normally $99, much cheaper than the $135 price tag in other places) and liked the quality of the Instant brand products I have purchased in the past. I assumed if I disliked it, Amazon has been great about returns in the past. Needless to say, I will not be returning this item. It is quiet and barely makes noise compared to its Keurig counterpart. I have tried both K cups and it‚Äôs included mini scoop for ground coffee, both options are spectacular. The Bold setting adds more dimensions of flavour. The touch screen responds well and is pretty quick to go from loading to brewing. It has a tiny jingle when the brewing is done, nothing too unpleasant or irritating‚Ä¶ I rather like it myself.

If you are debating this Instant product over a Keurig, you will thank yourself for choosing this option. I have had the very coffee I brew at the coffee shop, and it was never quite there when brewed with my Keurig. However, this Instant coffee maker tasted exactly like the coffee shop version.

The sizing is about the same size as a mini Keurig but slightly smaller. The design is sleek and easy to clean, the removable tray comes off with ease. It has a removable water tank that‚Äôs easy to clean if needed. ( Holds about 40 oz)

All in all, I‚Äôm so happy I decided to go with this option and can‚Äôt wait to see how well it goes over time.

Pros:

Quick Brew
Can use K Cup or Your own Ground Coffee with included scoop pod.
Sleek design
Touch screen
Size options (8,10,12 ounces)
Bold option
Easy to remove and fill tank ( can be filled separately or whilst in the machine)

Cons:

No indication of water level. I have no issue with this as my Keurig is per cup but I understand others have different models and may not have this experience.

Overflow, I have not had this issue more than once but understand some people have. I am aware you can remove the tray if that is a problem and it lessens this a bit, but if I could be honest, I would recommend a tall and wider cup. This issue for me only presented on smaller tea cup sized mug, so I grabbed my larger coffee mug and this issue was no longer an issue. There is spray (as to empty the pod of all fluid) which can be a bit untidy but Keurig also manages to produce this result. The difference between the two is I rarely have a leaky pod once I remove it from the machine. Makes it easier to disassemble for recycling.

Possible issues with touch censor but this is nothing I have dealt with yet, but know some may prefer the mechanical option as it may be easier.

Again, this is worth a chance to be considered especially being you can return the item if you dislike it. I found the coffee from this Instant Solo is preferred by myself and my guests who use it. I say the bold option was the biggest game changer.

I really like this coffee maker and being able to choose the strength. When mine stopped working after about 8 months I chatted with customer service, provided some info and they replaced it quickly. I‚Äôd buy again.

I have embarked upon a quest to find the best coffee maker at the best price.

The Instant Solo has a lot of things going for it. It‚Äôs fast! I don‚Äôt have to wait 5 minutes for my K brand coffee maker to decide whether or not it‚Äôs going to work. The Solo works instantly and that‚Äôs pretty great.

Unfortunately, the flavor just isn‚Äôt there. I have used ~4 kinds of grounds in the handy reusable pod, and ~10 varieties of K cup in the Solo. The flavors are muted, like they were brewed with far more water than they were.

While this isn‚Äôt my perfect coffee maker, it‚Äôs perfect for people in a genuine hurry. My other coffee makers can take 5+ minutes (and a power cycle!) to make a single cup. The Solo functions flawlessly and immediately.

Perfect for professionals, students, and people who really don‚Äôt want to wait for their coffee or other hot beverage. Note that this machine is compatible with K cups, and includes a neat little reusable pod. Certain other styles of pod will probably work, as long as they don‚Äôt deviate from the original K design too much.

Good for the price. I had a problem after using for 2 weeks where it stoped to brew. I had to read the instructions on the website on how to solve it. To solve I had to clean the needle because was obstructed by coffee.
Only dislike is that it spalshes too much when making
Better than expected. Reservoir is larger than my last coffee maker but overall more streamlined. I love it!!
This is the coffee maker I decided to try for the kcups. It has worked great. Several brand names we had previously seemed to have issues with the puncturing of the kcups or splattering.

review name: It's fast and coffe taste better than kurig
review text:
My first order was defective. No problem with return. My replacement was on order within hours. Recieved replacement on time as promised. The new one works great. Love the self cleaning. It brews fast and actually taste better than my old kurig.
Will highly recomend. Good price, compact and easy to use.

review name: Makes good pod style coffee. Lacking durability. Great customer support.
review text: This is a good, compact pod style coffee maker. Makes good coffee, fairly quickly. Reservoir could stand to have a larger capacity. Also, it doesn't pause making coffee if it runs out of water, it just alarms, and you end up wasting that pod. Needs a program update for this. Also, my coffee maker failed at around 5 or 6 months. Instant Co replaced it very quickly and without hassle. Very good customer service! But, my replacement is now acting up at just around 2 months use. We shall see after a thorough cleaning.

I read many reviews stating it was a bad coffee machine. I took it out of box plugged it in filled reservoir with weather, put put cup underneath and turned it on and hit 12 ounces and worked perfect, made no noise and water came out in a stream....100% satisfied.

This is the second coffee maker I have used in the last two months. This make‚Äôs very smooth coffee. It takes up very little counter space. I have used both grounds and prepackaged coffee and had no problem.
Video Player is loading.
My Kuerig Mini quit after only 2 yrs of use so I bought this Instapot and was not disappointed. Brews faster and comes with its own pod for fresh ground coffee also.

review name: Excellent cup of coffee - Probably the best
review text:
Okay, so I just had my first cup of coffee using this machine and my usual K-Cup brand. I have to say that it was outstandingly good. Much better than my old broken Keurig Supreme Plus ever produced. Not sure how or why, but it's a remarkable difference. Maybe there really is something to their pre-infusion process. It was delicious!

I had to ding the rating because at first try to do the initial brewing/cleaning process, I would push the 8 oz button it says to push and it would make a noise and then start flashing all the lights and chirping 3 or 4 times and then do nothing. I tried several times. Turned it on/off/on. Unplugged and replugged and removed the reservoir and placed it back on a few times without any success. The last time I removed the reservoir I pushed the little plug thing a few times, not sure if that was the problem, but when I replaced the reservoir again, it finally worked when I pressed the button.

There is no troubleshooting information such as what the chirps meant or what to do. We'll see how it does for the next time. It's a shame I'm worried about it being so defective - because again as I said first off it's probably the best cup of coffee I've had in a long time. I hope it lasts.

Works well. The water reservoir is nice, I can get 4 cups of coffee in one filling. I don't know how to judge taste as that is largely int the kind of coffee brewed. It evidently did not impact the taste.

review name: Only had a week and so far ok.
review text:
Easy to set up, did well with K-cups or the included filter. Drinks were hot and made in quick order. One thing noted regardless of what ounce chosen, be sure to use a tall cup! Short 6oz or 8oz cups allow the brew to splatter all around the cup area. Problem resolved by using a taller cup that came within an inch or so from the brew drip. No splatter.
Update: 01/07/2023
I‚Äôm in love with this little gem! Better than any other K or other coffee maker to date! The footprint is small and it‚Äôs actually attractive on the coffee bar!
After working thru the splattering by using a taller cup, I found by leaving the coffee cup in place after cycle completes and immediately removing the k cup, I avoid the end of cycle 1-2 drips on tray. No mess! Hopefully the unit will last a few years!

review name: Love, love this cute little coffee maker
review text: This is so simple to use. Just before you set it up take picture of the bottom with all the information you need to register at instahome.com/register. They will accept a photo if that is easier. I love that the water reservoir cones out. This machines makes cute sounds when turning on and off. Also comes with cup for ground coffee. This is my third coffee maker in three years but I think this might be my favorite. I did get the three year warranty just in case. I've never been so excited to make coffee.
Bought this since I can use ground coffee which I have allot of. Very convenient and compact.

This is a great k-cup brewer. I bought it for my home office so I really wanted something with a small footprint but that still looked good. This fit the bill perfectly. Brews 3 cup sizes of coffee and even has a "strong" option. It's been reliable and perfect so far. Love it.

This machine makes coffee just fine. Not sure what I expected. It does make a mess. For normal cups, it splashes coffee when used. After brew stops, no matter how long you wait, once you move cup it drops down on tray. Everytime. So cleaning is a constant. The coffee is warm at best. So if you like hot coffee, a microwave is a must. I hate to microwave coffee, but hate coffee that's not hot. The reusable filter is nice, but lots of stuff gets buy. So I recommend add a k cup filter. I got this to replace my $20 4-cup machine that was in last leg. Not sure if it's a upgrade.

I love everything about this coffee maker. I was a bit skeptical when i first saw it online during the Prime deal offer for $59. I ordered it anyway because my third unit of unreliable Keurig died unexpectedly (as always).
I planned on purchasing another Keurig at Costco (on special deal too) but iIthought, enough of this expensive and short-lived Keurig machines.

This Instant Solo Serve is the best coffee maker i have used so far. It is very simple to operate and clean. My family use this many times a day and it is still going great üëç Well done "Instant" brands.

I tried a Cuisanart, a brand I had purchased before and loved but expensive. I purchased another albeit less expensive Cuisanart and It Leaked. I tried two Keurig coffee pots the Elite brand made slightly better than lukewarm coffee. The Keurig Slim also leaked and was down right ugly in appearance!
Finally the Instant Solo Single Serve is a winner! Easy to use, hot coffee, takes up less room than the Keurig Slim model and brews a hot cup! Beautiful and so far no leaks! Thank you Instant Pot!

review name: Very slim and does not take up a lot of space
review text:
Received the machine yesterday and had it cleaned and setup in less than 30 minutes and is very easy to use. It has four control buttons, 8oz, 10oz, 12oz and a "bold" button. Machine has a 30 minute inactive sleep mode and will then shut down after 2 hours of inactivity. It started up quick this morning and did not take long to brew.

There is one issue I am trying to work out. I used a reusable K-Cup in my old Keurig and it worked great. The reusable K-Cup for the Keurig does not work with this machine. Although it fits in in the machine the lid will not close and lock into place. This machine does come with a reusable cup of it's own but it is much different.

It has two pieces, the lid and the basket. The lid has a little metal piece that needs to slide into the inside rim of the cup and then the handle locks into place. Early in the morning it is really hard to see the slot the metal piece needs to go in.

If you fill the basket to much and if the handle does not lock into place then the machine drips coffee like crazy. The water will actually drip from the end of handle as it sticks out of the machine. This is what I have to work on, not overfilling the basket and making sure the handle can lock onto the cup so the machine does not leak.

If I can figure out how to stop it from leaking then I will be happy with the purchase. It does not take up a lot of space on the counter, which is what I was looking for.

He used this while he was on the road for PSD/EP training for 12 weeks, as you never know what people have done to the coffee makers in hotels, (there are some vile story‚Äôs of body fluids‚Ä¶.Nuff Said‚Äù (Chadd Wright) makes a great cup of coffee, easy to clean and packable if you run around with a gorilla box for just gear like he does.
Highly recommended
Love the product...it's a no brainier. Easy Set up, hot coffee and the bold TASTE is GREAT!

review name: Great for families who use K-Cups AND who don't!
review text:
I had a dilemma. Visiting family members who love their K-Cups, and me ... who drinks dark roast decaf that doesn't come in K-Cups. And I'm not dealing with two coffee makers! My daughter was going to bring her Keurig when she came to visit, but how inconvenient is that?

Fortunately, my 12-cup coffeemaker broke - yes, that sounds weird - and I was on the search for a new one. My doctor had been advising me to cut down on my coffee intake, so a single-cup machine seemed like a good idea to break me from my 2-pot-a-day habit.

The Instant Solo Single Serve Coffee Maker was on sale and looked like it checked all my boxes when it came to requirements, except I thought I'd have to buy a smaller travel mug as the description didn't seem like it would accommodate a 20oz travel mug. I liked that it was compact, and I had a choice of colors, even though I chose basic black.

When my Solo arrived, I was surprised that my 20oz travel mug did, in fact, fit when I removed the drip tray. And, even though the machine only brews 8, 10, or 12oz, I can fill my 20oz tumbler by brewing 12oz and then 8oz (and who said my math was bad?!) My daughter can use her K-Cups without having to bring her Keurig to visit, and I can use my beloved Kirkland dark roast decaf in the supplied reusable coffee pod.

The reusable coffee pod is handy! it comes completely apart, so no hidden corners for coffee grounds to get stuck in. It's solid and well-constructed, so it can take the thumping you give it when you bang it to get the coffee grounds out, and the handle means you don't get covered in wet, sticky grounds, as well as is a means to place it correctly in the machine.

Cleaning is a breeze! The water container is straight-sided and easy to wash and dry. It's also large enough that I only have to fill it daily.

I'm very happy with my choice!

Love this machine! I brew loose leaf tea in the reusable K-cup daily. Bold setting is helpful to squeeze out additional flavor on my 3rd/4th cup from the same K-cup. Makes my loose tea last longer by squeezing out every drop. Brews hot but not too hot, so you can enjoy right away. Easy to use, multiple cup size settings and quick to heat water to satisfy the caffeine withdrawal in the morning. Had the "name brand" which broke, was noisy, not ergonomic to use as just shutting lid could knock the machine over. Was unsatisfied so tried something new. Do not hesitate to try this machine. Does everything it says and noise level is about the same as the "name brand".

review name: My boss gave me a raise because of this coffee maker
review text:
My Keurig broke down recently and replacement of the same model cost went up considerably. But I saw the Instant Solo brand in a superstore for $99. However, I checked here and it was on sales for $60. It was a no brainer for me because it cost less than half of a Keurig and does the same thing.

The 2 in 1 feature is great and allows me to use ground coffee powder without switching to another coffee maker. The 40 Oz capacity is just enough for my weekdays need.

The only negative is my dad likes to use 16 Oz mug which is too tall for it to accept. So he has to manually transfer with a smaller cup into the mug. Nevertheless, we are both happy with this purchase.

It is definitely an excellent Keurig replacement for the price I paid for. In fact, I purchase one to use at my work desk and now my boss loves coming over for a cup of coffee every morning and he gave me a raise because of it. Therefore, my coffee makers is already pay for themselves.

Maybe if I buy one for my boss before the next appraisal he can give me another raise. LOL!

I love love love this little coffee machine! I had a tiny kuereg machine and it was glitchy and would start brewing my coffee then suddenly stop mid brew. It was so frustrating. I started looking for something else and found this machine.

I love that it has a bold setting. My coffee is hotter and stronger than my kuereg ever got it and this new machine takes up less room. I don‚Äôt have much counter space so this makes me extra happy!
We‚Äôre happy with this product.
This makes a great cup of coffee and heats up almost instantly. It doesn‚Äôt take up much counter space. The tank is small but works for me as I only drink 2-3 cups a day.

Besides it being chic, it brewed my coffee cup fadt. I love the slender look on it. It fits perfect on my counter.

Love it!

I've used another brand for years and got tired of them. Bought another brand and ended up returning it. This one has been great. Easy to use, and filters fit so I don't have grounds in my coffee. Easy to clean and the flavor is great. I love having different sizes and the ability to make it bold. I love it!
Works great love it , i recommend!

This coffee maker replaced a Keurig mini plus which was very unreliable. The Instant Solo offers several benefits over the Keurig‚Äîthe coffee is hotter and seems less bitter (same K-cups), it has a more effective bold/strong setting, can hold more water, and it hasn‚Äôt had any issues brewing (unlike my Keurig). It also comes with a well made filter cup if you want the option of using your own coffee and it is pretty quick at making a cup of coffee, even with the bold setting. One feature that seems to be unique to this coffee maker is that it has a ‚Äúpre-infuse cycle‚Äù which soaks the grounds before brewing‚Äîthis may be why the coffee doesn‚Äôt taste as bitter.

The coffee maker does have a few negatives for me.
1. The cup sizes are not accurate. When I select 8 ounces (smallest cup size), I get almost 10 ounces of coffee‚Äîif you want less, you have to watch the coffee brew and press the 8 ounce button again when you want it to stop brewing, keeping in mind that it will continue to add some water after you press the button. This is the main downside for me since I prefer 7-8 ounces of coffee when I use K-cups.
2. It causes much more splatter than the Keurig. I now use a black 4‚Äùx2‚Äù mini cake pan turned upside down to raise my cup (see photos) and this has eliminated the splatter. A ramekin would also work well for this purpose. If this coffee maker is updated at some point, it would be great if the manufacturer could make the height of drip tray adjustable.
3. It doesn‚Äôt slide easily on the counter. I keep the coffee maker in an appliance garage and slide it out when I use it. I don‚Äôt want to use an appliance caddy (takes up more counter space), so I added small (1.2‚Äù) self-adhesive appliance sliders to the bottom of the coffee maker. I used 4 sliders under the main part of the coffee maker and 2 stacks of 2 sliders under the drip tray which is elevated (see photo). This hack has worked great‚Äî the coffee maker now slides easily on the counter when I need it to.

Overall, I would rate the coffee maker 4.5 out of 5 if I could, but since there are no half stars, I‚Äôm giving it 5 stars since it is a great coffee maker overall. Do keep in mind that if you want less than ~10 ounces of coffee, you will need to manually stop the brewing cycle. If this isn‚Äôt an issue for you, I do highly recommend this coffee maker.
Well packaged high quality product. Great compact design.
Solo is a great looking, easy to use, and well designed coffee maker. Excellent alternative to the "K" manufacturer with features they don't seem to offer, and a nicer price.
This really is all it says it is! I love the water reservoir and I love how bold it is even when you choose the 10 oz after choosing bold.

I‚Äôve had a few Keurig style coffee makers, and this one is just as good as any I‚Äôve had‚Ä¶ even better than some. But, I had a small issue. Mine arrived previously opened, with the water container broken. Apparently, it was a return that Amazon did inspect before sending it out to me. So, I emailed their customer support and they immediately apologized and sent me out a brand new one. They even sent me a follow up message thanking me for my purchase and asked if there was anything else they could do for me. Their customer service is top notch, and I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to buy any of their products based on that alone. Let me also note that I use many different k-cups, and it seems to work fine with them all. AND, it makes a good cup of Joe! ‚òïÔ∏è

review name: It was just ok. Prefer the Mixpresso.
review text: The sing-song beeps, shiny top. and flashing lights were too much for me each morning. Yes, you can adjust the song, but everything is complicated. I pressed multiple flashing lights and unit didn't respond. I'm guessing most of them require a wait after you push the power button until the machine lets you choose a cup size. Every time. Annoying. Didn't fit my travel mug. Bottom tray was flimsy. Took up a lot of counter space. Should have stuck with steady mixpresso brand.

I love how easy it is to use and the way it looks on my counter. It gives two extra ounces. Instead of 8 ounces, it gives 10 ounces which makes my coffee weak. The same for the 10 and 12 - it comes out with two extra ounces. Think I may have to return but hate too because I like everything else about it.
Update: a new machine was sent to me and it seems to be working correctly. I added another star because of that.
It‚Äôs works great and I like the small footprint. Makes great coffee

review name: Makes a really good cup of coffee
review text: Easy to use and actually makes the amount it‚Äôs says. The coffee has great flavor and comes out hot. I went through three Keurig machines in the last two years and it never brewed right and usually made bitter, luke warm coffee.
I had tried the other coffee maker, you know, the famous one, and it broke after a couple of months. I accidentally bought this one and love it. Easy to use and the coffee is HOT! And love the color.

review name: The coffee maker I have been looking for
review text: It‚Äôs great for single cup of coffee with your favorite coffee.
Great Machine

I bought this as a Christmas present to myself. For those that know me, I meticulously research everything before I make a purchase. I was first introduced to single serve coffee makers by our daughter just before Thanksgiving. She had a Keurig that used only k cups. It made a good cup of coffee and I was sold on the idea. So my research began. I soon discovered the major downside of using these single serve pods. They are way more expensive than just using ground coffee and the empty pods are terrible for the environment!
My research led me to this coffee maker by Instant Pot. It is a dual brew system using EITHER k cup pods OR ground coffee. I jumped in with both feet and bought a little electric coffee bean grinder for good measure. So, although I will likely not use the k cup pods in this, I can and will buy whole beans for the best and freshest cup of coffee. If we have company that likes the k pod coffee route, I can accommodate them.
All that said, I brewed my first piping hot 8 oz. cup of coffee this morning and it tasted great! The machine is very easy to use and clean. I use distilled water for the ultimate taste for my coffee, too. If you can push a button, you can use this machine! The price was right from Amazon at $59.99, as well.
Thos works as it should,but just doesn't give you very strong coffe even when you use the bold button. I like really strong coffee and this does not give you that.
Tengo cuatro y estoy muy contento caf√© y t√©s de todo tipo con muy buenos resultados üëçüèªüíØüëçüèª

I'm already a fan of Instant Pot brand, and this did not disappoint. It works well, is quick, and is easy to use and clean. And I like the little basket that allows me to use my own ground coffee in addition to K-cups.

review name: Nice looking machine - huge functionality flaw
review text: The machine looks nice. Which is why I picked it over another name brand machine. It works. However, it spits and spatters horribly all over each time it‚Äôs used. Something my two other branded machines don‚Äôt do. And I just don‚Äôt understand the liquid spout and the large hole of the drip drain not being aligned. Every time it‚Äôs used it ends up dripping all over the metal disk instead of into the large hole because they aren‚Äôt aligned. Why?! Honestly, would not purchase this again or recommend. It‚Äôs cheaper and nicer looking than most other brand solo brew machines but it‚Äôs design team focused to much on it being pretty and not it being functional.

Perfect replacement piece for your appliance! Arrived on time. Easy ordering and tracking. If your like me and use k cups but find a ground coffee you just love but have misplaced the piece to put that in.. this is for you.

review name: This is a great little coffee maker
review text: The coffee is piping hot: I can use pods or grounds and keep water in the take for my next cup. Only thing is short cups will be splattered and I only have one travel size cup that fits. I‚Äôm going to try and find some taller mugs.
When making a cup of coffee (not in a travel cup) it spills everywhere and having to clean it every time it‚Äôs some extra work I wasn‚Äôt expecting but overall delicious coffee in minutes!
It‚Äôs perfect for my kitchen. It‚Äôs dainty and makes really good cup of coffee. I love the buttons on top. Great but!
Perfect for one or two people to enjoy a fresh cup and save coffee rather than making a full pot. Attractive and easy to use. Options to choose strength of brew and volume of water are plusses

I‚Äôve had a K mini for years. I disliked having to use short cups underneath but along with having to fill it with water each time, I got used to it. I just hated that when it was a morning where I needed to brew and go, I had to either buy another insulated cup with a tapered lower half (to fit in my car‚Äôs cupholder) or brew in a mug and pour into one that‚Äôs travel-friendly.

Now, I just remove the drip tray and let it brew into my travel cup of choice and go!

So far so good. I‚Äôve only used it a couple of days. If I had a ding, it would be how strong of a plastic smell it had upon unboxing and that the part that holds the k-cup/reusable cup doesn‚Äôt tilt toward you for easy removal. Mine is on a k-cup drawer thing that sits on the counter under my cabinets. I can get the kcup out but it takes a second. No big deal AND I could scoot it out and open the lid fully if it truly was a bother. I just thought I‚Äôd mention that. It 100% would have plenty of room if it wasn‚Äôt sitting on top of the holder, so your results will totally vary.

Also, I love the little jingle it plays. üòÅ

review name: Confused about amount of Coffee to add to POD ????? It seems to leak when using your own coffee?
review text: I LOVE the Coffee Maker when using pre-made store bought PODS, However, when I add my own coffee to the coffee pod provided, it leaks all over the counter and there are grounds in my cup! Is there a certain amount of coffee or type you should not use in order for this NOT to happen ? Other than that it is small, easy to use.

Been using for a couple months now. It makes a HOT cup of coffee. Can fit an average Kcup or it comes with a small basket and top if you want to add grounds. Very sleek and doesn't take up much counter space.

What I wish was different- I have a travel mug that is 22 Oz. The machine only allows 3 cup size option to pick from. 8, 10 and 12oz, so i have to wait for the first brew to finish, and then select another cycle to fill. DO NOT fill the water reservoir other than the exact amount you want to fill for one cup. The maker will continue to run until the water is gone, flooding everywhere. As hot as it makes coffee, definitely don't want to have to clean that mess and risk a burn.

I like it, works for now, but I don't think I would purchase again due to the dislikes.

I very much like this coffee maker. The re-useable pod is great and easy to clean. The top of the pod is supposed to be a scoop, I think. I don't use it as one. I think it would be messy to use that way. We fill the pod up with a spoon, about 2/3rds the way full and that is perfect for the 12 Oz setting we use.
We like the different cup settings. There's an 8, 10 or 12 Oz setting. The settings are super easy to use. Just touch buttons on the top.
The water tank is very easy to fill and clean. It comes off super easy and goes back on just as easy.
The foot print of this coffee maker is perfect for a small kitchen like ours.
We have been using this for about 3 to 4 weeks, not every day, but regularly. We both really enjoy that there is no coffee pot to clean.
The price point was awesome as well. I love the color. It's a good buy!

review name: Works Great...But Not With All KCup Brands
review text:
This is a great coffee maker. I love the reservoir for the water, enough to hold about 2-3 cups. It allows you to brew ground coffee or use KCups. And the coffee tastes great.

HOWEVER, I learned the hard way that it does not work with all KCup brands. This is likely the fault of the KCup makers, not this product. I purchased a unit and found that while it worked some of the time, when it didn't work it was a disaster. It would spit out hot coffee and grounds from the lid, all over the floor or the person in front of it. I tried every diagnostic I could think of and finally concluded that it was ONLY having this problem with a particular brand of KCup. Everything else worked fine. The brand that didn't work for me was the Meijer store brand...I think it's called Frederik's. The Starbucks brand and other brands (like Aldi coffee) worked just fine. But whenever we'd use the Meijer store brand it was a horrible mess--even dangerous to anyone standing in front of the machine.

In case you wonder if it was the machine...I returned the first one we bought and had the same problem with the new one (which we are keeping). So I'm 99% sure it's the pods, as that is the only difference.

So...if you have this problem, try switching out the pods first. The coffee maker works great otherwise. But for some brands, it may have this problem.

Been using this every day, multiple times a day for three months now. Performs brilliantly. Haven't had any of the issues mentioned in the negative reviews. Brews fast, brews hot, and tastes leagues better than the old one. The large water reservoir is especially convenient. My only complaint is the grey one is a very light grey, almost white. It doesn't match my other grey and steel appliances like I hoped.

I love how easy it is to use and clean for 1time using it out of the box....

Had a different kind/ brand before . We have a insta pot and love using that, so saw this and price was great so i thought why not try it..

Wow it's great and slim and much quieter than I had before even across the room....

Can't wait to use it more soon...

Would be happy to try out all products and anything else and submit feed back ...
Great little coffee maker... perfect cup every time. Reccomend for sure.

review name: You are not limited to coffee pods
review text:
The refillable basket allows me to purchase any whole bean coffee, grind it, and make a great cup of coffee. The "Bold" button option on the unit allows me to find a coffee strength to my liking. I am no longer limited to the coffees in store bought pods. Of course this machine does a fine job with the standard pods as well.

Cleaning hard water deposits is fairly easy with vinegar or a descaler and removing stuck grounds from the holes in the upper puncture pin will also need to be done occasion.
I love this! 3 different cup sizes. Well made.

This little machine is awesome. A 100 times better than Kurieg 2. It‚Äôs quick ,it‚Äôs quiet, takes up a lot less counter space and it‚Äôs simple to use. the cup of coffee comes out very good. If I could tweak it I would say I would like the coffee a tiny bit hotter. Not a deal breaker. when first received you need to do a cleaning. I had a problem initially with it siphoning the water. I followed the directions push the 8 ounce button but at all the buttons would constantly blink, and no water would come down. I repeated this process about 10 times and eventually it began to siphon the water from the tank into the cup. Since then I have not had a problem it makes a great cup of coffee in very fast

I have had a few single serve coffee makers and none have worked as good as this one. It is quick and works great! I also like the sounds it makes signaling it is done, however you can mute this if you don‚Äôt like it. I would highly recommend. A great product for the price!
I replaced another coffee pot with this one. I am very pleased with the product. It is easy to use, heats quickly, and has a small footprint on the counter top. It is exactly what I need.
Coffee tastes too weak no matter how much coffee I use. I don‚Äôt know why!!

It seems that all these kind of makers only have 3 sizes of cups. I wish they had one more larger size. I use the smallest size twice to fill my cup. I do like this maker a lot, and I've had many of them.
My SOLO makes a great cup of coffee. It is so simple to use. You don‚Äôt have to wait long either while the coffee brews. So far my favorite coffee machine to date.

I bought this coffee machine during Christmas. I figured why not give it a try. It has been a wonderful purchase. If you drink a lot of coffee like me you won't be disappointed. It has been used A LOT and it's still going strong.

Makes a great cup of coffee, fast heating cycle. I would have given it five stars, but it does splatter a little bit. The brewed coffee stream coming down to the coffee cup is not 'smooth' like a Kerig or my Cuisinart at home. Not a big deal. This is my traveling hotel coffee maker. Very pleased, Reservoir is big enough for three cups. Very pleased
Works great for just a few people. Very simple and easy. Not fancy but very reliable.

review name: Great for pods but not so much for the loose coffee basket
review text: Pretty happy with it for pods. Tends to spit coffee and water out the top if you use the loose coffee basket. We generally use the 8oz with the "bold" setting for the coffee basket.
Nice coffee maker for the price. Small, compact, and brews well.

The machine itself works well, is easy to use, and makes a nice cup of coffee much faster than our old hamilton beach dual coffee maker. We are trying to cut back use on our Nespresso Virtuo machine, the best coffee period but at $1.25 per cup it‚Äôs beyond our budget. Where with this machine if we buy in bulk, we can get down to around $.29 cents/ cup, which is affordable.
We like the big water tank, ( that we are used to with our Nespresso machine, was a must have). We like the ability for different cup sizes, however if using a standard size cup the coffee stream has to fall too far and makes a huge mess of our counter with drops of coffee splashing as it comes out. The Nespresso and similar machines have an adjustable cup platform, that prevents the splashing. I read a couple reviews about the splashing, (blowing them off as kooks), but they are right, the machine is very messy, especially with granite counters that stain easily, (it‚Äôs no longer allowed in the kitchen, after I stained the granite, so I moved it to my workshop with white countertops, ( now also stained).
Kinda regretting buying it now, even though it works well and makes good coffee. It is no longer allowed in our house.
Update,,, I put a can of tuna fish under the cup when running the machine, and it works perfectly, (not staining my work bench any longer). But it‚Äôs still not allowed in the house or our motorhome. And now I have to spend several hundred dollars to get the granite polishers in to resurface the granite I ruined, ( if they can save the counter top ???).
Just should have been thought thru before bringing onto market in my opinion.

review name: Instant success with cup by cup brewing
review text:
This replaced a similar brewer that was bursting certain K cups and delivering too little water per brew of both K cups and ground coffee. That one was also hard to clean. This Solo brewer has brewed Twinings tea K cups, hot chocolate K cups, and coffee K cups, plus finely ground beans of two types, flawlessly. I brew everything on the bold setting. There is nothing left to clean that is not taken care of by an occasional brew without a beverage. The K cup holder comes out for deeper rinsing.

Other reviewers have mentioned trouble with "eco" type K cups, which have a filter instead of a plastic capsule, specifically ones by San Francisco Bay roasters. These are my stalwarts and work fine in this brewer.

I wanted a single serve coffee pot and I had been pricing the keurig because I waste so much coffee my Mr. Coffee. I came across the Insta pot and read the positive reviews. I had put it in my list and then when the price dropped by $20 I decided to get it. I‚Äôm so happy I did. It‚Äôs very easy to use, I love I can use k cups as well as the reusable k cup for your regular coffee. It even have the different ounces to choose 8, 10 or 12 oz. You can even choose the Bold setting. I was also happy that the coffee temperature wasn‚Äôt bad, with my Mr. Coffee I would need to put it in the microwave. I like my coffee hot and although I still warm my cup of coffee up with the Insta pot it‚Äôs not until it sits and gets like warm. It‚Äôs not extremely hot when it brews but for me it‚Äôs hot enough that I don‚Äôt immediately have to put it in the microwave. I‚Äôm happy with my purchase!

Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I LOVE this coffee maker. I just have a couple of ‚ÄúI wish it didn‚Äôt do that‚Äù issue. When the coffee is brewing into a short (8-10 oz) mug, the coffee splashes out and makes a little bit of a mess. I put a paper towel under the mug and extending out to catch the splashes. Definitely don‚Äôt overfill the reusable filter basket it comes with. If you so, you‚Äôll have another mess. Easy enough to deal with‚Ä¶just don‚Äôt overfill. I ended up getting a different reusable k-cup and paper filters. Easier to clean up and cleaner cup of coffee. Oh, and none of my 20 ounce stainless steel tumblers fit‚Ä¶too tall.

review name: Es un producto tiene buena apariencia
review text: Me gust√≥ mucho pero al mez empez√≥ a fallar y completamente ya no funciona
the part is oem ,i got for back up in case i broke my

review name: Ease of use, HOT cuppa and beautiful, trim features
review text: The makers of Instant Pot did not disappoint with this little workhorse single-brew coffee machine. It replaces a faithful Hamilton Beach single cup brew machine that I have had for quite awhile and replaced the same once before. This little machine delivers a HOT beverage with a K pod or fresh grounds in the K-cup included. I used the 'bold' feature on the first brew and it was exactly as expected. It has 3 size ounce brews (8, 10, 12) and heats/brews faster than expected. Yes, you should expect splash if you use a short mug, but I had no splash with a large mug and a 12 oz brew. I enjoyed the musical sounds but those can be disabled if you prefer. I appreciate the safety feature: an automatic off timer of 2 hours if you forget to turn it off after use. I love the slender footprint and the tank on the back that doesn't have to be filled each time. Easy clean & stores neatly on the coffee counter. Beautiful blue & stainless features. Great value for the price.
Quality and affordable. We‚Äôve had the Big name single serve, 3 of them. They are pricey and don‚Äôt last. We saw the high reviews on this product and so fare we love it.

I like the look and simplicity of this coffee maker but I have a few problems that seemed not so big at first but have begun to make me want to replace it less than a month into use.
1. When using the proprietary refillable/reusable filter there is often leakage off the handle of the filter from the opening to insert pods.
2. Ecopods do not fit in the k-cup slot (they are ever slightly to big, as if you could squeeze or force them in place which I rather not do)
3. It will start to brew a cup when there is not enough water in the reservoir (it gives a low water warning if it is empty but not if it has half a brew's worth of water)
4. While the design looks nice, it is actually difficult to get the water reservoir out of you have the coffee maker sitting at the back of your counters. I have found all three of us in my household have to pull it to the front of the counter to get to the water reservoir
I wanted to try a different brand of k-cup maker because my kuerigs seem to die after 2-2.5 years and I thought another brand might last longer. I will be returning to the kuerigs models because there functionality is seamless until the go kaput.

It‚Äôs such a cute little coffee machine very slim and fits on the counter without taking up a lot of space. If fits K cups very well and I just tried the included ground coffee scoop today and it worked perfectly! My previous employer had the larger version of this machine and I always liked the brew it made but this little one does even better especially with the bold function. I also use this to make hot water for my tea and it is perfect and very fast! I did use the hot chocolate K cups from Aldi and it warps the K cup from the heat of the water, just a little bit, but other than that I‚Äôve noticed zero issues with this machine in the month or so that I‚Äôve had it.

review name: Easy, Quick and Great Customer Service
review text: I have a small kitchen & needed a small-footprint coffee maker. I had originally purchased an instapot coffee maker for my office & thought to get another one for my kitchen. Now, I originally received a defective one & sought to get a refund. They ended up sending me a new one. Within two days I received a brand new, working coffee maker. I love this coffee maker, from the reusable pod, the multiple brewing sizes, the no-brainer functions, and the water getting hot enough for me. 5-stars for the customer service and sending me a replacement without delay.

I was a Bunn coffee maker person. Set up a coffee bar in my kitchen and needed a shorter stature coffeemaker. After much research decided on this coffee maker. I have found it easy to use. Once I found the correct amount of grounds to cup ratio it makes great tasting coffee. The only problem is where the measuring cup handle snaps into place water travels and leaks constantly while brewing. I have made sure the there are no grounds on the handle, all snapped into place without obstruction and clean. It still leaks. I put a towel in front of the cup to catch the leaking water. Kinda frustrating. If this didn‚Äôt happen I would rate this five stars.

review name: Instant Solo is the best single cup coffeemaker in town!
review text: I'm loving my Instant Solo coffeemaker. I bought it after months of dealing with the malfunctioning single cup Keurig I had to pour water into every time I wanted a cup of coffee. That Keurig looks primitive next to this Instant Solo. I was scared this machine would be too big but it fit perfectly on my small counter top. I like the cute design & option buttons. It even beeps when the coffee is finished. Love it!

Just invert a1 gallon jug and use till empty. Fits perfectly. No more manual refilling!!
FORM FOLLOWS FUNCTION.
KISS -- Keep It Simple Stupid.
Perfection is the enemy of good enough.
Oh the coffee is fast and good enough.
My daughter decided to try this brand and has been very pleased with its durability and functionality. Thank you Amazon for giving us other options and choices!
The machine works great. However the plastic water reservoir is made of very flimsy plastic. It is already showing signs of cracking 3 months in
I love the fact that it has a water reservoir.

review name: Changing my review to ONE STAR--would prefer ZERO stars!
review text:
I had previously had the competitor‚Äôs product‚Äîlet‚Äôs charitably call it the JFat coffee pod machine. Or rather, TWO of the competitor‚Äôs JFat machines. Both failed, almost to the day, at 4 months 2 days. The first machine was warranty replaced. The warranty replacement failed at‚Äîyou guessed it‚Äî4 months and 2 days. My JFat machine was replaced a THIRD time (in under 9 months) but I have zero faith now in that machine. In each case the unit was toast after doing the first descaling cycle. And apparently, going online, it is a very common failure. You shouldn‚Äôt have to pay close to $100 for a coffee maker that fails every 4 months!

So I took a chance and got this unit.

Update 3 months later: I revised my review to one star. Initially this unit was GREAT. But 2 months and 2 days later, it started freaking out--belching out steam from the lid, and the pump motor sounded like it was straining to climb Mt. Everest.

I had only used distilled water in this unit, and probably brewed 2-3 cups of coffee a day.

Amazon promptly replaced the unit, and I gave the warranty replacement unit a try. It lasted less than a month when it started acting weird--all the lights would start flashing at once, etc. I unplugged everything and it seemed to be okay. As a precaution, I tried to run the cleaning cycle, following the printed instructions EXACTLY. The automated cleaning cycle would NOT work. I wound up running a tank of the descaling/water solution through manually, one cup at a time. At this point the unit was under a month old! That seemed to help a tiny bit--but the next day the belching steam started, and the unit would stop brewing WAY to early--like 2 minutes to brew six ounces, when I had pressed 12 ounces.

Today, after taking 3+ minutes to get 6 ounces of coffee, I give up. TWO brand new units in three months. And this was after TWO K-Slim units going out exactly 4 months and 2 days of use.

I have whole house water softening to eliminate mineral impurities. For the last Keurig machine and both of these machines, I used pure distilled water ONLY. Still--they quit after an absurdly short period of time. I'm not brewing 25 cups of coffee a day. I'm not brewing only powdered drinks (i.e. cocoa or the espresso types) just plain old Keurig coffee cups. I clean the unit(s) regularly, and run through the little cleaning pods about every 10 days just to be sure. And ALL of them have crapped out.

I am giving the Keurig system one last chance--I'm buying one of the best units, a Cuisinart, that has better construction and a better pump system.

Keurig et.al, you need to get your acts together and engineer and construct MUCH better products and MUCH more robust pumps. Online searches show more and more people complaining--some from even 2 days ago, all saying "this unit only lasted 1 month" or "after 5 months it was toast" or "my old machine lasted 4 years, this one barely lasted a few months." You are biting the hand that feeds you, and eventually the buying public will shun your brewers and your entire Keurig system. You have created the Ford Pinto of coffee makers. FIX IT--NO EXCUSES!
Our top to this coffee maker does not match the cylinder color; Is that because the machine is gray and you want the top being more dull vs translucent . Just asking.

review name: Does not make consistant sized cups of coffee
review text: This coffee maker is attractive and makes a good cup of coffee but it does not make an eight ounce, 10 ounce or twelve ounce cup of coffee. no matter which button you push it gives you a random amount in your cup. sending back. Would not recommend
We bought this as a replacement for a Kureg and it has worked great! Just make sure that the water reservoir is on correctly or it will beep at you.

This is a pretty coffee maker, but coffee splatters everywhere. All over the coffee maker and all over the countertop.
Would not buy again.
Easy time use, quiet, and better tasting coffee.

I bought the ‚Äúused one‚Äú from the seller tradeport. And it came in perfect! I love this coffee maker. It‚Äôs so easy to use and makes a perfect cup of coffee. I bought the purple cups so I can load my own coffee to the strength that I want. So far this coffee maker is awesome. And thank you to the seller

Nothing to dislike about this product. It does what it was advertise and for a good price.
FP

review name: Functional Pod Machine to replace the broken Senseo machine
review text: This coffee maker worked well until a few days after the warranty expired. The manufacturer stood by their product and willingly replaced it. The new unit seems to be working as advertised. I'll update this review if the replacement fails.

review name: Omg you can use coffee grinds or pods and it come with its filter
review text: I have my coffee maker in my desk in my room I can make my coffee in my room anytime I have pods and grinds
Makes great coffee, gets very hot and is easy to use.
Exactly what I needed to keep counter space neat and tidy!

I dont know if it's a defect with mine only, but it does not make 8oz, 10oz and 12oz cups. When clicking the 12oz button, it filled a 16oz pint glass. So the options are actually 10oz, 12oz and 16oz. Did anyone else notice this? I just need to warn guests that if they click 12oz, their mug will over flow.

review name: Good coffee maker, but you have to sacrifice your choices
review text: My Bunn single serve coffee maker recently died after about 20 years. As they don't make them anymore, I went on a search. This coffee maker is good, but does not accept eco pods (k-cup style without the plastic cup), which was a problem as my favorite coffee is eco pod, and I refuse to use the plastic k-cups, for environmental reasons. OK, found my coffee in ground and whole bean. Whole bean is 1/2 the price of ground (?) so now I need a coffee grinder. The little grounds holder that comes with this machine works well (they say in the description that you can use it as a coffee scoop, but obviously that only works for the first cup since it will be wet for the second cup), and the coffee was great. I use a reusable pod for tea, to cut down of coffee transfer into the tea, but my reusable pod wouldn't work. I tried 3 different reusable pods, but apparently this machine will only work with it's own pod, which you can get separately for over $12, and there would be no way to tell which was for coffee and which for tea. I finally realized that I was dealing with a "proprietary equipment" situation, which I object to on principle. New coffee maker arrived yesterday, makes better coffee, uses my pods (which may be why it seems better), uses reusable pods, uses anything I want. My experience with the Instant Solo has made me realize that grinding my coffee is way less expensive, so I will continue doing that, but will still have the option to use my pods when I want to. This machine is going back.

TL:DR
Not bad , not ideal.

Cons
1. Outputs about 2oz more than pressed ie press 8 oz, output =~10oz ,10=12 etc Solution- Size up.

2. Splashes quite a bit. Solution -use a tall mug. Wait a few secs for the last drips.

3. Temp- outputs okayish hot drink but not hot-hot (vs Keurig)

4. Bold function: nothing to rave about.

5. Reservoir- very (easily breakable) light plastic.

Annoyance:

1. Red color is maroon /burgundy like. Very (VERY) dull, almost a flat shade. Satin or semi glosss would‚Äôve given a little pop.
Looks cheap.

Pros.
- Quick ( ~1 min for 8oz ) & Quiet.

- Small footprint.

- Opening mechanism easy & flexibly firm.

- MAJOR kudos on the reusable coffee pod included. Very little sediments on fine grinds.

- Almost cute/classy despite the color disappointment. ALMOST.

Zero wow factor you‚Äôd expect from the Instant Pot brand. None. Dont get got.

Disappointing. I was looking forward to the ‚ÄúBold‚Äù setting. I bought this for the Bold feature so my k-cups would be stronger. The 8oz with Bold option does not taste any stronger than the regular k-cup coffee maker I replaced with this. Money down the drain. I will say the coffee comes out hotter than my previous coffee maker.
Good product.

review name: Mostly good, but splashes a bit
review text: Makes great coffee and is nice looking. Got it for my parents and they need to use a ramequin to bring the mug a little closer (if you don‚Äôt it slashes a bit). If you use tall mugs / tumblers it probably won‚Äôt be an issue for you, but it would be cool if they made the little platform adjustable.

The stream of coffee splatters everywhere. It‚Äôs a long drop to the mug, a spacer from different sized mugs would be helpful. If there isn‚Äôt enough water in the reservoir to brew a cup the unit shuts down instead of waiting to add water, thus, wasting a pod. It brews nice, hot coffee but is so messy I am going to box it up and use it as an emergency only machine. Going back to my Keurig and Luke warm coffee. Before I could submit this review the unit stopped working, just 2 days past the return window. Go figure.

review name: would give 5 stars but was hoping to have a single serve for a 14oz travel mug
review text:
Thought it was a bit pricey for what it does...was hoping to accomodate a 14oz travel mug. And the coffee doesn't completely stop after beep, a few dribbles which not a big deal but it's in my office so will have to keep some napkins around.
But what I do like about it is the reservoir size and the maker is compact. Just got it so not had to clean except for dribbles in the tray.
It could use a filter as it leaves some sediment.

It is a good size compared to my offices Keurig machine but this makes the same coffee taste different. I don't know how to really understand it but the coffee from this machine tastes burnt, especially when using the "Bold" mode. I wouldn't think heating water would do that to the flavor of the coffee, but the exact same coffee cups in the Keurig just tastes better.

review name: Got this from my husband for Christmas gift
