review text: Have been trying so many products for K cups and none of them had good tasting cup of coffee and trying every trick that was recommended I had a Keurig and couldn't get it to taste right always tasted bitter and couldn't get the strength good tasting I had been looking for a single cup different sized pod and regular use of my coffee for about a year I love this one because of the red color is so pretty you can put extra water in but not an over abundance that it could get stale if sitting too long The different sizes I can choose our perfect it is easy to use the buttons on the top are really good quality it is not loud very quiet and it's the best tasting coffee I have had in a long time very happy with my Christmas gift and highly recommend it to everyone
I am enjoying the nice bold flavor of my Bustelo coffee. Nice, strong and fresh! This coffee maker is a keeper!

Time to replace my keurig and wanted a simple single serve machine that handled ground coffee. When I first came across the Instant Solo, I was excited, since it looked be the perfect replacement. While very new, early reviews on Amazon were terrific. After receiving the Instant Solo, the first thing I found was that 8 ounces is really 10, 10 ounces is really 12, and 12 ounces is 14+. Since there were no reviews stating this, I assumed that I had a defective product and returned, choosing to replace the unit and try again. Since then I have seen one review stating the cup size difference. I have now received my replacement and sure enough, for whatever reason, the cup sizes are understated. I decided to move on with using the machine and have been very pleaded with the overall performance, and especially with coffee taste, which after allowing for appropriate water, found it to be less bitter than my Keurig and overall a better cup of coffee. The only other thing I would point out for ground coffee users is that some of the third party "reusable cups" do not work in this machine. I have been using Solofill cups with the Keurig and due to the hinge for the top, the Instant Solo will not close with these pods inserted. Not a big deal, time to buy some of the basic reusable cups anyway. Overall, a very good, basic single serve coffee maker.

review name: Recommend for busy (and lazy) coffee drinkers
review text:
Easy to use and clean. Makes a quick brew, and the 8/10/12 oz options are perfect choices for when I‚Äôm feeling like a different mug size of coffee.
I haven‚Äôt used keurig cups with this. I use it almost daily with my ground coffee and only need to wash the insert for the coffee (and my mug). Love that I don‚Äôt have to wash a whole coffee pot everyday to make fresh coffee for one!
No options for the sound volume - it‚Äôs either on, or it‚Äôs not; but it‚Äôs a pleasant sound, so it‚Äôs not a turn off.

review name: Quality is very good, makes a good cup of coffee.
review text: The design and build quality are both very good. Was impressed and surprised this comes from the people who make the Instant Pot. Comes with a reusable grounds basket which seems to be very efficient, have noticed basically no grounds. Coffee comes out very hot, hotter than a Keurig. Only gripes, which may not be avoided, is the splatter if you get the white, means the machine itself needs wiped down frequently. Also, the tank being on the back is difficult to access if you have it under a cabinet or something etc.

review name: Robust Hot Coffee Sleek, Intuitive Machine
review text: This unit replaced a Cuisinart SS-10 that ceased working in less than one year. The Instant Solo was a pleasant surprise. I did not expect to get such a good quality cup of coffee from this less expensive coffee maker. The Instant Solo is by far the best coffee maker I have ever used. It is simple to use, very slim profile and it accomplishes the task of making a good hot cup of coffee at a good speed. I have only used this machine a few days; but, so far it has been great. If this machine gives me more than a year service with the same quality, I will consider it a great purchase.

review name: Love the instant solo 2 in 1 coffee maker
review text: I‚Äôm loving my instant solo 2 in 1 coffee maker I had ordered in on Dec 13 and received it four day‚Äôs later. It‚Äôs a nice and small compact little coffee Maker. When i came across it on amazon i had to Check it out and when i saw the price i could not pass the offer up the offer and bought one in black. I have used it pretty much ever day since i have gotten it in the mail. I have made coffee in k cup form and in the reusable pod form and have not had any issues that i have read in the comments that people have had some issues with as of yet from owning the 2 in 1.

review name: Easy to use but drips and splatters
review text: I like how easy it is to use. I dislike it drips after removing the k cup and coffee splatters on my counter when filling the cup.

review name: Instant Solo Single Serve Coffee Maker
review text: I got tired of throwing good money out on the K machines. Trying the Instant brand. So far it is easier to add water and brew. It doesn‚Äôt like off brand coffee K-cups so much as the two times I‚Äôve used the off brand, I‚Äôve gotten a little overflow with grounds going into the coffee cup. Haven‚Äôt tried the loose coffee grounds yet, but hoping that is successful. Will update if any issues with the loose grounds.

We love the coffee from this machine. There is a ‚Äúbold‚Äù button which makes the coffee a bit hardier.

Highly recommend.
Easy to use!!

I mainly use this for hot chocolate and Maruchan instant lunches, and it does the job PERFECTLY. It nearly instantly starts pumping hot water the second you hit the button, and it finishes pretty quickly. The tank will last about 3 drinks worth (only about 35ish ounces of liquid) so you have to refill often if you use it frequently, but this product works so well I truly don‚Äôt mind at all. I highly recommend this if you like having your drinks done quickly!

review name: Both return service and product were AWESOME!
review text: Once I got the replacement, it is AWESOME! I have nothing but good to say about Amazon's return. It was quick and easy. I am sure happy with the product as well. It probably was damaged during shipping. But the replacement came and I absolutely adore this coffee maker! It is ssssoooo much faster than that, aaahhh, let's keep them nameless out of respect for K, oops, almost named them. Sssooo quick and ssssoooo easy! Love the design.
Fits keuring pods but not other pod makers, and that's my problem !! San Francisco coffee pods will not fit !!!

review name: Adequate but can‚Äôt go the distance
review text:
This coffee maker is relatively easy to use but after only 5 months of 1 cup of coffee each day it stopped working.
Not a great purchase‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

review name: Nice coffee maker but has issues
review text:
I really wanted to keep this coffee maker, but it had a couple issued that made me send it back.
Pros: It is small but holds a decent amount of water.
It made a good cup of coffee (hot and flavorful)
It was easy to use
It was fairly quiet
Cons: The water reservoir leaked when you remove it and fill it
All of the cups are off, 8oz was 9.5oz, 10oz was 11.5oz and 12 was 13.5oz.
If it had not leaked I would have disregarded the oz's being off, but I don't want to clean up water on the floor every time I fill it.

I love this thing. Its so easy to use. Coffee is always piping HOT! Hated using my regular coffee maker and alot of times making too much, So then there was waisted coffee. It's a good purchase. We'll worth it.

So, I used this two days now, four 12oz cups. I'm impressed how comparable to the keurig it is. Water container can be removed easily, easy button uses and cleaning. 2 main concerns. 1st, it makes 2oz more. So 8oz, 10oz & 12oz are actually 10 oz, 12oz & 14oz so be sure to use bigger cups. (It don't bother me but some maybe). 2nd is taste, it does taste a little like some places coffee, which a little watery and/or light plastic taste. So, since I use the bold taste. I press lightly on the coffee grounds to compact it a little to add more. It dose make a little light mess when opening the top but i use a napkin to clean up no problem, but it help with the taste along with letting it sit a min after brewed. Other than that, it is very comparable to its competitor keurig, just cheaper.
UPDATE 1: I purchased K Cups to test out. Some people have mentioned that their tops won't close. Mine on the other, is closing fully, it does take some pressure because you have to puncture both top and bottom. If it holds up for some time, I'll definitely update my rating again.

review name: Quality and good design: great value
review text:
After 3 cheap single-serving coffee makers, I was thinking about an upgrade. Amazon had a great deal for the Instant Solo. We have an Instant Pot for years, and is quality. The Instant Solo is superb, especially for the price. Well engineered and designed. The only thing I COULD comment on is the reusable basket. It is somewhat small - but, I always make my coffee way stronger than most. So, I use the 8oz setting only for the reusable basket. I will try to review again in 6-7 months, for the longevity of the Instant Solo.

I‚Äôm a fan!
Love the color, size and the machine overall but it takes a long time to make a cup of coffee. It doesn‚Äôt seem to heat up like my Keurig did. Wouldn‚Äôt repurchase.

I bought this Instant Solo brand because I love my Instant Pot. I like everything about it except for the fact that it is messy. The brewing process is also messy as the flow is such that it splashes outside the mug. (It's not because the mug is too small, I'm brewing a 10 oz. cup and the cup is bigger than that.) It does not stop dripping after the chime indicates the brewing is finished. It continues dripping for about five seconds after.
This is a great little coffee maker!

I purchased this coffee to replace my kuerig. While the price was better and it brews super fast - I‚Äôve had nothing but issues. It spits and splashes coffee everywhere. I ALWAYS end up with grounds in my cup. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend.
All I expected
This is a nice looking product, easy to keep clean. It needs to have some kind of an adjuster so that you can use various sized cups.

review name: Ounces for Brew Options are off
review text: If you select 8ozs., it will brew 10ozs. It is off by 2 ozs. so you will always get 2 more ozs. for whatever you select. Total Bummer, since I like 8ozs. as the amount I want brewed. Makes the coffee tast weak, even when using the Bold Button.
Solid build, easy to use, huge water revisor and ‚Äúbold‚Äù flavor mode. The best out there.
Love the compactness of this and the fact that you can clean the removable water receptacle. On the old coffee maker it was internal and couldn't be cleaned. Also trust the brand.
It does sprinkles coffee around a lil. Like the look & a good buy.

Bought this for my friend for Christmas. He rants and raves about it all the time. He had a super old tiny one like they have in hotels that took forever to brew. Now he pops in the K cup and he's ready to walk out the door. He loves it. Im waiting on it to go back in sale so I can buy myself one

review name: I like it better than my Keurig Mini!
review text: I've had 2 Keurig Mini's - I gave one to my daughter, and needed a downstairs replacement. I love my Instapot, so I decided to give this coffee maker by the same brand a try. I'm delighted by the little design touches - it's got a solid feel to it, rounded corners for a smoother touch experience, and the small handle on the K-cup replacement is genius! For less than the price of a Keurig Mini, I have the same counter silhouette, with a larger water reservoir, and more settings. Coffee is hot and fast - faster than my Keurig. Overall, a definite win.

I needed/wanted a new single-serve coffee maker... I previously had that popular "K" brand and figured I'd just stick them for the convenience, but I stumbled upon a lightening deal for this and jumped on it. FINALLY, a full cup of coffee (or a true 12oz)! My K-brand had a 15oz option and still would only fill my 15oz mug maybe halfway.
I bought the white, it's super sleek and compact. You can actually notice the difference when brewing in "bold" mode. Easy to fill, easy to clean, and easy to use. I typically drink just 1 coffee in the am and have to refill every 3 days (w/ 12oz brew). I haven't tried the reusable pod it comes with yet, but that's just an added bonus here.
Never again will I buy or recommend another coffee maker! If you're hesitant on the cost, get over it and just buy the thing, you absolutely will not regret it.
Easy to use and doesn't require a large space. Coffee comes out great every time. Great purchase

I love that it's a clean, modern design, easy to use and makes a hot, flavorful cup of coffee in 90 seconds. The carafe is easy to fill and clean. The reusable filter is pretty easy to refill. It does splatter a bit (see photo) and I think the needle on the lid that inserts into the filter when closed is a little finicky; instead of making a second cup of coffee and I was getting a series of 3 beeps. I think it was telling me something was wrong because when I opened and re-closed the lid it went back to working. It's a chalky white which matches my china mugs but will be a little off with pure white (see photo with white coffee cannister). I'm pretty sure this was a gift from God and I love it!

review name: One of the best single serve coffee maker I've ever used
review text: If you're looking for a coffee maker that isn't one of those traditional ones, this is the one to get. You can use this with your K-cups as well as your own coffee grind since it comes with its own reusable coffee pod container. There are also 3 different sizes you can make. Cleaning the inside where the pod is can be some work since that area can have a buildup of coffee residue. One tip for using the reusable container for your coffee grind. Don't overfill it. If you do, you might cause the container to burst from the side or cause the side to swell up when you put the lid on. Just make sure to give yourself enough room on top to close the lid without force.

I actually love this coffee maker and think it's just about perfect, but I have one gripe that stops me from giving 5 stars. It came missing the little metal grill that your mug sits on. I went through every inch of packaging and it simply was not included with my unit. I'm going to contact the company through here and try to get it, and if they send one then I'll make this 5 stars. It's so nice it makes Keurig feel knock-offy. Except the missing part, that feels like crap.

review name: Loved it at first; now, not so much
review text:
Absolutely loved this little coffee maker when I first got it (based on several YouTube reviews as well as the glowing reviews here at time of purchase). Have had about 6 months, and it's developed a problem with overflow/leaking in the pod area.

When start a pod brew (regardless of selecting bold or whichever size), it drips from several areas near the drip point. It seems like the pod chamber itself is overfilling with water and trying to escape however it can. Note that this happens regardless of if I'm using official Keurig pods or fill-your-own pods (with or without paper filters in them).

I've done all the general cleaning (including a white vinegar rinse) as well as removed elements of the pod area and detail cleaned. The problem persists.

Again, though; it was perfect at first. Clean & quick. I found that it made very hot coffee for my tastes. The reservoir could be a bit bigger but that would take away from its small footprint. I just wish it worked as well today as when I first purchased it.

Straightforward to use.
The good:
Takes about 90 seconds to brew a cup.
It makes a hot cup of coffee.
Had a decent sized water tank
The reusable pod is good quality and will last
It has a small footprint

The meh:
The coffee is not strong (even with the bold function enabled)
The coffee dispenses messily (wipe your counter down after each use
Eco-friendly pods don‚Äôt fit into it (I bought some of these pods and have to transfer the coffee to the reusable pod; messy and a bit of a pain)

Overall a keeper, though

review name: Much better than the last Keurig I had!
review text:
This unit replaces another Keurig I've had for our RV. Easy to use, easy to fill coffee grinds, easy to use with K-cups, and the cord is long wnough to reach an outlet further than a foot away, unlike the Keurig!

The only drawback is that this unit only has 8, 10 and 12 Oz. settings, wish it had a 6, 8 and 10 Oz setting, as that would allow a double brew at 12 , 14 and 16 oz also. Still, this unit works well, is extremely quiet and makes a much hotter cup of coffee than the other. It also works well with a 2200 watt Honda generator, using a max of 1450 watts to brew a 12oz cup.

Received the classy Solo single serve Coffee Maker today, via Amazon fast service! Easy to set up. Easy to clean, fun to use and coffee was deliciously hot. It fits nicely into the space we have on our countertop, even though it has a good-sized water reservoir.

Be careful of the reservoir when unpacking, so it won‚Äôt fall off of its perch.
Also, I added round sticky felt pads to the ‚Äúfeet‚Äù of this machine, so it will slide easily. They work great. The instruction booklet is amazingly clear and helpful. This little baby will make your morning coffee fun again!!

No negatives to report. Even Hubs is impressed.

I have only used the other big known pod coffee maker. But after my second machine died, and within two years of purchasing it, I thought I'd take a chance on this.

Wow!! It is just fabulous but very simple. No filters to deal with or special cleaning. You probably don't even have to use distilled water but I haven't read the instructions. It is very easy to set up. I think it even tastes better. The best part is I am doing my part on reducing my carbon footprint and not throwing away pods. It comes with a reusable pod. But I still have the option to use the other pods if I'd like.

It's got a cute little chime that goes off when the coffee is ready. You do have to keep enough water in it to brew or else it'll beep at you when it runs low. But you can also open the lid while you are brewing and pour more in, in case you forgot, which I do a lot. It doesn't hold as much water as my previous machines.

It's a keeper.

In the past I have been disappointed with various single serve coffee makers and the quality of the coffee was often bland.l, even when using my own coffee. However, I have been pleased with the richness of my own coffee in the included coffee pod. I also bought this brand because the Instant brand has great service. I dropped the water tank when I was unboxing the unit and it cracked. I reached out to them and they replaced it free if charge even though I told them it was my fault.

Just one other note. One reviewer or blogger mentioned overfilling the pod. I did that and a small amount of water dropped out the front of the unit along the handle of the pod. So I would recommend not doing that LOL.

Makes an ok cup of coffee. Cleaning is super easy. I don't really use the K-cups....but I use the built in spoon. One thing to remember is that there is a silicon ring inside. You better wash it right after brew. Over time it contract a smell of rancid coffee oils which will ruin the fragrance and flavor of your coffee. I am pretty sure you can replace it easily.
I would recommend a Cuisinart single cup (non-kup) model over this.

Ok. I have just had 2 keurig slim coffee makers die on me before even a year of use. Decided to move on. Searched and searched while drinking instant coffee and finally landed on this little guy. I prefer bold flavored coffee and this offers a bold option, but‚Ä¶.the regular is just as delicious! Makes a great cup of coffee. Perfect temp. My k-cups fit fine and it‚Äôs compact for my small kitchen. Now the real test‚Ä¶..will it last a year?

review name: Great, but dripping tray out of place
review text: I really like this coffee maker. I wish they spent more time on the design aspect. As others have mentioned, the circle on the drip tray isn't centered to where the bottom of the k-cup or grounds cup is. This makes any drippings hit the slotted tray instead and make a mess. Another thing is, for some reason this coffee maker makes a bit of a mess when brewing. Splash-back from the coffee hitting cups makes a mess as well.

was going to get a nice looking Keurig but, i happen to see this instant one too and well since i own pretty much everything else from Instant/Instant pots, i decided to get this one instead.. was a good choice, love its sleek style, love that all the pods i used worked in this one and it works flawlessly as making coffee and tea! there was no burnt smell and no off taste like i normally can taste with plastic coffee makers. This is easy to use, brewed out a nice clean tasting blackberry cobbler coffee from victor & allen which brewed strong so i was able to actually re-make 8oz of it again - so one pod made 16oz. Also made a nice salted caramel cocoa by barrie house, it was very much enjoyed by the hub and it makes great tea as well, i used higgins & burkes pods.. Very happy with this purchase, my Brim pour over coffee maker is surely going to be neglected for sure!!

review name: This is the very best coffee maker out there!!
review text: My wife just purchased an Instant Solo Coffee Maker for my birthday. I never thought that I could be so excited over a simple cup of coffee. The taste is out of this world! WOW! What a difference when compared to the Mr Coffee Maker! To all the coffee drinkers out there, you just have to give this a try. O man! Now, instead of reheating my coffee from the morning, I simply get a fresh cup of coffee everytime I want coffee. No more reheating coffee. The Instant Solo Coffee Maker is absolutely the best coffee maker out there and the water reservoir is removable so you can simply clean it. We utilized a small can to raise my cup up closer to the spout to eliminate the small splashing. Welcome to the new age of coffee drinkers. Thank you!! Thank you!!

This is my first negative review ever.
First let me give the pros: This coffee maker is actually fantastic. It beats my Keurig and it's extremely simple to use and clean. I love the design.
The negative part: The company's non-existent, borderline tragic customer support.
My story: After just couple of weeks using it, the coffee machine started making a loud sound when making coffee. I assumed it needed cleaning, and I followed the instructions to clean it thoroughly. It didn't make a difference. Every time it would turn on, with and without pods the sound would get louder and louder until we had to stop it. Instead of going through Amazon (my mistake) I contacted the company's customer service. The link given by Amazon takes you to a web page where you enter your claim. I provided an explanation, uploaded a video of the problems and pictures. I received an automated email the next day, with a case number. Then... 3 weeks passed with no answer. We couldn't use the coffee machine without waking up the neighbors from the noise, so I called their 800 number. They, apparently, had no record of the original claim I filed online (even after providing the case# and original email). So they opened another new ticket. SAME STORY. I received another automated email with a different case number, and another 2 weeks followed. Almost 1 1/2 into the ordeal, I decided to email their customer service for a 5th time (previous attempts were unanswered) and after writing that I was going to post my experience on social media, sure enough the next day I got an email response from someone in their support group. Nasty email, badly written, accusatory. Pretty much saying that I needed to upload everything AGAIN (for the 3rd time) and that probably I was using the coffee machine without water (laughable excuse). I did that, replied to the email once again with pictures and videos. No answer back whatsoever. By that time, the return window with Amazon was closed, so I couldn't return it. I ended up throwing that paper weight to the garbage and I followed up with one last email to the company expressing my frustration. Finally, after around 2 months of my initial contact I received an email from the same support person, telling me "he was sorry for the long time it took" but because "I had disposed of the coffee maker" they couldn't replace it anymore so they kindly gave me a 20% coupon for their website.
Seriously, this is the worst experience I have ever had with any company and it's really too bad, because the coffee machine is actually amazing and when it worked, it was hands down the best product in it's category I've seen.
Hope this helps someone out there.

This is way slower than our old Keurig. I can be a whole pot in our Bunn in the same amount of time. I greet color shows lots of coffee splash and drips. Wish I would have gotten black. Might just stick to our Bunn anyway. Kinda disappointed.

review name: Just What I Was Looking For
review text: I was looking for a coffee maker for one person that could be used with both K-cups and ground coffee. In the past, I've tried various ground coffee add-ons in my old B40 Keurig, but they never worked well. The coffee was too weak, even with some hacks, and they tended to leak grounds into the cup. But the Instant Pot Solo is the perfect answer. It is extremely well-designed. Both K-cups and the ground coffee holder fit in the machine without having to remove or add parts to switch between them. The ground coffee holder holds approximately 3 Tbsp of ground coffee, which is enough to make a strong cup of coffee, whether in the 8 oz, 10 oz, or 12 oz setting. The coffee ground holder has a soft and flexible plastic red lid which seals around the needle that supplies the water and also seals the coffee grounds in the holder, so there is no leakage of grounds even when the holder is filled to capacity. The coffee produced is hot. Flavor is enhanced by four nozzles in the needle that distribute the water thoroughly. Plus, the rate at which the water flows is noticeably slower than in my old K-cup machine, thus extracting more flavor. There is also a Bold button on the machine that enhances the flavor. I'm not sure how it works, but the result is good. If you are looking for a dual function, single person coffee maker, look no further.
Has option for stronger coffee

I like the taste of the coffee, the multiple sizes, the temp. It is slim and sleek looking. The refillable pod is great, with a little handle for emptying it after use. Honestly, this is such a well thought out machine. I am happy I bought it. Cannot speak to durability, but should issues rise, I will report back.

review name: I Love this coffee maker, this replaced my Keurig!
review text: I couldn‚Äôt get rid of my problematic Keurig coffee maker quick enough. The size of this Instantpot Solo coffee maker was great, I loved the red color. The most important part was ease of use and speed of coffee. I have a hot cup of coffee in about 3 mins. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with the simplicity. I have had great luck with Instant brand in the past and know they stand behind their products. You will not be disappointed with this coffee maker!!

Stopped working after 7 months. Update: I contacted the manufacturer and they paid to ship the broken one back and sent me a new one free of charge. Pretty much hassle free and they stood by their product.

First off, I own a few other ‚ÄúInstant‚Äù products. Typically they make a decent product. This coffee maker isn‚Äôt one of them. I don‚Äôt even know where to begin with the utter disappointment this coffee maker is. The owners manual recommends cleaning it first. That‚Äôs an understatement, as your first brewed cup of coffee will not only smell like plastic, it will taste like it too. There‚Äôs a few ways to mitigate this, like running a water / vinegar mix through the machine. After about a liter and a half of white vinegar (which is crazy for the amount which it took) the plastic taste and smell subsided a bit. I even used a fresh pod and let it sit in the machine for a few hours to absorb some of the odor. Now, let‚Äôs talk about actually brewing of coffee. This machine brews coffee in a sad, watered down state. Yes, even with the ‚Äúbold‚Äù setting the coffee comes out pretty watered down. When I bought this machine my whole intent was to use the K-pod screen cup so I could use my own coffee grounds. While the screen cup for the grounds works fine, the machine has no temperature controls for the water, (understandable for its cost). The problem with this is that it has a tendency to put the water out so hot that it burns the grounds. So your going to typically end up with watered down, burnt coffee. If your looking for a home brewing coffee machine I strongly advise against this one. This is more suited for a cheap office break room or waiting area for customers. In my opinion this coffee maker isn‚Äôt worth the price.

This is a nice simple Keurig-style machine. I bought it, though, primarily hoping the "bold" function would really get more flavor from the pods. Unfortunately, it doesn't add any noticeable difference. So, if you want a nice simple relatively small Keurig-style coffee maker but don't need particularly strong coffee, this is a good bet. For really strong coffee from a Keurig, you have to spend closer to $200 and even then, it won't be as strong as a good (but less expensive) percolator or French press.

My Kuerig Express completely quit working after 3 months. I turned it into an opportunity to give a different brand a chance, as I've used Kuerig solely for about 7 years now (4 units total).
I got the instant solo and like it much better. I'm no green nut, but less plastic cups in the trash when easily preventable still seems like a good thing. The one thing they both do equally well is splash over the cup when brewing. I took off a star for this. Other than that, the insta is only positives...
Better button placement (although i do wish it turned on when closing the lid like the Kuerig does)
Can use ground coffee and it actually tastes good (unlike Kuerig user-fillable cups which tastes like bad tea)
Very fast - they both are.
Round water tank so it's easier to fill from a jug.
Pleasant beep tone.

This coffee maker makes sense with removable water container and scoop like cup for grounds. Plus good hot coffee.
They got this one right!

We really prefer this coffee maker over the Keurig. We replaced our old Instant Pod with a Keurig Mini Plus, but ended up sending it back. We didn't like the taste of the Keurig coffee. We ended up buying another Instant Pod and couldn't be happier. It really is a great bargain. Also, the company has excellent customer service of you have any issues! Try it.

review name: Efficient and small footprint on counter
review text: Coffee is made in 70-80 seconds. It amazes me how cold water is turned into delish HOT coffee so quickly. Takes up little room on the counter. The larger capacity reservoir is a huge plus.
Exact pod that came with my Instant Solo Coffee Maker. Ordered it just to have an extra on hand.

Nice and compact but will still accommodate a 20oz cup. Brews excellent coffee. I like it has the bold button to really get a full flavor. Clean up was easy. Very quiet compared to other machines. Definitely worth it for a quick cup on the go. It heats up within seconds giving a cup of coffee within less than 4 minutes. Great size for limited space.

review name: Where is the protection plan I paid for and never received?
review text: I love this coffee machine. However, I purchased the protection plan for $10 more and never received it.

I have had several Keurigs over the years and the last one I bought was so noisy and took 7 minutes to produce a cup of coffe plus it did not allow me to use my reusable kcup. This coffee maker is so quiet you don‚Äôt hear it and gives you a cup of coffee in less than a minute. Came with a reusable kcup which I used this morning and it made the perfect cup of coffee and it was easy to clean.

review name: Works like it's supposed to; could use a few tweaks.
review text: This little coffee maker is attractive (I bought the red) and brews a decent cup of coffee fairly quickly. The temperature of the brewed cup is plenty hot enough for me. I got it because it uses ground coffee, not just pods. (Can't rate pods - I don't use them) However: The cup holder doesn't adjust, so if you're using a short cup, the liquid tends to splash a bit. I don't notice a difference in coffee flavor when pressing the "Bold" button. The ground coffee holder is a tad on the small side. Wish it had a 6 oz. option. Overall, I'm pleased with it's performance and would recommend it.

review name: Takes up very little room on the countertop
review text: I liked the looks of the product and it performed fairly well. I don‚Äôt know if it was any faster than a keurig, and sometimes when it was finished, it kept wanting to drip. I also had a problem where the alarm noise went off, and I kept sounding, and I actually had to unplug it to make it stop and nothing was wrong.

I‚Äôm pleasantly surprised so far. Machine came yesterday and is much nicer than I expected. Plays a cute tech-y noise. I got the white and I‚Äôm super happy it‚Äôs slightly off-white and blends with interior paint perfectly. Love the compact size and easy just-right sized reservoir. We both had 2 awesome cups of coffee this morning. I‚Äôm concerned other reviewers say it didn‚Äôt Last long so I‚Äôll post another review in 4 months and let you know how it‚Äôs doing. We make about 4-5 20oz cups a day. But so far, I love üíï it! uPDATE‚ÄîSo after 2 months it still works great. We love the simplicity and very temperature for our brew. It does tend to splash üí¶ on the machine so you have to wipe it off. Also, water left more than a few hours gets mildew-y so plastic is not ü¶† microbe resistant. You just have to remember to dump it out after your coffee is brewed. Overall I like it because it is much simpler than the keurig. No messy water filters ( water is filtered when we fill reservoir). Id love more colors, antimicrobial carafe, and a longer dispenser tube so it doesn‚Äôt splash so much. Thanks Instapot!

I bought the Instant Solo 2-in-1 Coffee Maker to replace the Keurig machine that I had for 10 years (which finally gave out). I had no reservations about buying another Keurig brand machine since my first one lasted 10 years with daily use. However, I'm on a budget and didn't want to spend $100+. After perusing Amazon to see what the options were, I ran across this machine which had many positive reviews. I ordered it and it arrived on time. I set it up in a matter of minutes. This machine has a small footprint which I like because it doesn't take up much counter space and it looks sleek. The machine is ready to brew as soon as you plug it in. It's very quiet - you don't hear the water heating up or the pump pushing the water. The machine beeps before brewing and when brewing is complete. The beep is very subtle and not annoying at all. Apparently you can disengage the beeps by pressing some buttons but I have not attempted that. Overall this machine seems well made and of good quality. You can brew one cup right after the other without an issue, so it would be fine for multiple coffee drinkers in the morning. Though it has only been a day, I'm very happy with my purchase and would buy this machine again.
It‚Äôs very good for the money. I like that you can either use a pod or your own coffee.

I thought I bought the red one and still am not sure if they don't sell a red one or if I keep getting sent the wrong one. Both times I got one marked Maroon. Maroon does not go with my kitchen colors. I decided to try it out before sending it back the second time just to make sure if was worth the effort for the third time. It seemed to make a pretty decent cup of coffee quickly which was nice and I didn't have an issues with it for the few days I tried it out. I think I will get it again but a black one instead since the blue one is way more than all the other ones. I like its compact size and how it's packed, very convenient to take with you if you are travelling.

review name: Acceptable product - needs a riser for shorter cups, not all K-cups fit
review text: Bought this for my office. I use it daily. The water reservoir holds several cups and does not leak. I dislike that there's no included riser for shorter cups as the coffee splashes on the unit and around it on the counter. I've also recently discovered that Cameron eco pods will not fit in the machine. I purchased a box of them and have to cut them open and dump the contents into the included refillable coffee dispenser included with the machine. I got the machine at a good price but I might not have purchased had I known about these issues beforehand.

I‚Äôve had a keurig -coffee was not hot enough - flavor weak. I went to French press which I enjoy but I got tired of making it. I found the Instant solo and I‚Äôm loving it ! Coffee made either with a pod or with diy pod and it‚Äôs hot and I can change to bold - I can change cup sizes so I‚Äôm happy I found the Solo!

This is a great product! Does everything it is supposed to do and does it very well. My ONLY complaint is that it splashes a good bit and drips for a few minutes after brewing a cup. Not really a problem because of the drip tray but I have to wipe it off before the next cup.

So happy to find this neat little coffee maker. It‚Äôs space saving yet does exactly what I need. I can use the coffee pods but I prefer using the reusable one it comes with. Coffee (or water for tea) is always hot and I can use my travel mug. My son can come over and make a quick, fresh bold cup for himself any time. Love this thing, a great buy.

I like the maroon color and it certainly saves space! It also has a decent water reservoir, so I don‚Äôt have to fill it each cup‚Ä¶ maybe every 4th or 5th cup. The way I use it, I‚Äôll need a small mat or cloth to move it back and forth. If you don‚Äôt need it to move, the base stays on the counter really well, which is what you‚Äôd expect it to do. Enjoy your coffee! ‚òïÔ∏è

When I opened the box it was used and very dirty.the machine had some white substance on the side and the cup drain had coffee all over it . The reservoir on the bottom of the drain was sticky and most.

I was searching high and low for a coffee machine that served very hot coffee and I've found it! It also churns out coffee so fast I'm amazed as my husband tellse the Keurig at work doesn't even do it that fast.

It's super easy to use and it's sleek with the touch buttons. I also love it comes with the k cup filter so you can make your own coffee. When I'm feeling less lazy I like to do this and grind my own beans for it.

The only downside was the plastic it's made from doesn't feel such high quality but it does make it light enough to slide around my counter. The drip tray also doesn't click solid so if I shift the machine via the drip tray it comes off.

I have had this coffee maker for quite some time and I love it! I don't have to use the pods. It comes with a basket into which you put your own ground coffee and it works flawlessly! It's a no waste (except for coffee grounds which you can put in your garden or ?) and no paper filters with which to hassle. I love the Instant Pot products!

review name: Ease of use and great taste
review text: Good Price and makes great coffee, tea and cups of hot water. The only drawback is the small water tank.

I had the pot for about a month, make about 30 cups of coffee, now when you put it on 10 oz you might get 6 oz and hot steam comes shooting out of the lid! I contacted customer service, they said take pic of lables on the bottom, take a video of the pot working, and send a copy of purchase! they they would walk me thru how to do it. But hell I can just barely use a cell phone, I was born way before cell phones came out. I have 2 instant pots and love them, but will look for another brand of coffee maker. Looked on net to see if other people had the same problem and they did, but no tricks worked for mine!

review name: Love the water reservoir in the back.
review text: Love the easy way to brew my favorite coffee. I have a coffee cup near me all the time. Strong coffee during the day decaf as night gets closer.
I love the reusable pod. Works quickly and quietly.
The product was great until using the 3rd month and the then the lights started going off and started smoking

I received this for Christmas and really liked the one cup/k-cup option. It is taking a little time to learn the amount of coffee to put in the pod‚Ä¶.but, I‚Äôve come into the kitchen to a puddle under it. The water tank appears to be leaking. I thought that maybe I hadn‚Äôt snapped it down completely when we opened it and washed it. Day 2, another puddle. I‚Äôm returning it but I‚Äôm not sure if I should try again or try another brand?

Had a single-serve Kuerig that stopped working after only a year. Glad I read the reviews on this one and couldn‚Äôt be happier. The compact style takes up very little space on the counter, the tank can hold several cups of water so I don‚Äôt have to refill it every time, the coffee is delicious and is dispensed quickly.
The only concern I have is that the coffee is so damn HOT even when I use extra creamer. What‚Äôs the use of a quickly dispensed coffee if I have to wait to drink it. I have burnt my tongue several times while scanning the User‚Äôs Manual to learn if there is a way to adjust the water temperature.
If anyone knows how to cool down the temperature, please post. I really like this machine, but can‚Äôt recommend 100%.

Great machine!
Looks good and works well.

Other reviews complaining about pods exploding should complain about the pods, not the machine.

Making coffee is pretty messy because the splash from the coffee gets on the sides of the machine. Also the drip tray never gets fully dry and easily comes unattached. The back water container has a loose top that can easily come off. The coffee flavor is great though and I love the selection of bold.

This product produces hotter coffee than its K competitor, small enough to fit anywhere around the kitchen. the included filter at no extra cost is amazing for your non K Cup coffees with out having to buy any extra attachments.

easy to use and clean.

The coffee maker is OK. I like to use my own ground so I have to pack the little holder Full to get a decent cup of coffee. Now it's broken after 7 months, the water will not go into the machine from the reservoir. I tried cleaning the machine but it just made a mess and I mamaged to break my favorite coffee cup at the same time. (Did I mention I had no coffee this morning?) Going to buy a cheap Mr Coffee machine, do they still make those?

The title says it all, it was a good product until today. This was given to me on Mother‚Äôs Day of this year 2022 and work beautifully until today. If you think seven months is worth the price of this coffee maker then great. I do expect a product to last years, not months. Like other reviews I‚Äôve seen here I put the k-pod and hit the button it dripped a couple seconds and then all the buttons started going off and beeping. I am very unhappy to say the least.

This makes my coffee quick and easy! There was no assembly involved. I had coffee within 10 minutes of opening the box! I love the reusable coffee pod. It keeps plastic from filling the landfills and I can adjust the amount of coffee I desire. Everything is digital push-button, no plastic tabs to fall off or get dirty. There is a detachable bottom shelf where you set your cup so if there are spills or overflows it keeps it from spilling all over your countertop, just slide it off and wipe it out. There are settings for 8,10 or 12 ounces. There is also an option for "bold" if you like your coffee a little stronger. It automatically shuts off after 2 hours so it would be perfect for a dorm room. I also love the deep red color! I would definitely recommend this coffee maker.
Love, love this product üòç. Better then my old kerig. Not noisy either like my old one. I have the blue & it's perfect ü•∞

review name: Finally a single serve that delivers flavor!
review text:
After my trustee Hamilton Beach single serve coffee maker died over a year ago I have been trying to find a new one that I thought would last. The reviews I was reading for Kuerigs sound like their quality has gone way downhill. I don‚Äôt need a $400 coffee maker but if I spend money on something I want it to work right and last more than a year!

I used up the cups I had to make 10-12 oz cups on the strong brew setting and they were fine. I like coffee strong with creamer. The best coffee I get is with the included grounds cup. I fill it halfway with Peets medium roast and set it for strong and it makes a great cup! I just dump the grounds and rinse it and it‚Äôs ready to go.
I‚Äôve had no water leaks, no spitting, no mess, and it‚Äôs not very loud. The reservoir holds plenty of water.

I‚Äôd definitely recommend and buy again.

Very easy to use! Don‚Äôt have to wait for the water to heat up! It takes regular k cups otherwise it came with its own filter my coffee tastes better than my old one! It‚Äôs quick at filling up the cup! And easy to set up! Nothing wrong with it at all! I love it!

review name: Makes a fast hot cup of Joe. Doesn't check water level for you
review text: You may or may not care about this missing feature, but I occasionally find myself making a partial cup because I forgot to check the water level and it ran out part way. It doesn't take up a lot of counter space compared to the Keurig that unalived itself recently, and it seems at least as fast at brewing. I'm afraid if you like your drink both very hot and with milk added, you're going to feel the need to pre warm that milk. This makes perfect drinking temp black coffee, imo. It is not scalding hot, and doesn't seem quite as hot as larger size competing models

Gets the job done efficiently, I can make everyone just the right amount without wasting coffee -- which was a huge problem before. This is also so easy to clean. Of course, it IS a coffeemaker and is prone to shoot out a few grinds at the initial start of a cup, but you can push the button to pause quickly if that annoys you, so you can rinse out your cup. Not that troublesome, really.

This little jewel is clearly a quality coffee maker. The coffee is nice and hot. I love the feature that you can use your own ground coffee if you choose. I‚Äôve done both and love the choice. It is very quickly to heat up and start brewing‚Ä¶what could I possible want‚Ä¶attractive on my counter, slim but still hold a reserve of water for a few cups. I like that since I like fresh water after a day or two at the most.

review name: Husband says brews a great,hot cup of coffee!
review text: I love the fact that this coffee maker is very slim and smaller. I dont have alot of counter space at all.This will push underneath the top cabinets and out of the way.Husband loves coffee maker because 1)it brews a very hot cup of coffee and 2)it's simple to figure out and use...Good purchase!

review name: Husband loves his new coffee pot!
review text: Bought this for my husband, and he loves it! This is because the coffee is consistently really hot. You can actually see the steam. The unit also a small footprint which is nice if you have limited counter space. He has had it now for about 9 months, and it still is working great.
One of the best I have bought in a long time

Ordered white but came with red. Don‚Äôt have the patience to return since I need it badly.

Aside from that it‚Äôs good.

As a long-time Keurig user, the final straw was the $200+ machine that lasted just over a year and a half before it started having issues. It was my fourth and likely last Keurig. Enter the Instant Pot Solo. This is a great little machine for one or two people. As an added plus, it doesn't spit coffee everywhere as it finishes the brew. So far, this is a great little machine that does the job! So easy to use, and it brews the 12 oz cup you ask for! I guess I had gotten to the point that I was making due, but that stopped with this machine. Highly recommended.

review name: it makes rich and bold coffee ! ( like i like it ) and the other kind too
review text:
i just went through two $200.00 "Keuregs" that i loved but they both lasted only 6 months almost to the day !
Before that i had three " my cafe" by " Bunn" over about a 12 year period they were the best coffee makers ever ! now they don't make them any more ? i love my instant pot pressure cooker so when i saw they were making a coffee maker i immediately bought one. today is the first time i have used it i am drinking the first cup as i write this review . It tastes like the "Chemex "pourover that i was using after my other units broke . that says a lot for this" Instant solo" because with the "Chemex"i had to grind the coffee boil the water and lovingly and patiently pour the water til the pot was filled to get this level of rich delicious coffee ! Once i unboxed the" instant solo" and plugged it in and filled with water i put in "Newmans Own" k cup and got this delicious coffee in about 1/4 of the time it took with the 'Chemex" and the coffee is just as perfect without all the prep and cleanup ! Now on with the test of time if the quality matches my other "Instant" products i will be a happy man !

This is by far the best k cup coffee maker I've ever used. It brews extremely fast, no warm up time and gurgling noises to get started. This blows every Keurig I've owned out of the water (had 3 keurigs over the years!). The machine itself is easy to clean and wipe up. The part I'll knock it for is the drip catcher.. that lip on the outer edge is extremely hard to see under. I didn't notice how nasty it was under there until I had it for 3 months and it was growing mold. Then getting a cleaning utensil all the way under and around is a whole other struggle. That could have a way better design, however the coffee maker itself is fantastic!

I love this gem!! I had my old k-cup coffeemaker for 10 years. It died and I found this. The reviews really helped. This Coffeemaker is very slim, Makes my coffee fast, super easy to use, and I love that it has the water container on the back. Great product!!
Very easy to use, easy to clean. Compact, quiet and very fast. Best of all it makes a great cup of coffee. I'm very happy with my purchase. :)

I have had this for over three months now and it is 100% better than any Keurig I have ever tried, and I have tried many. The reusable k-cup is superior to any others. I prefer to use my own coffee rather than pre-filled k-cups and I have never had any grounds in my cup as I did with Keurig. Coffee is never wasted anymore and a cup is ready within 2-3 minutes. I always use the "bold" setting, 8 or 10 ounces, and it comes out perfectly. I am thrilled with this purchase and highly recommend it. I'm eventually going to order a second one to put away "just in case". I never want to be without it. Worth every penny you spend and then some.

I have found my new love in coffee makers! I have gone through so many Keurig, the last a total lemon. The Instant Solo is exactly what it is. Instant and much hotter. Brews the complete 12ozs. Small footprint, my new gift to family and friends. Once you go Instant Solo you will never go back!

I am blown away at how this coffee maker can make such a rich tasting cup of coffee from one K-pod. - whether the setting is for 8oz, 10oz or 12oz- the richness of the flavor does not dimmish!!!!! Easily, the BEST coffee maker I have EVER invested in!!!!

review name: LUV IT! Live alone and this is perfect for me!
review text:
Quickly makes the coffee (one minute) with mccaffe premium roast it‚Äôs DELICIOUS. And it holds at least 4 cups worth of water, so I don‚Äôt have to refill each cup! I live alone and this one‚Äôs perfect for me.
I luv it. No need for a fancier one. This does the job!
The fact I could get it in red to match her kitchen. I loved that she didn't have to refill the reservoir after each cup!!!!
Nice coffee maker. Brews relatively fast. Nice and hot, better then my keurig did!! Very impressed with this coffee maker. The price was more than fair.
Like it's very good

I bought this to replace a Keurig mini that I had been gifted a year and a half earlier. That Keurig had problems within the warranty period and was replaced; unfortunately, the replacement started acting up. Bad news: it was just out of the warranty.; Good news: it was Prime Day! I surveyed the offerings and found this unit by InstaPot. I love, love, love it! It fits in my appliance garage like my Keurig did, but I don‚Äôt have to pull it the whole way out to pour water into the unit each time I use it, as there is a removable 40 oz. reservoir. I can brew a little bolder if I desire, and have the option of 8, 10, or 12 oz. servings. Very easy to use; makes delicious and perfectly hot coffee.

My son-in-law accidentally dropped my 4 year old Keurig when we were unpacking for a Christmas trip to the mountains. So I needed a replacement and decided to try this. I‚Äôm so pleased! It has a great design, it‚Äôs quite and super easy to use. I love the bold flavor feature and how I can also use my own grounds. Works perfectly.

Just rec and we got this for our 52nd anniversary! He drinks coffee and I don‚Äôt! We can both use this! I like tea and cocoa. Perfect size! Looks nice and operates easily! I‚Äôm have 3 sizes of IP pressure cooker and love them. They didn‚Äôt disappoint with the coffee pot!.

This thing looks cool and makes a decent cup of coffee, but as with most plastic things, you can tell it was designed on a screen...likely by a NON-COFFEE drinker! The round tank is hard to hold on to and unless you have lots of counter space, hard to get back in place without a lot of fiddling. The drip tray is RIDICULOUS and you can't even clean it out nor wipe around it without knocking it to the floor. Look at it wrong and it bounces across the kitchen, spraying the coffee you can't get out all of the counter's and your feet. It's impossible to clean properly and after about a month, I'm pretty disgusted with it. It makes a halfway decent cup of coffee, but I bought it to replace the one that kept getting grounds in my cup. Guess what? I'm still getting grounds in my cup.

review name: Works great for my needs.BBut lousy packageing.
review text: So far it works great, I understand it was used and that was ok but it was shipped lose in a box and was missing the reuseable cup that was listed as icluded.

When my old Keurig died I was looking for a smaller version. I came upon this Instasolo, , saw the reviews and even though the videos showed that there was an after drip, that didn‚Äôt seem to bother anyone. I regret this purchase. Unless your only using it for coffee k cups I found the amount dispensed is inaccurate. I Use it for k cup hot cocoa and it dispenses 10 ounces instead. Same with any other type of Kup that isn‚Äôt coffee.
Also even using a 12 oz cup it splashes all over the machine. The after drip is awful!
Unfortunately I waited too long, and the time to return this coffee pot to Amazon had passed. I contacted the manufacturer, and I have to say they were willing to work with me. After sending them the serial number and model number and a video of the pot dispensing the incorrect amount, they would send me a new one. However, I have decided not to do that. Even if the amount dispensed is correct with the new pot they send me, it will still splash, and as noted in previous reviews it will drip after. Looks like I‚Äôll have to eat this one and order from a brand that I know doesn‚Äôt have these issues.

I had nothing but trouble with my new Keurig and was looking for an alternative. This coffee maker is great. It uses non plastic coffee cups like those of Chock Full of Nuts. The Keurig won‚Äôt. I don‚Äôt have to deal with a deglaze light that will never go off. Just thrilled with my purchase.

We had been searching for a "k-cup" style coffee maker for a while now. We decided to purchase this one and see how it went -- boy are we glad we did! The product was so easy to use right out of the box and we love the touch screen style controls at the top. The bold setting is perfect and it brews a hot and delicious cup of coffee. We also love the reusable k-cup that came with it which will eliminate unnecessary waste. The only thing we would change is that there was a 6oz setting (you only get 8, 10, or 12). Overall its a great product and we would buy it again!

I haven‚Äôt received my item yet but I know it‚Äôs going to work with the Instant SOLO coffee machine. I‚Äôm glad they sell this proprietary item separately bc one reviewer (perhaps when the machine first came out) rated the machine poorly since they lost a part from the one that originally came with the machine and could no longer use their own grounds. I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs bc they didn‚Äôt know where to shop or what but glad it‚Äôs here and that I have a backup just in case something happens to the original (and to swap out if I don‚Äôt clean one out right away or have another person staying over and want their own). The way things are going nowadays who knows how long this product will be in stock/available. *shrug*.

I will update my review if this item doesn‚Äôt perform up to snuff in a real coffee making test. :-)
This coffee maker works better than any k-cup maker I‚Äôve ever owned. I love it!!

review name: Broken pods for the Insta pot
review text: It came with a pod for using it with his coffee maker so far I‚Äôm on the third coffee maker with broken parts. Very hard to make another reusable pod work. I can buy the pods but that gets expensive I like putting my own coffee in it.

review name: Exactly what I was looking for.
review text: I'm very happy with this coffee maker. I had a Mr. Coffee single serve coffee maker for 15 years. I was looking for another one, but I found this one instead. I love it. It works so much better than a Keurig. I hope it lasts a long time.

I replaced a bulky old single cup coffee maker from the brand that starts with a k. I picked instant pot because I have some other products and have been happy with all of them. The thing I like best about this came as a surprise to me. It's their refillable cup that uses your own ground coffee. I've used other aftermarket refillable cups with my old coffee maker and I nearly always had coffee grounds end up in my cup.
The refillable cup instant pot includes with your coffee maker is foolproof. It's easy to fill and it snaps shut and pops into the coffee maker where it locks in place. No grounds get out and it's easy to dump out and clean.
Great at first then one day it stopped working. Only spits out hot water, no coffee. Only lasted 5 months.
Makes a cup of coffee in 90 seconds.

My 3rd keurig in 6 years quit working, so I decided to try something different. It delivered 2 days before it said it would, had it cleaned and hooked up in less than 5 minutes, made the first cup and was so happy with the flavor. Definitely recommend.

I am extremely pleased with my single serve coffee maker from Instant Pot. I have looking for a good and high rated coffee maker for some time now and had difficulty finding one that was both. Until this one. Enough five star ratings and a reputable company name. It‚Äôs easy to use and set up. Love the bold feature to kick the flavor of my k-cup up a notch. It makes a hot cup of whatever k-cup you choose. For me that‚Äôs a plus because I believe what is supposed to be hot should be hot. I cannot comment on the cleaning feature because I haven‚Äôt had it long enough to get to that point yet. I am so glad I found this coffee maker. I highly recommend it.

Using the loose coffee attachment, coffee travels down the top handle and spills out the front, leaving a little puddle.
Also, it is inconvenient that you cannot make less than 8 oz as this dilutes the coffee and makes it too weak

review name: Wait! It leaks water? An easy fix!
review text: I really wanted to love this coffee maker, but when I tested it with the coffee cup that comes with it - water kept dribbling out the front. BOO BUMMER! I reread the easy directions without a hint of why this was happening. But look - the red rubber gasket in the center of the metal wasn't seated properly & some of the center was out. It took a minute to carefully shove the entire rubber circle back into the metal hole. But be careful! You don't want to bend the metal trying. Long story - short - it worked & no more leaking!

review name: Best of the best but better
review text: Keurig fan no more. After 3-4 keurig machines in 2-3 years I took a chance on this one. Oh my gosh it‚Äôs better faster easier less expensive works great. Awesome tasting cup of coffee and I drink a lot of coffee. If your looking for single serve don‚Äôt hesitate. In my opinion this is the best.

Not big & takes up space!!
Ready to make coffee r hot water
No waiting!! GREAT COMPACT
MACHINE!! U WILL NT BE DISAPPOINTED!!
LID ON WATER MATCHES WATER!!
U THINK IT NEEDS WATER. U ADD Water..it goes all over counter. I put tape on LID so it does nt happen. Again

K-cup machines I've used before didn't seem to make a strong enough cup of coffee. I used to only do an 8 oz cup and now I can enjoy a 12 oz cup of coffee. The taste is stronger and more flavorful. I am very pleased with this product!
Its well design doesn‚Äôt take up a lot of space . The coffees taste great
It's sleek and slim. Brews a wonderful cup of coffee. Love the bold setting!

I got the red one and love the color. I like how it is packaged and the ease of making a cup of coffee. Having digital buttons to turn it on, choosing the 8 10 or 12 oz size, is nice. We travel a lot so having my own coffee maker in the room is very convenient, I like to have my coffee right when I wake up. I was so disappointed when I used this coffee maker for the first time on a trip we took, it worked great the first day but the second day when I tried to brew a cup it started to brew but after about 5 seconds it quit brewing and all the lights started flashing and there was a constant beep. Like I said I like to have my coffee right when I wake up so I was not happy!! I have returned this one, made a call to instant pot customer service, they said to return it and a new one is on the way. There is a 30 day return policy, I will give it a second try and hope the next one works.
UPDATE
Got the second coffee maker and right out of the box I tried to brew a cup, same exact thing happened, 5 seconds after pushing the button to start the brew, it stopped brewing, all the lights started flashing, and a constant beeping. Returned it the next day. Almost makes me wonder if Amazon get refurbished items.

I wanted to love this coffee maker. It looks great on the counter and is easy to use, but the coffee tasted horrible. I cleaned it according to the directions and made several cups - even performing a taste test with my old coffee maker, but it continued to taste‚Ä¶burnt? Like plastic? Bitter? Sadly, I am returning it.
Easy to use!

I was dubious whether this single server coffee maker was easy to use because the price was so reasonable but much to my surprise it worked just like the higher priced coffee maker. The coffee maker is used daily and still in good condition.

Paying $80 for the machine no problem, but to give one pod with machine is ridiculous ! I tried to buy more, it cost $12.99 a pod, while the generic one you could buy 12 for $10, so I feel that making the pod a special
to fit your machine s not cool ! I have a plenty of pods from my other machine but I cant use them !!!!

review name: Does not work with perfect pod reusable filter
review text: Do not like sediment in the bottom of my coffee cup. Watched Just A Dad video and he said that the paper filter works with the perfect pod reusable pod. IT DOES NOT. Still unsure if I will return or not since there are no compatible paper filters that will fit.

This is well worth the money & change of ways !! I‚Äôm die hard Bunn coffee pot , all my years ! I noticed I was throwing a lot of coffee grinds out everyday. And leftover coffee. This is perfect for me . Good cup of coffee, easy to use , less waste more counter space !!
I am so happy I purchased this. This takes up so little space in my small kitchen and brews in a jiffy. I love the bold setting giving me a delicious cup of coffee.
Love that there is no DRIP after the coffee is done brewing. Beautiful design and easy to use. Takes up less space too. Would DEFIINITELY RECOMMEND AND BUY AGAIN.

After wearing out several of the Keurig, I was looking for a coffee machine that wasn't as "delicate". So far, this puts out hot coffee, with little fuss. It holds my 20 oz tumbler when I pull the catch pan out, the controls are easy to see and use when you stumble bleary eyed into the kitchen for a cup.. the only complaint I might be able to have is the water tank could be bigger, and that the cup sizes are really more of a guess than anything.. If you are looking for a precise measurement, this won't help you.

I love this machine! Slim and fit neatly against the wall beside my full size coffee pot. Easy to refill water reservoir. Easy to clean. Comes with the basket for loose tea or coffees. Compatible with k-cups. Love it!

Fell in love with this machine. Originally purchased it to use up a large box of kcups someone gave me (did not want a keurig) but ended up using the full cup method after. This has now replaced my old Hamilton beach one cup. I like the bold settings, the chime at the end and the ability to clean the water reservoir. Overall a perfect little machine. I do like super strong coffee, so I have to use the 8oz and bold setting for the refillable filter

review name: Spend the extra $$ on a better brand
review text:
You'll probably save money in the long run and deal with much less aggravation. Although cute and high tech in appearance, it's not worth the plastic it's made from. The chime bells are unnecessary and annoying. The water is luke warm, at best. Bold setting does nothing to enhance flavor...nothing.
The main irritant is the mess it makes when brewing. Water, coffee drips everywhere. Countertop, walls, anything near by and all over the coffee maker itself. So spend 45 minutes wiping down everything while sipping the sub-par cup of coffee you just made.
Pass on this one and buy a quality, substantial coffee maker, not this toy.
Love this little machine. Wish it came with a replaceable water tank
Good strong coffee brewed fast.
Everything I expected

I like that this came with a pod that you can refill with your own coffee. That is great because I grind my own coffee beans and I think that the prepackaged pods are stale I really like this machine and I would recommend it.

review name: If you want strong coffee and to use your own, I would get old-school machine. Epic fail.
review text: I love the look of this machine, and I was super excited to try it with my own coffee with the reusable pod it comes with. I love strong coffee, and this one makes super weak coffee even with the ‚ÄúBOLD‚Äù option selected and smallest (8 oz) size. I am so disappointed. I tried changing the grind of my coffee to finer, and still weak and caused the machine to give up and all the buttons flashing. It also sputters a LOT and little drips of coffee go everywhere, unless you use a super tall like 20oz mug. Oh, and the first use, there was coffee running out the front to the machine. I am curious to try it with ‚ÄúDark Magic‚Äù K-Cups, as that was always my go-to coffee back years ago when I had a Keurig machine. The only way I will keep this maker is if the K-cup coffee turns out much better and I decide to forego using my own coffee anymore. I really thought with how it says it ‚Äúpre-infuses‚Äù the coffee and with the ‚ÄúBOLD‚Äù slower option on, it would make a decent strong cup, and it failed bigtime on that front. If you want a quiet and nice looking coffee maker, love weak coffee, and love to clean up the counter and the machine AND the reusable pod after every cup, this one is perfect for you!
Compact. Love the red. Easy fill. Easy clean. Quick make!
I love this lil keriug. But. How can I get another pod to go with it. There's just the one. Would be great to have a backup

review name: No it does not "break after a few months/weeks/moon phases"!
review text: YOU HAVE TO CLEAN THE NOZZLE FROM COFFEE occasionally or it will clog up and blow steam. Hard coffee grains will accumulate inside metal nozzle holes and dry up. The motor will not be able to apply enough pressure to clear the jam. I suggest you use your human ingenuity and a fork to clear the clog.
I replaced my keurig maker with this and I‚Äôm so happy I did. Set up is easy. Coffee taste great and looks so sophisticated on the countertop. Love it

review name: Makes the Perfect Cup Every Time
review text:
My Keurig broke down, so I started shopping for a replacement. I've run across this on Amazon. I was a bit skeptical going outside of the Keurig brand, but I've given this a chance based on the reviews. I love it. It makes a cup of coffee very quickly, and is quiet in the process. You can even select "Bold" to give your coffee extra flavor.

The only "con" is that the measurements are a little off. If you choose 12oz, it will give you 14oz........if you choose 15 oz, it will give you 17oz, etc. It's not a big deal for me, but keep that in mind when selecting which cup to use.
I got this coffee maker for Christmas and I love it. Love the reservoir, it is easy to use and it's from instant pot. I have two of their pressure cookers so I knew I would love this coffee maker.

review name: iNSTANT SOLO SINGLE SERVE COFFEE MAKER
review text: Doesn't get any better fast, smooth easy to use , quick cleanup thanks for suggesting this k cup coffeemaker told people about it and they ordered it also Awesomeness got two people to order
This works well, makes a good, quick cup of coffee, but coffee spatters on the shelf when brewing.

For somebody who doesn‚Äôt need to drink a whole pot of coffee, this is perfect. There‚Äôs the option of using K-Cups or being more budget minded and utilizing the reusable single serving basket. Clean up is simple.

This coffee maker is SO easy to use! I was looking everywhere for a good coffee maker that is not as expensive and small. THIS IS IT FOR YOU. Doesn't take up a lot of space, love the touchscreen, makes great coffee, and easy to clean. As of yet, I have not experienced a problem so it is working fantastic! I also saw some other coffee makers in which they require to be filled with water after EVERY use. Not in this case. My husband and I both use it every morning before work and it takes about 2-3 days to refill. Depending how much we use and how many ounces we choose. As my FIRST coffee maker EVER, I LOVE IT.

I drink low acid coffee that comes in K-cups. I needed a small coffee maker for travel. This little pot is perfect. Works great and has settings for different size coffees plus a bold setting for making a stronger cup.
I just love this really nice would buy another one.

review name: Makes excellent hot coffee, but broke after 25 days
review text:
Retired an old Keurig machine with this new little wonder. Compact size but holds 40oz of water so you don't have to fill every cup. Best difference over my old Keurig is that the coffee is hot, the Keurig was a real wimp in this category. Coffee seems stronger and more flavorful than the old, and it heats up and delivers the coffee fast. You can't go wrong with this choice.

UPDATE: AFTER 25 DAYS THIS MACHINE WENT KAPUT AND IS NOT LONGER WORKING. RETURNED FOR CREDIT PER THE MANUFACTURER.
It works good, easy to empty and clean. We use it for tea or coffee. Supposedly it creates a better brew than other baskets but I can't tell. Kind of high priced but well made.
I would prefer the water to be a bit hotter, but I like my coffee scalding. Other than that it's great.
great

review name: does not fit all coffee pods
review text: does not fit San Francisco bay coffee pods very disappointing. our favorite coffee.

I had to replace a single serve coffee make my mom bought for me about 5 years ago for 20.00 from Walmart. I've had this item for almost a month now and I really like it.. no issues.. the only thing I don't like is the bottom over flow disk I guess you would call it the cup sits on top of it.. I wish it wouldn't slide out so easily wish it wouldlock in.. I will up date the review at a later time since it has only been a month.

review name: Interchangeable from k-cups to your own coffee grounds
review text: Very easy to use and very easy cleaning maintenance

review name: Negative reviews don't make sense...It's great!
review text: This thing has been great...it's fast and really just a great little unit. I don't have issues with the reservoir lid, it does go on a little funky but doesn't create issues and doesn't fall in as some reviews say...it does not brew super hot coffee so if you want it scorching hot like some units this doesn't do that. Overall we are thinking about buying another for our guest room.

And first wasn‚Äôt sure since the first few cups had a lot of grounds! Once I figured out to push the pod down till it punctures then start the water it has been perfect! Not like my keurig which doesn‚Äôt give a consistent flavor
Great as good as the other k pot I love the price and it works great

Our Keurig finally have out after years of use. We opted to replace it with a Nespresso Vertuoso - makes a great cup of coffee, but it‚Äôs super glitchy, the pods are pricey and the refillable pod kits do NOT make a good cup of coffee. So, we decided to get another coffee maker - went with the Instant Pot coffee maker and it is GREAT!! Love the refillable coffee pod that comes with it. Also the size is nice; doesn‚Äôt take up a ton of counter space. My husband like the ‚Äúbold‚Äù brewing feature.
This is a very well made and easy to use 1 cup coffee maker! It would be great for a small apartment, dorm or for someone who only needs 1 cup of coffee at a time.

review name: If you overfill the Pod it starts to leak in the front.
review text: It's a pretty decent coffee maker, I do wish that a brood a bit slower like that the coffee could come out stronger it does have a bold feature but it's not that much of a difference from the standard, if you overfill the Pod it comes with it starts to leak in the front but I've noticed in the last week or two even if I didn't overfill it it's still leaked a bit in the front I just hope I don't run into any further problems I've been using it for a few months now.

review name: So far, changing my favorite morning ritual.
review text:
Had this about a month now. Wife is getting irritated because I keep buying "k-cup assortments," and have boxes full of strange flavors of coffee I normally wouldn't consider.

That said, it is fun, it has, so far, worked perfectly. 3d printed a little device to clean the cups so the Better Half can compost the grounds.

I default to using my favorite Chock full of nuts in the little basket. But now, I don't waste a half a pot, as did before. The coffee rivals when I do it in my Bunn, which has been my go-to for 30 years.
This coffee maker is narrrow and doesn't take up much counter space and that's the reason I bought it and it is a great coffee maker.

I picked this up about a month and a half back and we have been using it pretty heavy every day since. often making 1-6 cups every day between myself and my girlfriend. I am a big fan of the simple button format on the top (power, Size, Bold). It makes a quick cup with out much fuss and the detachable water reservoir makes filling the tank quick and easy. Well into a 100+ uses with this item and I am very happy with it. I can't say I can notice much of a difference between the bold setting engaged or just a normal brew cycle but it is a nice little option. I have had several brands of pod coffee makers and I can say the build quality and design is better than many more expensive models I have owned and the profile and slime taking up little counter space.
Good tasting coffee but only worked for 2 days

review name: Makes a great cup of coffee and a bit of a mess
review text: The maker brews a great cup of coffee quickly, but there is a lot of splashing. The reservoir is in the back so it could be difficult to fill, but we use a water bottle to fill it and it is super easy. Overall we are pleased with the quality of this product
It's easy to use, clean and fits perfectly on my desk. Any time I can make my own coffee and save money.
It is not only quiet but it heats the water very fast and makes a great cup of coffee I also like the lg water reservoir

review name: Perfect coffee maker for one (or one and company)
review text: It's just me and I have a kitchen with little counter space. This instant solo coffee pot is perfect for me. I can brew any coffee grounds I have or pop a k-cup in it. I've been experimenting with 8, 10 or 12 oz per k-cup or grounds in the included coffee pod. There is an option to brew a bold cup of coffee. I live over 5,000 ft elevation, so I set it for that prior to brewing. My coffee is brewed fast and delicious. I'm very pleased with this product.
I was looking for something to take up as little space as possible and this guy is perfect! Works every time. No leaks. No issues. I would buy this again.

Works as well as Keurig -- the bold setting makes stronger coffee than any of the three Keurig's I've owned. One warning, the smallest cup size one can make is supposed to be 8 ounces. On mine the 8 ounce setting outputs 9 to 10 ounces (depending on the cup). So it's not convenient if you plan to use it with a smallish cup.

review name: I like the Instant Pot brand, but the Instant Solo Single Server Coffee Maker is underwhelming.
review text: It's fine. That's all I can say. Click the "bold" button and it just adds a little bit of water to the ground coffee to make it believe that it's bolder before the hot water starts. It's not. I honestly like the Instant Pot brand, but this is just OK. I would not buy it again.
I like everything about my Instant Solo. Very easy to use a d clean.

review name: Compact machine NO warm up needed
review text: Perfect size machine that can make really good cup of coffee without a pre-heat cycle. I mostly use the resuable pod that comes with it for my favorite brand of Columbian style coffee. I find the resuable pod gives me the best tasting coffee using the 10 oz button. However you can try the 12 oz with the bold button more coffee but not the same quality taste. I only use half&half and stevia in my coffee. I've made iced coffee with the bold button and 10oz size over ice and half & half. That came out really good also. For those who go RVing this would be the perfect companion because of it's small size.

review name: Easy to use and make good coffee
review text: We had espresso machine and auto coffee machine before. But now we want a coffee machine that easy to use. Happy with this purchase.
