I've had it for a few days, love it so far! My first attempts at making a cup of my favorite Costa Rican Tarrazzu with the refillable basket resulted in a duller version of what I'm used to. Trying to pack more coffee into the basket didn't improve it and resulted in water leaking out of the top of the basket. Ground coffee swells when it absorbs water, forcing the top of the basket open which makes it leak. Make sure you leave about 1/4 inch of space at the top, no more leaks!

Boosting the flavor intensity requires a little more involvement in the brewing process. So, press "bold". With your cup in place press the 8 oz brew button. You'll hear it start brewing. When you hear the first drip of coffee hit your cup press the 8 oz button again (which cancels the brewing) Wait 10-20 seconds and press the 8 oz button
again, this time letting it run the full cycle. Now drink your better tasting coffee. Pre-wetting the grounds allows the coffee to "bloom", resulting in a better extraction.

I usually drink a 12 oz cup in the a.m. so I'll make 8 oz as above then refill the basket (or pop in another pod) and short cycle it for another 4 oz. Perfect!

It's not as complicated as it sounds, you're basically pushing the button 3 times instead of once. Hope this helps.

Oh yeah, love the look of the machine, love the small footprint and (now) loving the coffee!

Replaced an old keurig with this unit. I love a lot of things about it.Simple to use, easy cleaning, and because I like to use my own ground coffee, it comes with a dedicated k cup to be used for that purpose.Makes a decent cup of coffee. Works way faster then my old keurig as their is no warming up period. Interface is simple and appealing; you just turn it on and hit the quantity button and essentialy it will immediatly start producing coffee after 2 or 3 seconds.It takes up minimal counter space. One great feature is when I make a cup of coffee the end result quantity no matter which option I choose is never the exact fill I want for my cup. With this machine you can,say, choose 8 ozs and if you want just a little more you start it again and when you have what youwant in your cup hit the button again as it's running and it stops immediatley- it does not need to finish a full cycle. That is a really great option.Unfortunately, as many others have noted there is a frquent varying amount of leakage at the seal between the k-cupand the top part that flips down. It is not much, and it doesn't do it every time, but it has to be wiped up and it is annoying. This is a major design flaw that I would think could be easily addressed but because of everything else I like about the unit it's not a deal breaker as my experiance is there's some issue like this with all single cups units and for all the reasons given I'm willing to overlook it. So as with a lot of my reviews, it gets really good marks if it lasts for a reasnable amount of time which at the rate I drink coffee, would be like a couple of years.Like a few others I have an instapot made by the same company, and because of the build quality of that product was immediately interested in this one. That's the way things should work.

review name: Solo worked for 2 days and had problem brewing
review text: Brewer stop working

There was a minor issue of coffee splattering on the counter during the brewing process, however, we ended up with a major issue when it failed to brew correctly. It started making loud noises as if the water was under great pressure, steam started spewing out and the small amount of coffee it made was weak. We discarded the machine after trying to run a cup of hot water with the same noisy, steamy results.

review name: Works fine, a pain to keep clean
review text: I got this for my husband who is the only coffee drinker in the house. The size is perfect and it's so slim and lightweight it can fit anywhere without issue. It works exactly like a Keurig using the same pods or re-usable ones. Functions just fine. The water reservoir is not large but again, if it's for 1 person it's fine. Now, my only gripe is- I got the white version and it was a huge mistake. It is IMPOSSIBLE to keep it clean. Coffee splatters constantly and it gets extremely messy. And not just in a couple of places. It's all over and all over the countertop. It's grating and I would advise against the white version unless you don't mind constantly wiping it down. Other than that it's a great alternative to a Keurig but comparable price-point.
Super happy with this purchase! So glad I saved so much money with this purchase veruses what a Keurig would have cost!!! Especially since it performs better in my opinion.

Bought one for myself and then bought one for a gift. Just love it - tracked down an extra coffee pod for it at Target - Amazon is out of them at the moment (01/04/2023). Makes a hot, fast, great cup of coffee. Just the right size for a good cup, and a small footprint for my counter top. Love Instant products; I have the Instant Pot 6 qt, the Vortex Air Fryer, and now the Solo coffee maker. Even the fun sounds it makes when you start the maker and when it finishes put a smile on my face. Catch myself saying 'Thank You!' when it announces it is done. Silly? Yeah. Happy for a good cup, fast? For sure. Get one. Or Three. Your friends and family will thank you.

I love this single serve coffee maker. Easy to use, quieter than Keurig, better brewing with hotter water. I have had several Keurig for years but they never lasted long and never felt the water was hot enough. This machine is awesome!

review name: It splatters, you need to clean it after every use.
review text: I purchased it because it's small footprint, it holds more than a cup in the reservoir, and it had a bold flavor option. Coffee is hot and tastes good.

I like that it has a water reservoir and It is easy to use-just don‚Äôt put too much coffee in so that the top doesn‚Äôt close all the way or pack coffee into the pod tight (because it will drip all over the place.

review name: Simple and easy to use. Perfect
review text: WOW! Exactly what I wanted. Put in a k-pod, touch one button to turn it on, touch one button to start and 'voila' it starts making your coffee/tea and in less than a minute you have a hot cup of coffee/tea. It has a 40oz water reservoir that is very easy to remove and refill and replace. Plain and simple. No extra buttons, special features that you don't need and won't use. Those things only serve to drive up the price and make it seem more fancy than it really is. Bottom line... simple, easy to use, easy to clean and does exactly what you want it to do. I Love it and very highly recommend it. Part of Insta pot products. Great job Insta Pot!

review name: Excellent Home or Office Coffee Machine!
review text:
After my original Keurig machine broke this summer, I ordered the Solo from Instant to replace it and it's better in almost every way compared to my old machine.

I've read a few reviews about the machine ceasing to operate after only a few months, but mine has been going strong for 6-months without issue.

What I like:
‚Üí Smaller footprint than my old Keurig brewer, and the Solo looks better too!

‚Üí Water reservoir is easier to fill and fit back onto the machine than my old machine.

‚Üí Includes a reusable pod in the box! Just fill it with your favorite coffee and brew away!

‚Üí Fits tall cups and some travel cups.

‚Üí No RFID nonsense! Just put in any compatible pod (or the reusable pod) and brew!

What Should be Better:
‚Üí The brew temp isn't as high as my Keurig machine.

‚Üí My Solo is in white, and it looks great in my office but shows every splash of coffee immediately. I have to work on keeping this machine clean.

review name: It sprays coffee on the counter.
review text: It sprays coffee on the counter and when i use the separate coffee filter for my own coffee, the grinds end up in my coffee and i didn't fill it to the top. It's only been a few days and I'm not sure if I will be keeping it.

review name: Fast and doesn't take up much counter space
review text: Love that it has a water tank. Heats up quickly - much faster than the knockoff machine that I previously used lol. Only wish I didn't go for the white because you can see the coffee splatter from the times I use a shorter mug. But maybe that's good cause then I'm inspired to wipe it down more often.

while it was working it was great. had it 6 months and just got a small amount of coffee in cup one morning, sputtering and acting up and then water was all over counter from bottom. contacted company and they have not responded. $99 purchase for 6 months.....won't be purchasing another. very disappointed with customer no service.

review name: Compact, Quick-Brewing, But With Somewhat Problematic Reservoir
review text:
I like a lot about this Instant Solo Coffee maker. It doesn't take up much space on the counter, yet has a reservoir that can hold water for more than one cup. I can choose a slower brew time to make bold coffee, yet the turnaround time is still quick. And it includes a well-fitting reusuable basket so that I can use my own coffee grounds for a custom cup. The only thing I don't like is how the reservoir fits into the unit (more on that later.)

I've been using a Keurig for years when either my husband or I want a single cup of coffee. It works well when only one of us is home or when just one wants, say, a cup after dinner. Or when one wants caffeine and the other, decaf. This Instant Solo uses the same platform as the original Keurig. For the most simple usage, all you need to do is fill the reservoir with water, pop in a K-cup of any brand, and select the desired cup size. For a bolder cup, you simply press that button before selecting the cup size. The machine remembers "bold" only until it turns off, so that's a bit of a pain compared to my Keurig, but even the regular cycle tastes as it should.

A lot of people don't like K-cups because they seem like an overuse of plastic. Plus, it takes trial and error to find a K-cup brand and style that brews the type of coffee you like. That's where the reusable basket comes in. I love that Instant has included a basket that fits perfectly inside the machine. It has a handle that makes it easy to insert and lift out. All you need to do is fill the basket with grounds, close the lid, and put it in the machine.

As mentioned above, the reservoir can be a pain. Especially since it's located in the back of the machine, it should be easier to insert and remove without having to turn the unit around. If it's not properly seated, it knocks easily off the base, even when full. (I learned this the hard way the first time I used it.) Once it clicks in place, it stays. But the lid just sits on it and can easily be knocked off when you lift the reservoir to refill. Although I've learned to seat the reservoir until it clicks, I still frequently knock off the lid. I do like that the plastic reservoir is indented in the back so that I can grip it, but that means, yet again, that I have to turn the machine around to grasp it. Fortunately, the unit is compact and lightweight enough so that turning it around is not a problem, just an annoyance. A side indentation would make things much easier.

This Instant Solo doesn't offer anything fancy, not like upper-end Keurigs and those from other companies. I don't think it needs more bells and whistles, though. It does the job in a compact design. Most simple brewers don't offer three sizes of cups, and most don't include a basket for your own grounds. Instant includes the things that most users will want.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

review name: Do your research you will regret buying the solo
review text: After all the amazing reviews I pulled the trigger and bought the Instant pot solo single coffee brewer. It was a huge mistake. The machine will splash coffee all over the counter because of the design of the needle slow brew infusing slow brew. It trickles into the cup in droplets allowing liquid to splash out of any regular size coffee cup. Travel mugs are not a problem because of their tall height. Who wants to use a travel mug every day and not be able to brew a normal cup of coffee without having to wipe the counter after each use? Not me returning it right away.
I am Obsessed with these coffee maker. It‚Äôs so easy to use and clean. Perfect for one cup or 2. Couldn‚Äôt be happier

review name: Package damaged and spots on the item
review text: Packaged was damaged and also sealed cover was opened , I see water spots on the base and water tumbler , I did not tested the product, the review is all about product quality and delivery
Fast serve, easy to use & clean! Works great with k-cups or ground coffee.

review name: It makes coffee that tastes like hot squirt gun water. Horrible. Do Not Buy
review text:
If you love the taste of plastic, you'll love this coffee maker. You will never again have to worry about your coffee tasting good, or getting that pesky coffee flavor in your morning brew.

This coffee maker was so brilliantly bad, that after a full week of multiple daily brews, and a wife that was tired of me whining about how horrifically gross the 'coffee' tasted, she demanded I leave a review on Amazon. I don't like leaving negative reviews, but I am a public servant, and the public needs to be protected from this dangerous and disgusting conspiracy by Instant Pot to get into the 'coffee-brewer' game.

Buyer beware. You will regret every dollar you didn't spend on a Keurig.

As a matter of fact, the cheap coffee pots in hotel bathrooms make better coffee than this machine.

If you like the taste of hot water run through the soft cheap recycled Chinese plastic they typically use to make clown noses, then you'll love this machine. But if you like the taste of coffee, I'd advise chewing on discarded paper coffee filters from the trash before subjecting your soul to the morning torments of this counter-top torture contraption.

It's cheap and it makes gross coffee that is sure to disappoint you.

Fully discolure, I bought this model from Walmart, not Amazon. But I returned it and purchased a replacement Keurig on Amazon just now

review name: Pay attention to the water reservoir, but otherwise, this works great and coffee tastes good
review text:
I've had a Keurig coffee maker, so it's hard not to compare this to that. Overall, I really like this coffee maker and we've been using it daily now for almost 3 months with no issues. We have very limited counter space, so the fact that this takes up narrow space is perfect for us. It's very sleek looking. Since it's white though, we have to constantly clean it because when the coffee brews and pours into the cup, it tends to splash and leave marks all over the machine.

The one thing that I don't like about this, and it's probably not a huge issue for many but it is for me when I'm in a rush - this doesn't warn you when you don't have enough water to brew whatever desired oz cup you choose. The Keurig doesn't even let you start it if there isn't enough water. This one will start and once the water runs out, you have a 1/3 or 1/2 made cup of coffee and you have to basically fill it up and start over. It DOES beep when the water runs out, but in my opinion, it's too late at that point. So pay attention to your water reservoir and just keep it full if you drink coffee multiple times a day/every day.

The settings are great with the 8, 10, and 12oz options. The coffee turns out really good which IS something important to note. Some coffee makers simply don't make good coffee. Of course, the coffee itself is a huge factor, but some machines don't measure out quite right (that's one reason we switched to a Chemex several years ago).

Finally, the only pods that fit this are the K-cups. I've purchased other pods that say they are compatible, but they are not. The other nice plus is that it comes with a reusable pod, so we simply pour the contents of those pods into that. Problem solved. Overall, I really like this coffee maker and it gets a ton of use from my husband (who loves it).

this is a good Keurig alternative. the reservoir is large enough to make several cups before needing to be refilled. its simple to operate and makes a good cup of coffee. the included reusable grounds holder is better quality than some others I've used. my wife really likes the red color as well as how easy it is to use.

review name: One of the BEST K-Cup Single Makers for HOME and here's why....
review text: I'll tell you what, I don't know when exactly K-Cup coffee makers got so overly complicated but at some point they decided to put 50 options on something that should be 1. This restores sanity and simplicity to K-Cups. It's easy to use, easy to clean, and just does it's job correctly. And for those reasons I...am....in.
It stopped working. We‚Äôve only had it since July. We‚Äôve cleaned it, watched YouTube videos, still just spitting water.

We liked the promotional price and streamlined profile but the reusable filter cup drips coffee from the tip of the handle and makes a mess. The coffee also splatters and we‚Äôre always having to wipe down the appliances next to it. Coffee is not as hot as we‚Äôd like. But the price was good.

review name: Love it!! Way better than Keriug.
review text: The flavor is much more bold than in Keriug. I have no complaints so far.

It processes a cup quickly. Rinsing the reusable K cup is easy enough too. I tried a Keurig pod in it and it was fine. However, there are two things that I am not too happy with. I should have known that if it was narrow it had to be deeper than most things on my counter in order to hold the water container. It sticks out quite a bit beyond every other item on the counter. I can deal with that. But, the coffee holder has a little lid with a small metal tab that must be inserted into a slit in the lip of the holder and that is a bit daunting especially when I am just barely awake. I have to carefully place it, being sure it is mating, or the coffee maker top will not close. Maybe other makers have a similar challenge but I haven't owned one previously. I wanted this to be so easy and in many ways it is. So I will fill my coffee pod each evening to make it work for me. I just received a new coffee maker, a replacement unit from the manufacturer. The electronics gave out on my purchase after only 3 months of light use. The touch controls stopped working and started flashing. I had to document the issue with a video and contacted Solo several times but I did get a new one after several weeks of back and forth.

It's probably the best and simplest single coffee maker I've ever use. The only downside is that it slightly sputter when coffee is coming out. Might night be work out well if you're using small thin cups. I use slightly bigger mug and it's works or great for me.
Just quit working for no reason.

Hot coffee is at your fingertips. Love that there‚Äôs a Bold option. Had the K brand before and the coffee was never strong enough for me. This pot is a game changer. Purchased it because I‚Äôm an Instant fan and wasn‚Äôt disappointed.

review name: Great single cup coffee maker with a minor flaw
review text:
First of all, I love this single cup coffee brewer. It is exactly what I wanted and brews a great cup of coffee. I absolutely love that it comes with a reusable coffee pod that you can use to brew your own ground coffee. At the same time, it can brew any K-cups available on the market, so that you can make any variety of flavored coffee drinks, cappuccinos, hot chocolate, hot cocoa, teas, etc. The machine is very compact and takes a small amount of space in your kitchen while still having a good size water tank that is enough for at least 3 cups of coffee. I love the red color. It looks very stylish especially in combination with its sleek touch screen user interface.

While I love this machine so far, there is one minor flaw that I noticed: Unfortunately the machine does not recognize if the water tank is about to go empty and as result may suck air into the brewing unit which can then cause a big mess. It happened to me twice already. The machine will stop and beep and light will flash to tell you you ran out of water. But when you refill it with water and restart the brewing process, it will pump out that sucked in air and the coffee will splash everywhere. This issue could be easily solved by having a water level read and automatic shutoff below a certain water level.

Overall, I am in love with this single cup brewer due to its great coffee making abilities and variety of coffee drinks it can make. The machine is fairly pricey at $100 at the time of this review. However, you do get what you pay for and it is a great 2 in 1 single cup coffee maker.

To start, this is my first review ever. I strongly felt I needed to address this machine. I bought this because my wife and I like our morning coffee but don‚Äôt drink enough to warrant a bigger coffee maker. I like grinding my own coffee and she likes using pods. I liked the size and the versatility of it. This machine just isn‚Äôt very good though. If you use the supplied pod for your own ground coffee you have to be very accurate with the amount you put in otherwise the coffee will literally back up and start dripping out of the top of the machine. The supplied pod also doesn‚Äôt clean easily and started warping a little bit after a few uses. When using the store bought pods the machine doesn‚Äôt penetrate the foil top very well and will actually crush the pod a little bit and ends up making too big of a hole in the top and you‚Äôll end up with a bunch of grounds in your coffee. I would not recommend this product.
Had a hard time getting it to start brewing, but after threatening to return it? It shaped up, and started to brew.

I‚Äôve used Keurigs before and while I love the convenience, I didn‚Äôt love any of the baskets I tried for using your own coffee. All of them resulted in grounds in my coffee. This was on sale so I thought I would give it a try.

It is so much faster than the Keurigs I‚Äôve used. The included basket has a handle, making it so much easier to remove. More importantly (to me), I have no grounds in my coffee!
Ease of use and how quickly it heats and brews coffee.

The problems that seem to be inherent in this product are just to much trouble to bear. Mine experienced issues within a week of getting and using it. I tried to get some information from the company, but to no avail. All they said was things like ‚Äú oh you need to make sure it has water or that it‚Äôs plugged in‚Äù which did not address the issue or help in any manor. By using the cleaning feature I was finally able to get it working again after fiddling with it for a month. Now, it‚Äôs not working properly again after only 2 months of real use. Please, if you value your sanity, avoid this coffee machine and the absent customer service like the plague.

review name: Simple, straight forward, just works! Not a lot to ask, but doesn't always come by!
review text:
I have use multiple different K-cup machines, this "Instant Solo Single Serve Coffee Maker, From the Makers of Instant Pot, K-Cup Pod Compatible Coffee Brewer, Includes Reusable Coffee Pod, 8 to 12oz. Brew Sizes, 40oz. Water Reservoir, Black (Black)" is one of the better ones. It is simple to use, straight forward, and it just works. Plug in power, fill up the water reservoir, insert your favorite K-cup pod, pick your brew size, and wah-la, a great cup of coffee magically delivered! And the coffee that it brewed, is as good as it gets, for K(eurig)-cups.

This "Instant Solo Coffee Maker" also comes with a reusable coffee pod that you can fill with any grounded coffee, and the unique design of its reusable pod is just better than most that I had used before. This particular feature is going to save you a lot of money as you don't have to go for the single serve k-cup pods. The pod is intended to hold 2tbsp/12g of grounded coffee, so each lb of grounded coffee can make almost 40 pods/cups, that will cost much less than you going out and buy K-cup pods.

I also appreciate the 40oz water reservoir, it is a good size and will last me a few days rather than me needing to fill it up every day. I do use the "BOLD" feature, and this will increase the brewing time while allowing more flavor to be extracted from the coffee. Lastly, this is one of the few coffee maker that actually have an "altitude" mode (for use of this coffee maker at 5000+ ft above sea level) that would adjust the temperature of the water, to make sure your coffee is brewed at the optimal water temperature.

Currently this machine (the black version) is on sale for $78. This is quite a deal as that is probably cheaper than any Keurig-branded machine.

Thank you for reading this review, I hoped that this review & the pictures are helpful to you in support of your purchase decision.

Bought this to replace a Keurig coffee maker . This was the best decisson I could have made. The coffee maker is grest .It makes a cup of coffee much better, easier then the Keurig did. I love this machine.
I love everything about it. It's fast, easy to use, easy to clean. Thank you for making a great product! Disclaimer: I've only used it for a month.

Bought this to replace my single serve Keurig & I was so impressed, I won‚Äôt buy a Keurig again. The Instant Pot coffee maker looks sleek & brews delicious coffee very quickly. I like that it has a water reservoir unlike the single cup Keurig so I don‚Äôt have to fill each time. The 3 size selection is perfect when you need more coffee or you just want a small cup. Works great brewing cups of tea too. I have been using for 3 weeks now & no problems at all. I love this coffee maker!

review name: Loved it until it started to overheat
review text: So amazing slim design, the removeable refill water compartment, and fast prep are great. Totally loved reclaiming counter space but yesterday our coffee pods started to melt from heat and this morning when making coffee the machine started smoking and the metal tab to lift to place the pod inside was HOT. The machine shut itself off and I called Amazon to get it replaced. I was put on hold and given a refund. They refused to replace it. I am guessing it was because I bought it on prime day for $61/62 bucks and it costs more now. Or maybe there are more people who have defective machines and something needs to be fixed. Either scenario does not inspire me to get the same machine again so I will be switching to another brand because I'd rather have smoking hot coffee verses a smoking hot coffee machine. For the 2 months we had it, it worked great and totally loved it.

review name: Great for a single cup maker
review text: Let‚Äôs start with aesthetics: it‚Äôs slim and sleek and I love the bright red. As far as operation goes, it‚Äôs very easy to use and to clean. I love that it comes with its own DIY cup from the start so you never have to buy K cups if you do not want to, which I do not. As far as the cup of coffee it makes, it taste pretty good for a 1 cup coffee maker. I‚Äôve always found a full brew pot or an espresso to taste better than a one cup maker of any brand, and this one is no different in that, although I do think it tastes a little better than a Keurig and definitely better than the even smaller off brand I take camping. My favorite brew still tastes better in the full pot, but it tastes fine when I make it in this. I got this for the convenience and ability to make one cup of coffee at a time, and I have no regrets. I can make one cup of coffee the tastes good, and it doesn‚Äôt take up much space on my counter while looking pretty fabulous.

review name: Sleek minimal design, looks nice on the counter top, and makes a quick cup of coffee
review text:
This review is for the Instant Solo 2-in-1 Coffee Maker for Ground Coffee and K-Cup Pod Compatible. We go through a lot of coffee, as well as coffee makers, including the ‚ÄúK‚Äù brand. But we also using a combination of K-Cups, as well as coffee we grind ourselves and then brew in drip pots. We decided to give this combo maker a try to see how well it would work for us for both coffee types.

First, from a design perspective, I am really pleased with it‚Äôs trim design and how little space it actually takes up on a counter top, so that was a plus. From an operation perspective, it is very easy to use. There are simple touch buttons on the top for on/off, ‚Äúbold‚Äù, and then 3 different cup sizes. The one thing that we are still adjusting too are the touch buttons. They are sensitive, so when you just wipe the top to clean it a bit, it will come on easily. It‚Äôs no big deal, but a definite adjustment to the raised buttons you have to physically push.

Making coffee is simple. It pierces the K-cups easily, and brews a cup of coffee as you would expect.

For ground coffee, you just fill the included reusable K-cup pod with 2 TBSP of your coffee of choice, and brew the same way as a normal K-Cup. It does help to have one of the K-cup funnel scoops to make filling the reusable pod easy. The resulting coffee is not as good as the drip coffee method to me, but then again I have never really like the fine-mesh wire filters used with these types of reusable pods because they still allow some of the really fine grounds to get through, which changes the taste. More than likely I‚Äôm going to get some of the small paper filters to use as well to help with that part. I also think it is best to use the ‚Äúbold‚Äù button with the reusable pods to slow the water down a bit.

Overall it is a great machine, sleek minimal design, looks nice on the counter top, and makes a quick cup of coffee.

review name: I wish I could say it lasted....
review text:
I bought this in October 2022. I liked that it was slim and easy to use. Unfortunately just this week it stopped working. Even with the reservoir full there seems to be something happening internally that the water isn't coming out correctly and it burns up the pod making all the lights/buttons flash and beep on the machine.

I was hoping it would have lasted much longer.

review name: Craps out after just a few months
review text:
I saw reviews that said this thing will spit water everywhere and make loud odd noises and stop functioning properly and now I am experiencing the exact same thing after just a few months of owning this item.

Be careful when it stops working properly or you will get burned by the water and steam when it spurts it all over your counter!!
Love the choices for different ounces! Great feature.
It works just fine and brew's coffee but with a standard size coffee cup it splatter coffee all over you need a tall cup to minimize it

review name: Wow! A Fast Cup Of Coffee ‚òï
review text:
This Instant Solo has outperformed our Keurig, and Hamilton Beach Dual Brew from the start of powering on the unit to the point of a full cup pour. It lives up to its name and pretty much starts pouring very hot coffee as soon as you start your selected cycle. So far we're very impressed.

The footprint of this unit is smaller than I had imagined and will be great to take on our camping trips as well.

I also used the provided brew your own pod attachment which worked very well with our Starbucks Pike's Place vs the same in pod form, a robust cup of coffee indeed.

review name: Bye bye Keurig - Instantly in love
review text:
Having used a Keurig B40 Elite for nearly 10 years - it finally kicked the bucket and began leaking internally - I didn't know exactly what to expect with a new single-serve brewer. I'm a slow pour-over guy on the weekends, but for speed at work it's pods all the way.

It's early yet, so far I'm blown away by the Instant Solo. It's light, small, fast and quiet (after you turn off the darn button beeps - thank goodness they allow it). Plus, the coffee strength seems excellent. The 3 sizes are perfect - 12oz being the largest.

I just hope durability holds up. Stay tuned.

review name: Grounds float in coffee cup when using misc brand K-Pods
review text: All of the plastic k-pods I have used in the machine have resulted in coffee grounds in my cup. Not acceptable. If I use an eco pod then no grounds. Not sure what the issue is. Perhaps it is making a hole too big at the top or bottom? Not sure but this is not something I want to deal with every day. Have tried to put a paper filter around the K-pod to catch the grounds but that defeats the purpose of why I bought this machine. (Easy fast cup of coffee)

Update March 2023: I've had this coffee maker since last year July. So customer service is great! My replacement machine is great. The splashing isn't a big problem like my original machine. Best part is that the part where you put the kcups is an attachment so I can easily take it out to clean it. I didn't know that until just last week. I like this coffee maker and use it mon thru Fri at work. I personally only do 8oz coffee and started using the bold button. Coffee comes out extremely hot so be careful. I like how slim this machine is and it's ease of use. Again you don't have to only use kcups, it has a filter to use ground coffee as well. I clean my machine with wipes. I have not had any issues with my machine. I even just do hot water alone for ramen cup of soup. I haven't had any coffee grounds inside the water. I have a nespresso Vertuo Next at home and hands down this machine makes coffee hotter than my nespresso.

I had an issue with my original and contacted customer service directly with instant Pot company and they were great. They were very helpful and resolved my problem. The machine is very cute and not bulky. I like that it comes with its own coffee filter for ground coffee. My personal opinion the bold button works well but then again I'm not a big fan of bold coffee. I'm more of a splash coffee in my creamer or sugar cup. I like sweet coffee. I like this machine and it's very practical. Works and looks well in my office. Mine doesn't make a lot of noise when brewing the coffee and yes it does beep when you press buttons but I think there's a function to quiet that? I don't mind the noise it isn't annoying or loud to me. Mine does spill though and gets splatters of coffee on the machine and counter but hopefully my replacement won't have that problem. I've only had it for a week so I can't judge on a lot yet. But I'll update in the future.

review name: Would like to give more stars.
review text:
Bought this to replace an older much more expensive Keurig. For my office. Footprint is small. Water reservoir capacity is great for a small model like this. I like to use the coffee basket instead of pods. So basically I grind my own and load the basket. Coffee tastes great.
Negatives: would give it 5 stars except for 2 things. 1) The way the coffee pours into your cup causes a LOT of splash. It will make mess. I fixed this by putting an unopened can of tuna under my mug so it is closer to the dispenser which stopped the mess. 2) If you use the basket do not fill it above the screen. If you do the water will back up and overflow. It will run out inside the machine and out along the basket handle to the outside. Saw some pics in the reviews before I purchased that looked like might have been caused by this.

If it weren‚Äôt for the 2 issues I referred to it would be a great star.

review name: It stopped working after one month.
review text: Paid $60 for this thing at Best Buy at the end of December. Now the water siphon/pump just makes a grinding noise and won‚Äôt draw water from the reservoir. Piece of garbage.

review name: Garbage that won‚Äôt last a year!
review text: My brother has had a Kuerig for 10 years, works like magic. The new ones are GARBAGE, they are purposefully made to break in a year. I might make 2 cups a day and clean in regularly- didn‚Äôt make 8 months-Pathetic!
Worked mediocrely for a few months, now it just shoots steam out and incessantly beeps. Garbage. Not even worth the prime day sale price.

review name: Capable Compact Coffee Maker With One Problem
review text:
I was looking for a compact coffee maker for the RV. I wanted one that gave me the option of using both pod and ground coffee. I was very familiar with the Instant Pot brand, so I decided to try this one.

I‚Äôm pretty happy with this coffee maker. It has a very small footprint and takes up little counter space when it‚Äôs out. It‚Äôs quite tall which is both a good and bad thing‚Ä¶it‚Äôs good because you can fit a travel mug under it easily‚Ä¶it‚Äôs bad because it‚Äôs hard to find a cabinet in the camper tall enough to put it in.

I like the fact that the ‚Äòmock K-cup‚Äô they give you has a scoop built into it. It‚Äôs makes it a lot easier to use, and you don‚Äôt have to go searching for a coffee scoop to use it.

This coffee maker brews pretty quickly‚Ä¶not as fast though as a real Keurig machine. It takes about 90 seconds for my 10 ounce cup.

The one thing that I do not like about this coffee maker is that there are too many loose parts‚Ä¶and they don‚Äôt stay put. The drip tray just rests on the coffee makes and slides off every time you move it. And the water reservoir‚Ä¶when it‚Äôs empty‚Ä¶doesn‚Äôt really seat well in the machine and falls off too. And the water reservoir lid doesn‚Äôt sit down far enough in the tank to keep it in place.

But this coffee maker does make a decent cup of coffee. I like the look and size of it. I just wish it stayed together better.

I loved this machine because of it's smaller size, ease to use and how amazing the coffee brewed!
BUT!!!! Within 3 months it broke :(

review name: Delivers on Hot and Delicious Coffee, Can Use your Own Grounds!
review text:
This is a fantastic coffee maker! My daughter was looking for a single-serve coffee maker that she could use loose ground coffee, as she's environmentally conscious of the plastic pod waste, as well as being able to use the pods for my elderly mom who prefers that convenience method. The size was also an issue as counter space was limited. She also expressed to me that most single-serve machines that we've used in the past, fell short of delivering a hot cup of coffee, so we added temperature to our wanted features list.
Well, after researching so many coffee makers here on Amazon, and reading a plethora of reviews, I decided on this Instant Pot brand, and I'm so happy with my choice!
First, this maker is made with quality components. The plastic is solid and heavy. The size is also space-saving, yet it still has a nice size water reservoir where you don't need to be filling it back up with each use. The controls are conveniently displayed on top of the machine with smart buttons. You can choose between three cup sizes and also brew strength. And she loves the soft audible chime that alerts when the brew is complete.
The included coffee ground basket has a handle so scooping and placement into the machine couldn't be easier.
But the best by far is the temperature of the coffee and the speed of making it. She can finally add cold almond milk from the fridge and still have a hot cup of coffee. It also fits her tall tumbler so coffee on the go is easy.
I've been a big proponent of the more popular brand maker that starts with a "K" thinking it was the best in coffee makers, but, in my opinion, this Instant Pot 2-in-one coffee maker makes a better cup of coffee. I can enthusiastically recommend this coffee maker for its quality and the delicious coffee it makes.
I posted some photos to give you a closer look and hope that they, along with our experience, help you out a bit with your choice. Thank you!

Great coffee maker for shallow countertop area. We have used Keurig for years but it stopped working. I liked the sleek design of this one and it comes with its own pod that you can fill with grounds, which was a plus. It is much faster to heat up than the Keurig and it is overall more compact. Great find for the price!

review name: I really want to give it 5 stars...
review text: My girlfriend loves it, I love everything about it except.... The distance from the spout to bottom of the cup holder is too much so if you use the average cup or mug it'll splash everywhere ..

I use this single-serve coffee maker several times throughout the day. I love the fact that I can use my own freshly-ground coffee in the re-usable cup, or I can use standard k-cups.
It's easy to wipe down and clean, and the tank comes off so it can be washed.
There are three settings for cup size, and a button for BOLD (stronger) coffee.
I've had this coffee maker for months now, and I love it. But, if I had one suggestion for improvement, it would be this - I often forget to add water and run out in the middle of brewing a cup. The coffee maker will beep that it's out of water. So, I add more, but instead of being able to push a button to continue the brew and fill my cup, I have to start the brewing process over. If my cup is nearly full, then I have to get a second cup to catch the extra. Not a big deal, but a bit of an aggravation that I could solve if I would just remember to check the water level first. Or, if I could just push a button that would continue the brew. ;)

review name: Way better then any Kurig I‚Äôve owned.
review text: Makes a great cup of coffee, and fills the cup. Super easy to use as well.

I liked the color but there is an issue with water leaking. This was my second one.
Would not recommend.
Small footprint, refill every 2 days. Hot, good tasting coffee. I use Lavazza, bold. Only drawback; the grounds cup will not last long. Poor design. For the money, on prime day, worth it!

This coffee machine was alright. It was very easy to use, however the quality felt cheap. It was difficult and tedious to clean, lowering the user experience. I also found that the water tank stored little water, so I would have to very frequently add more. It does not take up to much space in my kitchen, so it is also a good portable option. I recommend this coffee cleaner to anyone who needs a good sip of coffee in the morning.

review name: Very nice and easy to use.
review text: Purchased for my bedroom when I stay at my daughter‚Äôs home. Nice addition for coffee or hot tea.

Worked well for about two weeks. Now it regularly (about every 5th cup, I'd say) experiences something with the symptoms of vapor lock and refuses to brew. Fixing it is usually easy -- remove the water canister and push the valve on the machine in and out a half dozen times -- but wouldn't you rather have a coffee maker than just works?
Easy to clean, super easy to make a good coffee

My hubby is a coffee nut so our older, basic Keurig got daily use. While it worked fine, we were looking to get a second one to place in our guest bedroom. When this popped up, I was immediately drawn to it for its water reservoir tank and the streamlined look. The touch button controls made this sleek little machine that much more appealing. We were not disappointed.

I love that it takes up little space, despite its water reservoir. It actually has a smaller footprint than our Keurig did, but that‚Äôs likely due to the age of the Keurig as newer models are probably slimmer. I love that it came with a reusable coffee filter for the times we want to use fresh ground beans rather than K-cups. While we have yet to use it, the quality of the reusable filter is excellent.

There is a ‚Äúbold‚Äù option that is supposed to allow for a slower brew which makes the cup of coffee stronger. I‚Äôve only used the ‚Äúbold‚Äù option so I‚Äôve not had the opportunity to compare it with the regular brew, but I can say that even using the ‚Äúbold‚Äù option, the coffee is ready lickity-split! It also tastes great.

The option for 8, 10 or 12 ounce is also a nice feature that was missing on our basic Keurig. Having a reservoir makes it so convenient to select which size you want without pre-measuring the water before each brew. The added bonus of the reservoir means you don‚Äôt need to have a close water source nearby, making it a great choice for rooms other than the kitchen or bathroom. I also appreciate that this little machine accommodates taller mugs and thermoses.

Cleanup is a breeze. Certainly much easier than our older Keurig. I do find that the grey color shows splatters and drips much easier, so a wipe down is necessary after each brew to maintain cleanliness. Speaking of drips and splatters, I‚Äôve found that removing the K-cup after brewing causes a few drips to trickle out. Keep your cup in place during removal of the K-cup and that problem is easily solved. Otherwise, you‚Äôll find yourself cleaning out the drip tray after each use.

I am so thrilled with this little single-serve coffeemaker. It has all the features I was looking for, and then some. I recommend!
Water drips from the lid as it's brewing. Only had it for a few months.

review name: Spews water out three front‚Äîbad burns twice now!
review text:
Every time I use the reusable filter basket this thing spews coffee out the front while brewing. It‚Äôs about 185 degrees or so as it comes out and has now given me a nasty burn on my leg through my pants today and on my hand/wrist previously. It almost seems like the basket is too tall for the machine. This is probably going to have to go back unless I can find some tips or tricks that aren‚Äôt in the instruction manual (yep, read it twice) to stop this. I just want the dang thing to work.

To add insult to injure I am getting lots of grounds in my coffee which is gross.

I bought this to be able to use the reusable filter basket not single use plastic!

I live my three instant pots so was excited to see this item. Now? Nah. Total dud POS except that the bold does make a nice tasting cup of coffee if, like me, you don‚Äôt care for coffee shop level of strong coffee.

Purchased as a birthday gift for my husband to take to his office. He has used a Keurig in the past and says this single brew coffee maker is by far better. The coffee is hotter, easy to use and brews a better tasting cup of coffee. That was all I wanted to hear, a great gift, well received.

Nice coffee maker, but not exactly the size I was hoping for. The size is comparable to a Nespresso, whereas I was looking for something smaller without this much depth. The width is great, but the length of the unit is a little bigger than I was hoping for. If the overall depth doesn‚Äôt matter to you, this is perfectly comparable to the size of other units‚ÄîI was just hoping for something a little more compact. The overall shape makes it great countertops. Just to be clear, it never claimed to be a compact unit, so no fault of the brewer, but it appeared to be a bit smaller than most, but it's actually comparable to others.

The controls on top are easy to use and I like the water reservoir which makes it convenient to brew compared to basic brewers where you have to fill water into the actual brewer and not in a separate water compartment like this one. The convenience of using K-Cups and ground coffee makes this very versatile. A very good brewer overall, but not the best if you‚Äôre looking for something ultra compact for tight spaces.

Pros: Works very well and I like the little chimes it plays.

Cons: If you drop the reservoir and it cracks, you‚Äôre out $70 because they do not offer replacements. If I would have known this from the start I would have bought the keurig slim, which does offer them.

I have the Solo Coffee Maker, which I enjoy using with my own grounds. I grind whole beans, then put them into this reusable coffee pod. The results are good and the whole process is simple. I just have a couple of minor complaints.

One, if you actually fill the pod with 12 grams of coffee, it will leak water onto your counter. I was trying to get all 12 ounces of grounds into the pod, so I'd get a stronger brew. Well, when I came back, water had basically ran from the lid of the pod to the handle and dripped out of the unit and onto my counter. Since then, I've made sure to leave a little room in the pod and haven't had a problem. Also, the filter does let some sludge in, so I wouldn't slam that last gulp of coffee. I'm personally experimenting with larger grounds to see if it'll keep the sludge down without altering the taste too much.

Aside from those minor issues, this is a great feature for the Solo and works much better than other reusable pods I've used, including Keurig's own reusable pod. I'm planning to purchase a second pod so I can easily make two cups of coffee in a row or just so I can still make a cup if I forgot to clean one. Actually, maybe I'll pick up a couple.

review name: Steamy hot cup of coffee in 90 seconds
review text:
I ordered the INSTANT POT Coffee Maker for my 81-year-old mom and hoped that this machine would satisfy my mom‚Äôs needs; who incessantly complained that the previous k-cup coffee machine I bought her, didn‚Äôt produce hot enough water. A bonus, however, was that the maker was red and matched my mom‚Äôs red and black kitchen d√©cor and other appliances; product‚Äôs description identified the color as maroon, but it appeared redder to my mom and me.

The INSTANT POT Coffee Maker was sleek in appearance and didn‚Äôt take up too much counter space. Mom really liked that she could remove the water reservoir to fill and was excited to get the companion reusable pod with handle, because she had never seen or used one before, and she‚Äôs accumulated a variety of ground coffee to brew. I also needed to find a coffee maker that was user-friendly and one that wasn‚Äôt embellished with a whole bunch of bells and whistles ‚Äì one less complicated to operate, and this coffee maker fit that bill.

The multiple brew sizes were also a big hit for mom, as she tends to drink her coffee so slowly that it gets cold. Mom, now, makes multiple small cups of coffee or tea throughout day, because the speed to which the coffee machine produced the coffee, was relatively fast, and she didn‚Äôt have to stand and wait around a lengthy amount of time in order to collect another cup. Moreover, mom was able to use one K-cup pod multiple times, because she‚Äôs brewing only 8 ounces at a time ‚Äì she claimed the additionally brewed cups produced were still robust in flavor.

The INSTANT POT machine really did brew a steamy hot cup of coffee in 90 seconds, and my mom found that out when she placed her finger under the group head to check whether the coffee was coming out hot or not ‚Äì and yes, the coffee singed her finger. Asked why she did that, mom said that, ‚Äúthe machine started so quickly,‚Äù that she ‚Äúdidn‚Äôt think that the water could possibly be hot in that short amount of time‚Äù ‚Äì lesson learned. All of the K-cup pods we already owned, were also compatible with the INSTANT POT coffee machine.

review name: Better than Keurig and perfect for your RV!
review text: We got this to use in our RV with limited counter space and this is just perfect in all respects. Most compact k brewers have tiny reservoirs this one is very large! Small footprint is great and also love the fact that there is no internal storage tank holding water even when empty so perfect for long term storage between camping trips. The brewer has a variety of settings and a bold feature that is noticeable compared to Keurig with no noticeable difference in brew strength. This comes with a pod to put your owns grounds and I have not yet tried that feature but like having that option if needed. This brewer does take a few seconds longer to brew compared to my keurig brewer, about 90 seconds it states but the trade off for all the other great features has the Keurig beat in my book. Nice variety of color options to choose too. An all around winner you can't go wrong. When my Keuring at home goes out I will be replacing it with another one of these.

I received this machine as a THIRD replacement to a malfunctioning dual maker. I was excited to try it even though the other two from Insta were defective.
All of the K-cup pods I used (different brands) resulted in coffee grounds EVERYWHERE! The needle in the bottom is too long and punctures the filter holding the coffee in the pod.
I will be avoiding Insta brands for coffee makers from now on.

review name: Only lasted for two and a half months.
review text: I bought this and loved it for as long as it lasted. But after only after 2 1/2 months it quit working. I guess I will have to give the Keurig a chance because I definitely buy this again
I like this product a lot. Easy to use. Looks sleek and modern. The hybrid functionality of either using ground coffee or K-cups is fantastic. Coffee tastes very good. Highly recommended.

review name: Finally: a single brew coffee maker my husband loves!
review text:
The Instant Solo coffee maker seems thoughtfully designed, well constructed, and has been reliable, as one might expect, for the week it has been used. You can use disposable K-cups, but while we have used them at work, banks, doctor's offices, and friends' houses, we're not fans. The empty K-pods which end up in landfills, limited choices of coffee, and price were all negative factors from our point of view. However, the grounds from the reusable pod of this device disappear easily into a compost collector, a window box, or even the trash (last resort), all without adding to plastic waste. Whatever coffee you choose can be purchased ground or ground from whole beans at home, and spooned into the sturdy, reusable, fine wire mesh pod to brew each fresh cup of coffee. Not doing the math for the cost of K-cups, we do know that our costs for my husband's coffee throughout the day did not go up or down after we got this, as he uses the same amount of coffee per cup as before.

Experimenting with the settings, he found that brewing a cup with the wire pod filled to about an eighth inch from the top (giving a little head room so that it is easy to close), selecting "Bold", 8 oz works best for him, but loves that different mugs and cups of all shapes and sizes fit. A finer or coarser grind of the coffee of your choice, different brew size, plus a choice of settings, all give you control over the results. So far, my husband has tried two brands, and two different grinds (he grinds the beans at home), and is looking forward to trying more, though he says he is not in a hurry, as he has been getting excellent results with the current selection. For the solitary coffee-drinker, which he is, as I'm allergic to the magical beans, we highly recommend this coffee maker. You get only one cup at a time, but it is absolutely fresh and there is no pot being kept warm and becoming undrinkable. Instant does not recommend this for tea, as this is a pour over method of coffee brewing, and tea leaves need to steep, which finally explains why the tea which came out of the bank's and doctors' offices K-cup brewers was essentially tasteless.

My husband also wants to point out that the controls are very easy to read, (lit circles around your selections!), and the soft end-of-brew-cycle beep is not likely to awaken a sleeping spouse or child, but can be turned on and off. Also a big plus is the high altitude mode, since we love to travel to and camp (obviously with amenities) in the high desert of New Mexico. This is slim, so a much better traveler than other single brew, K-cup type coffee makers we've encountered.

Thank you for reading our review. I hope you found it helpful.
Ignore the mess in my house. But this is from a bold brew. No creamer, full brew, and 8oz and it‚Äôs basically water.

review name: Convenient, easy to use, and makes a good cup of coffee
review text:
After a couple of weeks of use, I can say this is a pretty decent little machine. I like how slim it is and how little space it takes on the counter. It makes a good cup of coffee and I like the size options and the ability to brew strong. It heats up quickly.

Cons: the little filter that it comes with it bent a bit after a couple uses. It is still useable but doesn't lock in the way it is designed to do. It would also be nice if there was a water filter in the machine. Otherwise, love it.

Awesome little single-cup coffee maker. Though I would recommend one other thing to do when using it, if possible. And that is degassing the coffee. Which simply means pouring hot or boiling water (just a tablespoon worth) over the grounds that are in the reusable cup. Your coffee grounds naturally contain carbon dioxide. By pour hot or boiling water over your grounds, and waiting for thirty seconds, you've helped to remove the gas that can affect the flavor and extraction. So if possible, give it a try with the grounds you use if you're using the reusable cup.

review name: This ‚ÄúSolo‚Äù is a compact machine that does its job well.
review text:
Having lived with the Instant Pot ‚ÄúDuo Plus‚Äù pressure cooker for a few years now, I continue to be impressed with how exceptionally well it works and how, even I, can schlub my way through a recipe and make a great meal with it. So, given how pleased my family has been with our ‚ÄúInstant Pot‚Äù, this Solo coffee maker already had a leg up when we decided to get a K-cup machine. In short, this Solo is an easy to use, no fuss, high quality machine that does its job very well. My family has been using it regularly for a few weeks now and the following are a few standout impressions ‚Ä¶

* The Solo is a compact machine that doesn‚Äôt take up a huge amount of counter space. It is comparable in size to a simple, no frills, standard 8-10 cup coffee maker. Its water reservoir is easy to access, lift up and remove, and drop back in when filled. Fumbling around is not required;
* The inclusion of a reusable coffee pod is a welcome bonus. It is a proprietary housing with a combination cover+handle that securely snaps together and is dropped into a recessed slot to lock it in. Although the unit works well on the whole, on a few occasions I‚Äôve had fine coffee grounds pass through the pod‚Äôs wire mesh into my cup. So, keep in mind that the grind of the coffee you put in this pod will make a difference in what, if anything, you have left over in the bottom of your cup; and, lastly ‚Ä¶
* The Solo‚Äôs ‚ÄúBold‚Äù brew selection button can, and does, make a difference. Pressing this button slows down the brewing process to allow the heated water additional time to pass thru and interact with the ground coffee. My experience has been that its effect varies with the brand of coffee I‚Äôm using. Using this ‚ÄúBold‚Äù button can/will give the cup a boost that will be noticeable, and enjoyable, as long as you don‚Äôt expect an espresso strength brew to appear in your cup.

The takeaway: This Instant Solo coffee maker is a well made, K-cup ready, machine that comes with a reusable pod that allows you to use your favorite bagged coffee. It has an ergonomic, well thought out, design that does not take up a lot of counter space. It is made by the same folks who have been making the popular ‚ÄúInstant Pot‚Äù pressure cooker since 2010. And, this coffee maker will undoubtedly add to the company‚Äôs good reputation.
Smal, greatl for trailer space perfect for that, does take a bit of time for the water to run through to your coffee cup but I‚Äôm happy

This little coffee machine is definitely beyond expectations! I read several reviews and was intrigued. I did not want to buy a Keurig-type machine because of their, a) size- it's just me or perhaps a visitor, and b) I don't like the plastic waste and types of coffee that are commercially available in that style.

Prime Day arrived and this little gem was a very attractive option. Insta products are excellent quality, IMO.

What sealed the deal was the included refillable cup- I love my particular brand of coffee and the refillable cup that is included with the coffee maker is perfect for it. And the "Bold" feature that allows for a stronger brew is what the gods dreamed about.

It arrived very well packaged, I am a secret admirer of quality packaging. Not a scratch or bump, just perfect.

I rinsed everything (has a 40 oz water reservoir) and filled the cup with my favorite grounds. The resulting cup of coffee was excellent! Great flavor (no chemical or plastic taste ) and perfect strength.

So far I have used it 3 times and love it. Very convenient in the morning as I don't have to heat water and go through all the other steps for a good cup of coffee, not to mention the paper filter, the filter holder, etc...With this gem I only have to clean my coffee mug, the refillable grounds cup, and the spoon I use to stir.

I am very satisfied and will recommend to my friends and family.

review name: I really wanted to like this
review text: I am one person, so using this and having a single served coffee maker makes sense.. but this machine splatters coffee all over and leaks, so you have to be prepared to clean after every use. Definitely not loving this..

I've used keurig coffee makers for years and I've honestly never really been impressed by them, I just used them for convenience. I really didn't have high expectations for this Instant coffee maker, I figured it would be pretty much the same as a keurig. I like this machine a lot better. It has a slim design so it doesn't take up as much counter space. It's just as deep as my old one but not as bulky. It comes with a pod that you can fill with your own coffee grounds and it works great, I'm really happy about that. I bought one for my keurig and it didn't work, I just ended up with grounds everywhere. It can also use the regular k cups. I tried it with both and I was impressed with the coffee. It's hotter than my old one and the bold option gives a stronger, more flavorful cup. I like that this machine has a simpler design where the pods go. On my old machine, the lid opens and the part where the pod goes raises up. If you aren't careful about how you set the pod in and close the lid, you can end up with a mess. On this machine, the lid opens and the part where the pod goes stays in place, just drop it in and shut it, there's no way to mess it up. It has a digital screen to choose your cup size and the bold option. I was surprised at how quickly this machine heats up compared to my old one, it starts brewing the coffee right away as soon as it's turned on. It really is instant. The dripping does take a bit longer than my old one, but maybe that's why the coffee seems to taste better. It beeps when the coffee is done unlike my old one. The water reservoir is easier to clean and fill. I'm really surprised that this machine is better than the popular original brand, you would think that since all keurig sells is these pod coffee makers that their's would be the best. I'm excited to see what else Instant comes up with.

This coffee maker is the worst! It stopped working after 4 months of having it. The last time I used it, it took forever to brew half a cup and started smoking a lot. Also the water tank was built up with calcium as the water filter sucks too (fresh water was used every cycle) overall not worth it, save your money and buy a great kureig!!

review name: nifty and perfect for small space use, first one did not work out of the box!
review text:
product review: Instant Solo 2-in-1 Coffee Maker, 40oz. Water Reservoir, Charcoal

Instant became popular with it's design and features, especially with Instant-pot popularity. Definitely I see styling and design that reflect the product. This Solo 2 in 1 coffee maker looks nifty with it's color combination. The top lid is touch sensitive glossy black that is LED lit which opens and close smoothly with a soft click. Reusable coffee pod is unique as well with a handle design for easy scoop off the ground coffee. In terms of brew quality, it got standard as well as 'bold' brew function, that basically brew at a higher temperature for a strong brew.

Now coming to the reliability and product quality, unfortunately, this will score lower. We had to get a replacement due to faulty unit that did not work out of the box. It would flash and does not brew in spite following all care that is required. The advantage here is the support, they are located in USA and respond quick, super convenient to work with. Our replacement unit works fine so far. I hope Instant will improve quality check to avoid such issues.
Better than ever expected!

review name: Instant solo single server coffee maker
review text: Excellent! I purchased this during the Prime Days and got a pretty good deal on it. I wasn‚Äôt sure if I‚Äôd really like it or if it was as convenient as it seemed, but we have used it several times now and it it a good little machine. Plus it has helped me to save some money since not going to the coffee shop every day. I would buy again or for a gift.

review name: Every bit as good as a kruerig
review text:
I‚Äôve never purchased a pod
Coffee maker that wasn‚Äôt a kruerig.

I‚Äôm very happy with the flavor and the amount of water the reservoir holds.

I‚Äôd buy this again for my kids.

This is a single-serve drip coffee machine. Drip coffee as in regular coffee - there is nothing unique or special about the "K" cup fad that so many of these after-market "K" coffee machine manufacturers are piggybacking onto to sell some units. A small, single-serve sized container of 'some' coffee grounds is penetrated by a (very!) small needle which dribbles hot water over the grounds. Basically like what your grandparents' Mr. Coffee does but scaled down 90%.

As you've probably guessed from my wording so far, I'm not super enamored with this machine - especially for $100 (yes, we bought it pre-sale....sigh). However, it's taken me a while to figure out WHY I'm not super enamored with it - because the coffees I made myself from it last weekend were - quite frankly - a violation against nature.

So last night, we broke out the kitchen scales, disassembled a bad K-cup (never drunk one, never will) and weighed the contents. 8.5grams of coffee. Then tossed the contents. We then filled the provided grounds basket that comes with this machine with our own (good) coffee, dumped the contents out onto the scale and measured 9.5grams of coffee. Hmmm. We added more coffee to the machine's small basket, tamped them down lightly (which you're NOT supposed to do) and added MORE until it was full to the brim, then dumped out the contents and weighed them. 12grams. Eureka!

So, this machine purports to make either an 8oz, 10oz or 12oz coffee, with an added "BOLD" button that you can press at any point. LIES! Lies I tell you!

The golden rule of coffee:water ratio is about 1:17. 1 part coffee to 17 parts water, give or take depending on how strong you like it. To save you some math and just give you the tl;dr of this whole equation - you basically need about 12 grams of coffee grounds to make a DECENT 6oz coffee. Yes, you read that correctly and no - I didn't make a typo - 6OZ COFFEE.

The very SMALLEST coffee this machine will make is an 8oz cup. The very LARGEST amount of coffee you can get into it's tiny, K-cup compatible compartment is AT MOST 12grams - and that is with some tamping (which you're not supposed to do) and ending up with the water needle buried in the grounds (which you're not supposed to do).

Tl;dr again - every coffee this machine makes is EXTREMELY watered down, and more than likely far, far over-extracted. Which is weird because from the sour taste of my weekend travesties, I was under the impression that it was UNDER-extracted....but whatever. Either way, the coffee is bad, and the machine does not even remotely allow for adequate coffee:water ratios.

Only their pod works which broke after 2 weeks. Other ones you have to hold top down or it just pops open and goes everywhere! So now I have to buy coffee in pods which are very expensive...not what i signed up for! Oh and replacement for their pod is 13.00!!!!!

The coffee machine itself is great! Easy to use and fits nice in small spaces. However, it makes the weakest coffee. I tried everything to get the coffee stronger and nothing will work. I wish I knew this before I purchased the machine, now I'm stuck with it. If you love coffee strong, this is not the machine for you.
Easy to use and space saving was great but it stopped working after 2 months

I read the reviews here and decided to buy this Instant Pot Solo. Easy, Efficient and Fabulous are 3 words which describe this little machine. No need for bells and whistles! It does the job. And a good job btw. It heats water almost immediately and brews as good a cup of coffee as the Kcup you use.

I got one six months ago works awesome until I got up and the solo coffee maker didn‚Äôt come on. I got a new one so I‚Äôm giving them a 2nd chance and if this one goes out shortly I‚Äôm going back to Keurig.

Very easy to use, water gets nice& hot. I read the reviews regarding it not closing with the eco pods. Those are also what I use. But, with a little extra push after the liquid starts running through (and a restart), it closes every time. At this point, I'm very happy with the purchase. (Also love the color-got the red one.)

review name: This turned out to be a very good Product
review text: It is very easy to use. But I recommend using Pod Filter. Less cleaning for the Screen.

review name: Excellent alternative to Keurig, until it failed
review text:
*** UPDATE 06/04/2022:
Less than 2 months after obtaining the Instant Solo, it has failed. Either the system won't turn on, or if it does, when I start to touch the touchpad to make my brew selection, the display shuts off and the machine is not responsive. I'm assuming that there's some kind of short or defect in the control hardware. I would reach out to the manufacturer for repair or replacement, since it has a one-year warranty, but per the warranty I would be financially responsible for shipping the unit to Canada, which from my location would be at least $35 via UPS. As much as I like the unit, I'm not willing to spend that much just to initiate consideration for repair/replacement.

*** ORIGINAL REVIEW:

I've had so many different Keurig brewers over the years that I simply refuse to buy them anymore. I do use the standard K-Cup pods for convenience, however.

There are a few things in particular that I like about this unit:

+ It's sleek and smooth with a nice, rounded design for a more contemporary appeal.
+ It serves up a warm cup of coffee, brewed at the proper strength.
+ It has a Bold option to make the output from the pod a bit stronger, which is likely my favorite feature.
+ The top of the unit is a touchscreen with simple, easy-to-use options: On/Off, Bold and Size Selection. The options you select are outlined by a white circle for your confirmation.
+ The unit emits a tone at both the start and end of the brew cycle. The tone is quiet yet stands apart from the rest of the beeping kitchen.
+ The unit holds 40 ounces of water in its storage tank, and is easily removed and refilled as needed.

What I'm not crazy about:

- The lid to the water reservoir is a matte, clouded finish, so you have to look at the side to see how much water is left. The top doesn't match the body and looks out of place.
- The brewer is white. I didn't have an option to pick it up in black or red that fits better into my decor.

The brewer is fast and quiet. I used the bold feature as I like my morning cup to have some impact, and the taste difference is noticeable. Like other brewers I've used with K-cups, I always insert and press down the pod so that the base is pierced before I close the lid. This ensures no leakage or back spray.

IMPORTANT NOTE: If you're using a K-cup with this machine, it's really important to press on the edges of the cup to pierce the bottom when you place it in the machine. If you don't, it's possible that the K-cup will "explode" or you'll get a cup of hot water. Always make sure the K-cup is properly seated before closing the lid.

My Kuerig died and I wanted something that took less counter space. I love the smaller, clear water canister so I can see it is clean and water does not sit in the canister when not in use. I love that it shuts itself off. I like that the controls light up and that there is a sound when the cup is brewed. Reasonably priced to boot. Very pleased thus far.

review name: I Like It Better Than the Competition
review text: This device is really cool. It doesn't take anytime to heat up and produces a hotter cup of coffee than the more popular competitor. It takes all versions of K-Cups, does a decent job when you use your own coffee grinds and the included reusable filter, and is great for a quick cup of hot water.

review name: No fail, works every time as expected! ‚òïÔ∏è
review text:
I really like this single cup coffee maker‚Ä¶ although everyone else in my house does too LOL. With the water tank only being 40 ounces, after 3 cups it needs to be refilled (which is fine). You can use this to make hot chocolate or just on-demand hot water too!

The perk of this device is you're able to use your own coffee grinds in the reusable pod or use any K cup pod from whichever brand without issue. It's fast! It has an option to make the coffee regular or rich AND three brew sizes which are 8,10 and 12 ounces.

The biggest con, with all of these k-cup/single coffee makers, is it has no warmer. You either have to heat up the cream/milk/etc before you brew your cup or reheat the freshly brewed coffee in the microwave. I just wish you had the option to keep the coffee warm until you were ready for it.

ùêó Cons:
‚ûñ Hot water can squirt out so don‚Äôt stand too close to it.
‚ûñ Water spillage if moved with a full water tank/reservoir.
‚ûñ Coffee doesn't stay hot very long because there isn't a warmer.

‚úîÔ∏èPros:
‚ûñ An 8 oz of coffee brews in under 100 seconds
‚ûñ You can choose a bold or regular brew cycle
‚ûñ 3 cup sizes to choose from 8,10 and 12 ounces
‚ûñ You can stop the brewing at anytime
‚ûñ Coffee pod easy to clean immediately after use
‚ûñ Can use any brand of k-cup pods

Definitely would recommend for a small office or single to two-person home‚Ä¶ convenient and small-space friendly.
Love this coffee pot! It‚Äôs easy to use and doesn‚Äôt take take up much counter space

I LOVE this new coffee maker. Works just as well, if not better, than any Keurig I‚Äôve owned. Best of all, it came with its own little device for using coffee grounds instead of pods, so you‚Äôre not pulling parts out or changing things around just to use your own grind!
This works so great, highly recommend this product!! Works great like keurigs if not better!!

review name: As perfect as it gets for me
review text:
BACKGROUND:
During the first COVID-19 lockdown, I started looking into making the best cup of coffee for me, out of boredom and to keep my mind off of the terror. I was successful at keeping my mind occupied, but not as successful at the coffee part.

I started out by trying drip coffee makers from various brands, including some that were well rated by experts, including machines from OXO and Technivorm. For one reason or another, they didn‚Äôt work out. Mind you, I was looking for single-serve options, because I tend to only drink one cup in the morning per day.

I moved on to pour overs, trying drippers from both Kalita and Hario. I would've tried a Chemex, but again, I only drink one cup per day, so the Chemex would've been too big. I got myself a nice burr grinder, gooseneck electric kettle, scale and got to work. To my disappointment, I could never get the taste quite right or consistent using either the Kalita or the Hario. I was also kind of put off at how expensive the Kalita filters were, so I moved on yet again.

I finally decided to give Keurigs a try, despite their reputation for weak coffee, high cost, and wasteful non-recyclable K-cups. The convenience was great, but the taste didn‚Äôt suit me and using the reusable Keurig pods made them taste even worse. At a loss, I flip flopped between using my pour over drippers and my OXO 8-cup drip coffee maker.

Then came the Instant Pot Solo 2-in-1.

REVIEW:
I've been using the Instant Pot Solo for about 6 weeks now and find the taste using the reusable pod to be good enough. I only brew 8 ounces on bold and it‚Äôs fine. I grind one scoop of beans using my burr grinder, then pour it into the reusable pod and it‚Äôs just the right amount. I did once try to put as much grounds as possible into the reusable pod and I think that caused it to leak. Frustratingly, I noticed it leaking at other times too and I couldn‚Äôt figure out why. I‚Äôve tried to be more mindful about not overfilling the pod and making sure that the pod is seated properly before brewing. I haven‚Äôt experienced any leaking lately, so hopefully there are no more issues.

Using the Instant Pot Solo is a cinch. I like that the water reservoir is removable, which can make it easier to fill and clean. Like most single serve coffee makers, it does splatter quite a bit, but if you use a tall tumbler, it minimizes the splatter. Still, you‚Äôll want to wipe the Instant Pot Solo down about once a week to keep it clean and looking nice. The touch button controls are simple, responsive and a joy to use. I power it on, select bold brewing, then select the size and it starts brewing. Within a few minutes, my coffee is ready. The tones the buttons make when you press them and when the brewing is done are pleasant and not annoying like a lot of coffee makers.

The Instant Pot Solo isn't large and takes up very little space. It also doesn‚Äôt expel any steam from the machine itself, so it should be safe to run while underneath your kitchen cabinets. It‚Äôs so small and self contained that I‚Äôm reconsidering whether or not keeping my burr grinder on my counter is worth the trade off. I may go back to a small blade grinder or maybe even just go back to pre-ground coffee.

I‚Äôm not a fan of Keurig K-cups, but totally get the convenience. While using the reusable pod on the Instant Pot Solo isn‚Äôt quite as convenient, I prefer it to using the overpriced and hard to recycle K-cups. I really wanted to perfect the pour over method, but I just sucked at it and it was too much of a hassle, not to mention how stupid expensive the Kalita paper filters are. The best cup of coffee I made during this entire journey was from a Technivorm, but the single serve version was designed so poorly I couldn‚Äôt see myself using it day in and day out. The Instant Pot Solo 2-in-1 has been the best fit for me so far with the right balance of compromises, features, and convenience. It‚Äôs also reasonably priced. What‚Äôs not reasonably priced is their reusable pod, which you can purchase on its own and I‚Äôd love to have. Aside from that, no major complaints and I‚Äôm happily using the Instant Pot Solo 2-in-1 almost everyday.

Replaced a keurig with this one. It makes the coffee faster and hotter than the one it replaced. Will take ground coffee or kcups. I use the pod
coffee filters with ground coffee & it's a breeze to throw away the filter. The cup is better toward the front of the machine. Once you press the size cup you want the coffee starts brewing immediately. I removed the overflow tray to accommodate a 16 oz contigo cup. The 12 Oz button nearly fills up my 16 Oz cup.

The one thing is that because the coffee is more flavorful, it does take a little longer to brew but I don‚Äôt mind. All in all I love it and would buy again.

review name: Use pods or use easy to fill screen pod
review text: I really love this little coffee maker. Does not take up a lot of counter space and you can make a fresh cup very quickly !
