review name: A good single-serve maker from a good brand
review text:
Quite a few third-party K-Cup coffee makers have hit the market recently with a marked variation in quality. I got my hopes up when I saw this offering from the makers of Instant Pot, and I'm glad to say it lived up to my expectations.

The maker itself is very light and is mostly a thin plastic, but as long as you set it up and don't move it around all the time it shouldn't be an issue.

The removable reservoir holds about 40 ounces of water, which is good for 3-5 cups depending on cup size (it gives you options for 8, 10, and 12 ounces). This is a nice middle ground between having to fill it up every time and having a big reservoir where the water sits long enough you want to dump it.

The controls are very intuitive, with five buttons overall - a power button, a button to switch bold flavor on and off, and three size buttons. Selecting a size button starts the brewing. Each button helpfully illuminates a ring around it when it's active; considering the hoops I had to jump through on some other third-party coffee makers, this was a welcome change of pace.

It depends on your taste, of course, but you're more likely to want to have the "bold" option on as you use larger cups. There's a noticeable difference in intensity between an 8-ounce brew and a 12-ounce brew, though it's not as pronounced as some other brands.

Overall, Instant did a good job in a small package with this coffee maker. If you're only making for yourself or yourself and one other person, this is an excellent choice.

Watch the video from a previous review of the coffee maker dripping from the front tab. It leaks all over the counter.. I like the option to make 1 cup at a time, but the 12oz option isn't enough to fill our large Rae Dunn mugs that we love to use. I gave it 2 stars because I do like that it's narrow and simple to use and clean, but I am sending it back because the dripping on the counter is a deal breaker.

review name: Simple, slim, and makes a decent coffee
review text: Is very easy to use and clean you do have three different options of coffee oz. It‚Äôs very slim so it doesn‚Äôt take a a lot of space. I like the option of using k cups or your coffee grounds.

This product is simple. There is not really much to go over. I will say, this has replaced my current Keurig since it does kCups just as well and is made to also do ground coffee.

Build quality and design: I love how slender the unit is. It has a bit of depth, but it doesn't take up much space widthwise. The cup tray has a ton of vertical space for large and small cups. The drain tray is easily removeable and durable. The rear reservoir is large, easy to place, easy to remove, and easy to clean. Everything about this machines is built well and well designed. It also looks attractive.

Functionality: Not really much to discuss. There is a power button, and 3 fill sizes. Each setting pours exactly the stated amount of water and the liquid is hotter than most Keurig dispensers. The past part here is that the included ground coffee scoop is well made and thought out. This really makes a good cup of coffee from ground.

I really do not have a negative here, even after a week of use. Maybe if I were to nitpick, I would suggest that Instant use conventional shaped packaging for products. The last two product s came in weird dimensions or hexagons and it actually wastes space. That and packaging. Smaller footprints are better.

This machine made great coffee and so easy to use. I read the reviews about how some machines stopped working after 3 month and thought, "ya that won't happen to me". Well, it did. It ran for about 5 seconds and then started beeping. Very disappointed. Now I will have to pay to have it shipped back and possibly get a new one. Not sure if it's worth it.

Bought this and worked fine for about two months. Then it wouldn‚Äôt make a full cup and made beeping noises. Customer service sent us a new one except the second is doing the same thing. Customer service isn‚Äôt responding this time. Junk. Do not buy.

review name: Minimal space and bold tasting coffee
review text: This Instant Pot Solo Coffee maker has been a game-changer in my house! Let's start with the fact that it only takes very minimal space and can fit anywhere in my kitchen, it is K-cup compatible, so I can buy my favorite brands and drink a different type every day. It does have a reuseable cup for drip coffee if desired, and I have used it only a handful of times but the coffee comes out tasting great! It has an option to brew 8, 10, or 12 oz and the water compartment can be removed for easy cleaning. Keeping up with the cleaning is straightforward since you can also remove the bottom tray. The touch screen is easy to use and has the option for a bolder taste. It is decently priced as it competes with the more known brand but I personally like this product a lot better than the more known and higher-priced brand. I highly recommend this coffee maker!

review name: Best single-serve coffee maker I've tried--love the included reusable pod

review text: Flavor if coffee is best from this Instant Pot of an coffee maker in market. I highly recommend the coffee maker over all itherss. Ease of set & use of grounds or pods very simole!

This review is for the white Instant Solo by the Instant Pot company.
Lots of good features, so let's start!
The insert one uses to place your own coffee grounds in, is absolutely the best designed one that I have ever seen, and this is keeping in mind that I have had probably over 10 different machines that use K-Cups. (I used to collect various coffee makers, both old and new, with a collection of about a hundred before downsizing, and even had one of the first Keurig home units, back when they were made with a lot of metal parts and what plastic parts they did use, were excellent quality and substantial)
The mesh is more fine than some of the cheap generic ones, and it clips together tightly. Works beautifully, as long as you have a medium grind. Nothing too coarse, or it won't extract enough coffee flavor, and nothing too fine because it will clog.

Now let's compare this Instant Pot brand with the Keurig Mini, because both are compact size and about the same price, if you're getting the Mini that has the coffee strength selection feature, which the Instant Solo has.

As you can see, it's just a little larger than the Keurig branded mini. It's also not as streamlined of a design. Keurig has the edge here, think Zephyr and those clean, modern curves. However, you're trading off to be getting some good features. The Mini does not have a water tank that goes beyond what you put in it for one cup. The amount of water determines the cup size. The Instant has a water tank, and you can choose your cup size via buttons on the top. That may or may not matter to you, it depends on how small of a unit you want. Most people will fill the cup with cold water, and put it in the Mini reservoir. With Keurig, you are cooling off the mug by doing this, thus losing a bit of heat.
The build, in terms of quality, are comparable, but I think the Keurig brand edges it out just a little bit for one little reason. I show in the photograph how you can see the plastic seam at the top of the Instant branded coffee maker. These tiny little details bring down what would otherwise be a quality look. It ain't easy making plastic look quality but this is one of those things that makes an item made of plastic look downright cheap.

But my favorite Instant Solo feature is being able to adjust according to altitude.

Is a high altitude adjustment absolutely necessary for coffee makers?
If you love coffee, the answer is absolutely yes!
The reason for this is the boiling point of water at high altitude. Unless you adjust your coffee maker, the water flowing through the grounds is going to be too hot.
Water boils at 212¬∞ at sea level. I'm in the mountains, and water boils a full 10¬∞ lower at my altitude.
Something to always keep in mind, if your coffee is too bitter, it might be that the water you're using is too hot. If your coffee has that sourness that we sometimes associate with coffee beyond its expiration, it could be that your water isn't hot enough. So yes, that variance in temperature can mean quite a bit.

The Instant company clearly gets it in terms of how important these things are, right down to another great feature of this coffee maker. You will notice that the water pauses and continues a few times. Just like with pour over coffee, the machine is wetting the grounds in a manner which is going to extract the most flavor.

Some negatives...
When removing it from the protective packaging after pulling it out of the box, I could see several flaws. Minor and not so minor. The scratches at the top of the unit are bad enough to where I question quality control. That's a red flag for two reasons. First of all is thier quality control lacking? Second of all, was this product rushed through production to get it on the shelves, which translates as the first batch of units at high risk for issues? You can barely see in the photograph the black stains at the bottom, but since the unit is white, it's kind of noticeable in person. They're very small, but they don't wash off.
That goes back to the above mentioned cheaper build. I think the Keurig model uses a better quality of plastic, little flaws like the plastic seam cheapen the look of the Instant model.
This is very minor, but when you put the reservoir tank back on the unit, it pops a little, so if you have it filled to the max you're going to probably spill a little water unless you're very careful placing the tank on. No big deal.

So, in closing, my suggestion, especially if you are giving one of these as a gift, unpack it and take a close look at it before the time comes that you can no longer return it. Solo is comparably priced, with more features than similar single cup units.
I hope that the comparison, and the photos, help you to make a decision about whether or not you'd like to invest in this offering from Instant Pot. In my opinion, because of my altitude, I believe the brewed K-Cup from the Instant tastes a little better than the Keurig branded model.
It would rate five stars from me if the quality control was tighter.

UPDATE:
As mentioned, this machine will wet the grounds in the K-Cup a number of times during brewing, and most importantly, it will wet the grounds and pause right at the start of the cycle.
Few machines do this. Some of the Bunn home coffee machines come to mind.
But here's the thing. The older Jura models would do the same thing, but the first wetting of the grounds was with room temperature, not hot, water. I had one of those, spent thousands for it, and I found myself putting a cup to catch those drips, and then putting the cup I would drink from, underneath the spout.
So yes, I put my finger underneath to check the temperature of the first few drips coming out of the K-Cup brewing in the Instant Solo.

Let's just say, I took one for the team!
Ouch!

Cheers!

This "Instant Pot Solo 2-in-1 Singe Serve Coffee Maker for Ground Coffee, K-Cup Pod Compatible Coffee Brewer, Includes Reusable Coffee Pod, 8 to 12oz. Brew Sizes, 40oz. Water Reservoir, BlackInstant Pot Solo 2-in-1 Singe Serve Coffee Maker for Ground Coffee, K-Cup Pod Compatible Coffee Brewer, Includes Reusable Coffee Pod, 8 to 12oz. Brew Sizes, 40oz. Water Reservoir, Black" is great! It's easy to use, works well, and works quickly. Highly recommend!

Originally I gave this five stars. I absolutely loved it and I only use it a handful of times a week maybe five times a week. Five cups of coffee a week. I use filtered water and now it will not produce a cup of coffee and there's steam coming out all over the place. I saw a video review of one star and it was doing the exact same thing after 4 months on theirs also. I have descaled it and cleaned it and everything and the water will not go through the coffee at all. JUNK. I am so so sad & irrate about this! Purchased June 2022 so cannot return!!!!

I‚Äôve long wanted my own coffee maker at work and this one has been great! All the features I need as packed into this small machine: 3 sizes to brew, pod for your own grounds, and an easy to fill tank. I‚Äôve used mostly store bought pods but also had a chance to use the fill-your-own attachment and it works great too. I ordered two additional pods and they fit perfect too. I‚Äôve ended up sharing this with a nearby desk mate, so I sometimes wish the tank was a little larger but love the small footprint. This is a great for if you‚Äôre looking for a personal coffee pod machine.

I have a large coffee pot. But I don't always want a lot of coffee, especially if it's just me. Single-cup coffee makers are a great compromise. And each cup is always really fresh. I have the original Instant Pot, and it's really a good product, so when I came across their brand of coffee pot, I was sold. It's such a breeze to use. Easy buttons, including one for bold. Three brew sizes. It's ready to brew almost instantly. And it's very convenient to be able to use either the k-cups or the enclosed coffee pod. Coffee pot takes up little room on my counter, and I love the red color. Oh, and it makes a really good cup of coffee. Recommended.

review name: Perfect for the office- so nice we bought it twice
review text:
I was looking for something with a small footprint that looked professional for my husbands office. This is absolutely perfect! It comes with a reusable k cup style mesh pod and you can choose the size of coffee cup you would like. It is so easy to set up and use. I love that you can choose your own coffee grounds, makes this a step up from typical single cup coffee makers. I think it‚Äôs worth it for the price for sure, especially from a reliable brand.

I hope you found this review helpful!

UPDATE: After my husband had been using this in his office for a bit and we really came to understand how it worked we decided to get a second one for me to keep in my office. I am not quite as caffeine dependent as he is, but it‚Äôs nice to make people feel welcomed to my office. I got it in red and it‚Äôs just gorgeous!! The grey is a little more professional but the red is just stunning. It would be great for a kitchen with an eclectic vibe.

review name: Stopped working with horrid bumps steam
review text: My key rig broke my wonderful daughter bought this for me I was delighted üòä‚≠êÔ∏èHere we are a few months later it started making strange noises then today steaming not running thru pod‚Äôs at all a complete breakdown

I love this coffee maker, it‚Äôs a home run, nothing I don‚Äôt like about it. Easy to use, easy to clean, makes coffee fast. The basin is removable, so easy to fill. It‚Äôs easy to clean, and brews coffee instantly. If you‚Äôre wanting a good cup of coffee, on demand, quickly, this is the right coffee maker for you. Everyone that comes over raves about this machine. We have in home nursing for our oldest child and everyone raves about it. I‚Äôve had multiple people take pictures of this unit so they can get one for themselves.

This is a great personal coffee machine I don't drink a lot of coffee so this size is perfect for me. Using this is pretty much like every other k pod machine you open the top insert the k pod and close the lid the top feels sturdy and doesn't feel like it will fail any time soon. This is also really fast at making coffee there's no need to wait to heat up the water at all you just turn it on chose your cup size and it starts immediately its pretty amazing I had a older machine that you had to wait whole it warmed up so this is a welcome change. This is a good coffee machine it's small and stylish so you can place it anywhere to have super fast coffee.

I am dismayed that you cannot use any pods with this machine. The ad states you can but customer service says only use refillable insert using your own grounds. This is not why I bought this maker and am very disappointed in misleading information. Not what I expected from the Instantpot Company.
Stopped working after 2 months of in-home use. Not recommended.

I got this because I liked the dual ability it has to use K-cup pods or ground coffee in the reusable pod. Overall we are really happy with it. It brews quickly and the coffee tastes good. I like that you can easily choose brew size and strength. I like the large reservoir and that it's easy to fill and to clean.
It brews coffee hot but it doesn't have to cool down much before it's a temp ready to drink. For me it doesn't at all because I like my coffee hot while my husband doesn't and that is one thing he likes about this machine that he doesn't have to put a cube of ice in or wait a long time for his coffee to be ready to drink.
The only issue I've had is that sometimes when using K-cup coffee pods it doesn't want to close all the way before brewing. When that happens I'll hit the brew and it will brew a little bit and then I'll have to hit it again (and at that point it sometimes will close all the way if I push down again) and it will brew the rest. That isn't an issue with the reusable pod, only on certain K-cup pods. It still brews them, just takes a little extra effort.
*Update* We've been using this daily for months and I'm updating it to five stars because of how much we like it. The reusable pod works so well and we've found it's saved us money because we aren't brewing a full pot and wasting coffee that we don't drink. We just brew a cup when we want it and so our beans and ground coffee last longer than it typically would. I'd really like to be able to buy a couple more of those to have on hand.

review name: Quit working after less than 3 months.
review text: Quit working in less than 3 months.
stopped working after 3 uses. only gives hot water . does run thru pod./

Instant's Solo Coffee Maker is a small and compact machine. It's made completely from plastic, but the plastics used are high quality and the machine looks and feels well made and robust. It looks great on the countertop.

The Instant is easy to use. Fill the tank, turn it on, add the coffee (either grounds or a k-cup), and choose the serving size. The machine also offers the option for a bold cup by brewing the coffee more slowly.

The coffee it makes is hot, and if you choose one of the smaller sizes, it has a pleasant flavor. The largest size tastes a bit watered down. The machine isn't too noisy in use and makes a cup of coffee fairly quickly. It spittles a bit and makes a slightly splashy mess on the machine and counter.

It's easy to clean and the brew chamber is removable. The touch controls on the top are also easy to keep clean.

All in all... a great coffee maker.

Out of all the coffee machines I‚Äôve had this has to be my favorite. I personally only use k cups, but they get done super quickly with this. There is also a bold setting which I thought was really cool. It makes little cute noises when it‚Äôs done which is great when you‚Äôre a busy mom and have to get the bottle ready in the morning so it lets me know when it‚Äôs ready to go!! I love this machine and definitely going to be buying this as gifts for family and friends. Coffee/tea lover must have

I have wanted a pod maker for some time, but cost had me hesitant to go for it. I have a single serve machine for grounds, but sometimes I wanted to feel fancy with a pod maker. Well, I am really glad I didn't pull the trigger on a pod maker, because this one has best of both worlds! I just love this machine. It is so nice to have the option to use pods or ground coffee. You also have different options for the size of your mug. (Make sure you double check your size because you could overflow your cup if you're off just a tinge). You have an option to have bold coffee as well. I've used it both ways, and I'm satisfied and pleased either way. The bold option does make it a little more bold. It cooks quickly, and it's incredibly fast and easy to clean. The water reservoir on the back is a little bit larger so you can get several mugs out of this without refilling it. It is a little bit of hassle to move it to the side to pull out the water reservoir, but because it is larger it's worth it to me. If you notice a problem that the buttons aren't working properly, make sure the top is clicked shut (that happened to me once and I didn't realize it was a tinge open). I decided to donate my other single serve ground maker, because there's just no point of having that around right now with this new and nicer one. I love this so much.

I am not a coffee drinker but my wife is. She loves this thing. She can use either the coffee pods or fresh ground coffee! The size is just right to take traveling in a motorhome.

She likes this and is very happy to have it. It looks very nice also.

got this 2 in 1 coffee maker, it is so good - I don't have to refill everytime for just 1 cup of coffee, I can use between ground and K-cup, it is touch screen and it brew super fast and hot. I would recommend it if you are coffee lover.

review name: Great Little Coffee Maker by The Instant Pot People! Sleek & Space Saving but Not Small In Ability!
review text: Video Player is loading.

For at least ten years now I've had a Keurig at the office and a french press for use at home. The french press usually makes enough coffee to last me all day if I put it in a good thermal container. But lately I've been drinking less coffee and ending up with 1/3 to 1/2 the french press brew going unused.

So I've decided to make the switch from french press to single-cup brewer at home. I was convinced to make the change by this Instant Solo's ability to use actual ground coffee as well as the normal plastic pods. Pods are ridiculously expensive, but other single cup brewers I've owned have not worked well with actual ground coffee. This one does exceptionally well. The coffee comes quickly and tastes good. Strongly recommended.

I‚Äôve tested several single serve kcuppers over the years, and there is nothing special here. Its simple to use. 8, 10 or 12 oz. If you press bold, its even slower. I prefer the bold option, but be prepared to wait 3 minutes at least. Its easy to load, easy to fill, and easy to touch the buttons on top my mistake, so make sure you have your cup ready.

review name: Wonderful machine. Note that eco friendly k-cups don't seem to work in this.
review text: This has been an outstanding little coffee maker for us. It's the perfect size and it brews my k-cups much hotter than the similar size Keuirg I had prior to this machine. I'm loving everything about it. However one thing I did discover is that it seems the soft k-cups that don't use plastic and use those fabric type bottoms to them (the eco friendly type k-cups) don't seem to work in this machine. I ordered two types of the eco friendly coffee k-cups and this brewer won't brew them. However regular k-cups it has no troubles with. That what I normally drink anyway, but when I discovered the eco friendly k-cups didn't work, I figured I'd mention it.

This Instant Solo 2-in-1 Coffee Maker for Ground Coffee and K-Cup Pod Compatible is perfect if you are limited on counter space but don't want to sacrifice a great cup of coffee.

I like that it comes with a Reusable Coffee Pod, has three one-touch brew sizes from 8 to 12 ounces and also has a 40oz. Water Reservoir which should last through several brew cycles before needing to be refilled. I also like that it has a bold brew option.

All in all this Instant Solo 2-In-One coffee maker is a great deal for a great coffee maker! Definitely recommend!

Oh how I love this thing and it‚Äôs reusable K-cup. I bought this because I‚Äôve been more of an occasional coffee drinker and conventional coffee makers were overkill for me, but the coffee the Solo puts out is so good I end up exhausting the water tank every day drinking multiple cups. Highest recommendation!

review name: Other (mesh) K cups are not compatible with this machine
review text: You cannot use other mash cake up brands with this machine. They say you can in the description but they are wrong. You may be able to use regular field K cups with coffee in them that you buy at store but you cannot use mesh K cups

I was looking for a slimmer single use coffee maker and this seemed like the perfect option. I‚Äôm the only one who drinks coffee in the house and i wanted something that was easy to store. After less than two weeks I‚Äôve now wasted more than $10 in keurigs trying to get a cup of coffee. I‚Äôm now trekking to the basement where my old keurig is set up for guests. All of a sudden it only brews about six ounces of either muddy or clear water.
This was great for three months. Just quit working on me. I have unplugged and tried cleaning. Powered on and off. Crapped out. I emailed them and haven‚Äôt heard anything.

review name: Easy to use and clean. Makes a great cup of coffee!
review text: This little coffee maker is perfect for our needs. We don't drink coffee regularly so we don't leave one sitting out. The Instant Solo coffee maker is small and lightweight so it's easy to pull out as needed. It's also very easy to use. Just fill the tank, insert your kcup (or fill the included reusable cup) and choose your size! You can also select a Bold button if you prefer a stronger flavor. That's an option my old Keurig didn't offer. There is an audible beep to let you know when your cup is ready. You can disable this if you prefer. The tank is wide enough to wash well so it stays clean. Overall, we are really happy with this coffee maker. We both prefer it over our old Keurig.

We received the coffee maker which we purchased for our camper, so it was not opened right away. When we did open it the water tank was broken in a couple of places. We have emailed the manufacturer but, to date have not heard back from them nor received a new water tank.

review name: Easy way to make a single cup with or w/o K cups
review text: This is a perfect coffee maker to get if you‚Äôre all about single servings and you use pods but you want to transition away from that. You still have the freedom to brew K cups when you need/want to, but you also can use your own ground coffee which is more affordable and better for the world. The included filter cup thingy is easy to scoop your ground coffee with and place inside like you would with a K cup. This one does a good job of not causing the super fine ground coffee bits at the bottom of your cup. If you have ever make coffee in a machine designed for K cups using one of those special refillable kind of cups, then you know what I‚Äôm talking about.

review name: Strong brew, light real estate space in a small kitchen or office!
review text: This little machine works great and is perfect for small kitchens or office space. I like most that I can use either K-cups or freshly ground coffee to brew and it works fast and gives a nice hot cup of coffee. You will be very happy with it however you decide to use it!

This coffee machine is my all time favorite ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è It gets its own attention, all my guest and family member says how nice or how cute it is üòä the water tank can hold over 30oz of water which saves some time. I love I can use pods and it comes with a little filter allowing me to use ground coffee as well =) you can make either 8oz, 10oz, or a 12oz cup of joe depending on how much you want or need. It‚Äôs very easy to clean and maintain, and it makes a very delicious cup of Coffee ‚òïÔ∏è I HIGHLY RECOMMEND and know this would be a great gift üéÅ ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

review name: Don‚Äôt have to purchase the pods if you want to use your own ground coffee
review text:
This is my very first ‚Äòsolo‚Äô cup coffee maker. I drink a lot of coffee in a day and I have been hesitant to get one due to a number of factors and the cost of k-cups was the number one reason.

I decided on this one because of the Instant name brand and that I can brew a cup in this one using ground coffee. I don‚Äôt have to purchase the k-cups. These pots have improved, too. This design is sleek with a small footprint and has a 40 ounce reservoir.

It works good for me and I can make it ‚Äòbold‚Äô like I like it. It fits a travel mug, too.
Broke in a month. Lots of steam no coffee.

review name: SUPER easy to use, works great!
reviewer's name: Your Best Source For Unbiased Reviews!
review text: I got this because my roommate is Autistic and he's very smart but he hates messing around with things that have too many options. So I ditched my overly confusing Ninja Bar and got this one that he can operate by pushing like a couple of buttons is all! We even use this just to get boiling water quick so he can make tea with it. It works great for brewing coffee. It produces hot water quickly and brews pretty quick. For the price point and ease of use, this things fantastic!
Coffee splatters all over the place. I have now ordered taller coffee cups to hopefully take care of that. Satisfied with everything else. It's quick and easy. Just don't like the splatters.

We got this coffee maker to replace our larger, outdated machine and have not been disappointed. This machine takes up around half of the counter space of our old machine and also produces far superior cups of coffee. The Bold feature is fantastic and the machine heats up the water as it is drawing it so not only does it brew warmer but also faster than our old machine. The price may be a little more than other machines like this but I feel like it is worth it for the quality of the product and smaller profile.

So easy to use!! I love the included reusable pod. It is easy to clean and the size makes a perfect, tasty cup of coffee. The size is perfect, also. It fits on my small counter and takes up a minimal amount of space.

The water tank is easy to remove and fill. The functions are extremely easy to understand. I like that I can customize which size coffee I would like, too.

It also takes k-cups, so even easier cleanup in the morning if you want to use those!

I decided to order this as I had heard nothing but good things about it since it‚Äôs debut.
And I can assure you, it did not disappoint!
Not only is the packaging top notch, the coffee maker itself is beautiful, slender and takes up such little space. It‚Äôs perfect!
My husband and I are daily ‚Äúone cup‚Äù coffee drinkers, so this instant solo coffee maker fits our needs exceptionally well.
I love that you can chose to either use k-cups, or use coffee grounds depending on preference and I also love that I can remove the bottom tray, and fit my to-go tumbler without issue.
The price point is great as well
It‚Äôs truly the best out there in my opinion.
Would absolutely recommend! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

review name: Typical k-cup type of coffee flavor‚Ä¶
review text: Lightweight, easy to clean, easy to use. Compact for amount of counter space required. Three different brew sizes which dilutes the coffee as you increase in volume.

I bought this Instant Solo coffee maker after returning a similar product from Hamilton Beach after only a few days of use. This one is so much better. Large capacity water reservoir for such a small machine. Easy to use touch buttons. Produces great flavor and hot coffee. So far I am completely impressed with the quality of the product.

This instant solo has surpassed my former coffee maker with flying colors. It is super easy to use and very quick, even when choosing the ‚Äúbold‚Äù setting. The water reservoir holds quite a bit of water and there is a ‚Äúk cup‚Äù attachment allowing me to brew my ground coffee instead of using an actual coffee pod/pack.
Lasted a couple of weeks then started steaming out everywhere and squeaking loudly and then stopped brewing, just hot water. I loved the small form factor until it failed.

I have a duo coffee maker/k-cup that is so bougie it only likes Starbuck k-cups and explodes other cups resulting in grounds all over and a mess to clean up. I was hoping a machine specific to k-cups would work better, but I was work. Exploded multiple other brands, except for Starbucks. How do these things work in hotels with that cheap stuff???

review name: And just like that‚Ä¶..it stopped working.
review text:
I ordered this based on the reviews And the prime deal. Received on 7/16/22 and it stopped working 9/6./22. Water is sputtering out all over, the motor is loud and sounds like it‚Äôs straining, the water pours through clear . Steam is streaming out from the top. Lights are flashing. What a total disappointment. It was working perfectly and then bam‚Ä¶.nothing. Now I‚Äôm without coffee and that‚Äôs not good lol. Contacted the company and waited on hold for 45 min. Was told to send them a video of the item malfunctioning. I‚Äôm hoping that they offer a replacement or my money back. Ugh I‚Äôm so bummed.
***update as of 9/8/22. The company is sending me a new unit. I‚Äôm hoping I don‚Äôt have a repeat of what happened with the first unit especially after reading more reviews of customers that experienced the same thing after a month. I will update this review after I receive the new pot and use it for a few months. Keeping my fingers crossed!

Works just like a keurig and works with k-cups like a champ! It is very pristine and sleak look. Additioanlly it comes with reusable cups for making your own coffee or tea. I highly recommend this product!

I have used this Instant Solo coffee maker for a month now and I really like it. I mostly use it with the compatible K-cup pod which allows me to use my own coffee beans and I like how rich and flavorful my cup of coffee is. It is easy to use and works flawlessly. Nice!

‚≠ê‚≠êThanks for reading my review & I hope that it is helpful‚≠ê‚≠ê

This coffee maker is great for office use. It is very simple to figure out. The maintenance is minimal. It brews coffee very fast. I did not try the pods, just the ground coffee- and the flavor turns out as good as it gets (unless you have an espresso machine). Also, it takes very little space.
It is very convenient and easy to use.

A great little single serve coffee maker that uses pods as well as having a filter that brews your favorite coffee. Easy to use and with a touch screen makes brewing coffee easy as well as fast. Find your favorite pods and you‚Äôre in business. It has a small footprint that won‚Äôt take up half your counter. I love it!

**** UPDATE****

I do not love this coffee maker now. I have discovered it makes my Kcup coffee to weak on the lowest 8oz serving. My coffee is like water with some flavor. ‚òπÔ∏è
ALSO.... It's messy after it's finished brewing. It drips and sometimes makes a mess inside. Be careful removing the Kcup, you will likely get burned by how hot it is plus the dripping to get it to the trash can.
I would not recommend and regret selling both of my Keurigs!!!!!!

love love LOVE this coffee ‚òï maker.
No start up time.
Turn on, hit brew, BAM! Starts brewing!!
I purchased a second one for the RV. Selling my Keurigs and not looking back!

*UPDATE* I had to deduct a star. ‚≠ê
The only thing I do not like is it's messy.
After you open lod to drive used Kcup it drips on me and ALWAYS on the little drip pan area. I have to wipe it down every single use. Not just one drip but several.
I even got burned with one Kcup when I removed it. Dripped all over myself and the floor.
Very irritating, but it still makes delicious coffee ‚òï

*NOTE* I loved this machine so much I ordered a second. NEVER did it say "USED" But IT WAS!!!
It still had coffee splatter on the machine and in the drip tray. It was missing the coffee pod where you can brew your own!!!!!!
WATCH Amazon.. They will sell you used merchandise and not tell you. They just drop the price a little bit.
SHADY.......!!!!!!

I love the single serve coffee maker. I have used the k cups and the filter basket to make coffee. Both worked great. I usually make the 10 oz which is a decent size cup of coffee. Easy to clean. Highly recommend

This product is simple. There is not really much to go over. I will say, this has replaced my current Keurig since it does kCups just as well and is made to also do ground coffee.

Build quality and design: I love how slender the unit is. It has a bit of depth, but it doesn't take up much space widthwise. The cup tray has a ton of vertical space for large and small cups. The drain tray is easily removeable and durable. The rear reservoir is large, easy to place, easy to remove, and easy to clean. Everything about this machines is built well and well designed. It also looks attractive.

Functionality: Not really much to discuss. There is a power button, and 3 fill sizes. Each setting pours exactly the stated amount of water and the liquid is hotter than most Keurig dispensers. The past part here is that the included ground coffee scoop is well made and thought out. This really makes a good cup of coffee from ground.

I really do not have a negative here, even after a week of use. Maybe if I were to nitpick, I would suggest that Instant use conventional shaped packaging for products. The last two product s came in weird dimensions or hexagons and it actually wastes space. That and packaging. Smaller footprints are better.
This machine has turned out to be great. I am now able to get my coffee at the office anytime and the price is right - it did not break the bank.

reviewer's name: Dinosaurs and Mermaids, mom of both
review text: I needed something to replace our bulky Keurig and this slim version by Instant Pot works out nicely. Very easy to use. Easy to clean. It plays a little tune when it's finished brewing. We haven't had any issues with it and it gets used almost daily.
I like this single 2cup pot. All I ever needed except when I had company was 2 cups in the morning.

This is my third instant pot appliances and it did not disappoint. The coffee maker is very easy to use. It makes good coffee fast! I got this because it comes with a reusable k cup so I can use my coffee ground. The red color is really pretty and it really stands out being in between my two instant pot pressure cookers.

Make sure you run the initial cleaning process before brewing. This machine is easy to use and clean after each use. It can be used for a K-cup or to put your own coffee in. Coffee tastes great!I am very happy with this product!

Pros:
Fast brewing compared to Keurig brand I also own. Shorter and about same width as Keurig. Spill plate works great and is easy to clean.

Cons:
Sputters coffee out and less constant drip than the Keurig. When using a small mug you can't put the mug against the back. It must be centered reasonably but not perfectly. 8 oz brew is true and you'll need 9-10oz mugs. It filled my 8oz slightly over the rim and thus I got to test and clean the spill plate.

I prefer the Keurig because I can brew 7 oz into an 8 oz cup by pouring the water from the cup into the tank. This has a prefill tank. Some people will prefer the prefilled. If so this is the one for you.

Despite my preference there this is the better choice for me on the master bathroom counter where the smallest Keurig unit is too tall and this is shorter and certainly the most compact one I've ever used.

My home coffee station has become cluttered. I was looking to downsize from my full size Keurig machine. I'm so glad I did. This does have the small footprint. Our coffee station has a Ninja coffee maker, an espresso machine, and a coffee burr. Aesthetically, it looks much better. The cluttered look was really annoying my husband! Set up was easy. Directions are clear. The water reservoir is ample enough so I'm not refilling it daily. It's more like every 2 or 3 days. I like that there are different sizes. The coffee it makes is noticeably better than what I was getting from the Keurig. Even my coffee snob husband has enjoyed using the special pod feature. I am very pleased with this!

review name: Not previously a fan of solo coffee brewers
review text: Video Player is loading.

Nice looking coffee maker. I followed directions carefully. Makes smaller than expected amount of coffee, which is watery and flavorless. Brews quickly and quietly. Good size. However, for the price, was hoping for a better cup of coffee than the weak coffee water I got, even with the bold setting. May have to return to inconvenient lower-tech pour over method with my previous Melina carafe, cone filters and teapot for boiling water.
Messy and poor coffee flavor
My only issue with this coffee maker is the water tank is too small for 2 people. I find myself filling it up daily.
The reusable cup is great for making my own blends, and it doesn't get grounds in my cup. Brews quick, doesn't need alot of warm up time.
Coffee just does not taste good from this machine

review name: I like it over all Update
review text:
It‚Äôs nice. Small and fits right into my small kitchen. The only thing I don‚Äôt like is it can leak. I am not sure why yet. It‚Äôs happened a couple of times.

Update- it no longer works!!!!! It just stopped working, I‚Äôve tried everything and nothing works.

review name: well performing coffee maker with less contribution to landfills..
review text: Easy to use coffee maker that doesn't really require any instructions. I have had issues with flavor strength and sometimes volume when using reusable pods on Keurig machines. This one doesn't seem to have that issue at all. Brew is as anticipated and seems to have consistent strength for the various coffee types we have tried on several days. The "bold" feature maybe the reason - clearly the secret because the ad just mentions special "brewing sequences". It seems to work. For less than $100, water storage, reusable pods and flexibility with traditional Kpods, and minimal space occupied - this is a great choice for a dorm or office. (in fact we bought one for each)...

review name: The slim compact design looks great in kitchen
review text: The sleek compact design looks beautiful and works great. The best features: the BOLD (stronger flavor) option, and the reusable pod--so you can grind & easily use your own beans.

This Instant Pot coffee maker is just what I wanted! It brews K-Cups and has an option to also brew grounds. It brews coffee nice and hot and you can choose the size of cup you want to brew by the press of a button on the top. I really like that it has a tank on it to hold water, instead of having to put a cup of water in every time I want to brew a cup. I also like that I can see into the water tank through the transparent plastic.

This appliance is attractive and sleek...looks great on my coffee bar and has a small footprint.

Really happy with this product! With a name like Instant Pot, what else would I expect but awesomnesss?

I hope you find this review helpful.

review name: Only lasted a month and now I have to buy another one. Do not recommend buying this!!
review text: It only lasted a month and the motor died and it started making weird noises and smoking. Now I have to get another one üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°
This compares to the leading brand! Very happy to have this single serve coffee unit. Fit on the counter top. Easy to fill with water. Works like a charm.

The set up was super quick and easy. I really like the slim profile of the unit. Anyone with limited counter space would find this a welcome alternative to the wider/larger coffee makers. It has a 40 oz water reservoir, which I thought was a pretty decent size for a smaller unit. It brews a very hot cup of coffee, at least compared to the coffee maker we have been using. I couldn‚Äôt find any temperature information in the literature, but I would say those who like their coffee extra hot will be pleased. The instructions are clear and it is very easy to use. This is a basic coffee maker - easy to set up and easy to use. For me, that was a big plus. I don‚Äôt want to have to study up just to make a cup of coffee. LOL. Very happy to recommend.
Love the size, easy clean, easy use !

The product arrived well packed and in good shape. It was extremely simple to set up. It brews super fast, just not very hot. Any K pod seems to fit and function. I really appreciate the multi cup (40 oz) water reservoir. Being the only coffee drinker in the house it is perfect for my situation
Amended review:
After just short of 3 months the machine went bizarre. It screams like a banshee, blows steam out every orifice, the lights blink like it‚Äôs on defcon 4 and it beeps incessantly. It now resides in the local dump. It surely wasn‚Äôt over use, averaged less than a cup a day.

review name: Instant Brand Solo Coffee Maker K-Cup
review text:
Currently I am using a bare-bones Keurig brand machine that works well and like this Instant brand machine has a small footprint but it has a higher price point with very few features. This machine has a bold brew option, a high altitude brewing a feature along with a large 40 ounce water reservoir. It can handle tall travel mugs and three cup sizes may be selected for 8, 12 or 16 ounce brewing. Also the operation is quieter and brewing is considerably faster.

The included user manual is clearly written and includes operation and maintenance information. For the last few days I‚Äôve been using the machine and so far am very pleased with the ease of use and ability to customize size, etc. For brewing the commercial k-cups work without issue but so does the included refillable pod which brewed a very good cup of coffee. Excellent.
I bought this 10 days ago. Have made total of 4 cups of coffee. Now it makes hot water. Tech support was clueless. Returning it. Absolute piece of garbage.
After 1 use, it no longer works.
Didn't even last a month, worst coffee maker I've ever had. Please don't waste your money.
Video Player is loading.

review name: Has high altitude mode. Works well, only neg is no way to see water level from front.
review text:
Photo with soda can for scale. Also photo of cleaning directions.

Pros:

There is a HIGH Altitude mode! This is for above 5000 ft, I live at 7000 plus so I set it. Push 8 and 10 oz buttons for 3 seconds until they blink twice. To turn off, press 8 and 10 oz buttons until blink 3 times.

Slimmer than my Keurig.

Feels more solid.

Even tall mugs fit below.

Brews great coffee. Bold setting does make it darker.

Easy to clean buttons.

Removable and easy to clean drip tray.

You can turn off the beep sounds if you like (press and hold the 8 and 12 oz buttons for 3 sec and wait for them to blink twice)

Cons:

No indication of how much water is left from the front, you have to peer at the back of it to see if there is water.

Pros: easy to use and clean. Flavor is ok, quieter than keurig, brews quickly, small footprint on counter
Cons: Kcups explode on last water push
This happens every other kcup. Coffee grounds everywhere and in cup. Still trying to figure why this happens. I want to love it. I like it way better than my last 2 keurig 2.0. But...

I replaced a Keurig with this Instant pot coffee maker. I have only been happy with it. It makes the coffee quicker; it is easier to clean, and I can use pods or any ground coffee I want. Takes up less room on the counter and just looks nicer.

review name: Broke taking it out of the box
review text: I don't know how a first impression of a product could possibly be worse. As I was carefully removing the product from the box the water reservoir fell approximately 18 inches onto my carpeted floor and a piece broke off. I don't understand how plastic can be more fragile than a crystal wine glass. I should have stuck with Keurig. $100 lesson learned.

Coffee pot worked for about 3 weeks (although it did spit water all over the place), the it just didn't. Tried cleaning it as directed (3-times), but all it did was shoot hot steam out of it, splatter water all over the place, and still no coffee! Read enough reviews to see that this happened a lot, so boxed it back up and returned for a refund.

P. S. Actually thought this item was made in Canada, but it is actually made in China (no wonder why it broke so quickly), and distributed in Canada.

review name: LOVE THIS SINGLE SERVING COFFEE MAKER!
review text: But truth be told, we make more hot chocolate with it than coffee. Fantastic appliance and we are so happy with our purchase!
My machine doesn‚Äôt brew enough coffee. No matter what size I choose it brews couple of drops and starts flashing. Do you know what is the issue??

review name: Pods explode, sputters making a huge mess, leaks
review text: Pods explode sending coffee grounds all over the unit and in the cup. Continues to drip after coffee made and makes a huge mess. I‚Äôm very disappointed in InstantPot brand. If I could give it a 0, I would.

Update! Reviewed this and rated it highly as it is quite a good coffee maker, that is until you accidentally let it run out of water. Once. Just once. And once is enough to break this thing. It does say in the instructions not to let it run out of water but I don't remember reading about the severe consequences.
Shame really. This was good.

So we bought one of those well marketed Keurig alternatives on Amazon about a year ago. For ground coffee and k cups. It lasted a few months and it was so bad we threw it out. Then we bought a Keurig with an attached milk frother and after six months it stopped working. And it's tiresome.
We got this and love it already. Im going to come back and tell you if it fails like the others but for now it feels like it's going to last. I hope so anyway.
It's so simple. The interface on the top is basically just four buttons. On/ off, bold and then three cup size options. To be honest we haven't used bold and only really go with 8oz cups because we are creatures of habit. But it's working perfectly. And we do use the coffee maker a lot.
The 40oz reservoir is fine and for two people and it's fairly easy to clean. The big benefit was the size of it. We were looking for something compact and this is it. It has to fit alongside the toaster and the tea kettle and the soda stream and all the other devices we ended up with.
I will come back, as I said, it it turns out this is another let down. But so far it appears to be a win.

review name: DON'T BUY! No support & dead after making 16 cups of coffee
review text:
Update #2:
I emailed the company at the address provided when I registered this Instant Solo coffee maker. No reply. Simply crickets.

This coffee maker made it through 2 more cups of coffee for a total of 16 cups during its career before spewing water everywhere and giving up the ghost. We went to my daughter‚Äôs office where her Keurig Slim had been sitting unused and full of water since mid-March 2020 when she was sent home to work at the start of the pandemic. Yeah, the Keurig still works fine despite its abandonment issues ‚Äì okay, it thought it was on an extended vacation, so no worries there ‚Äì and it‚Äôs gone on to prove that all the ‚Äúdefective‚Äù k-cups we‚Äôd been dealing with while using the Instant Solo were actually not defective at all. The Solo was putting out so much pressure, it was damaging the k-cups and filling our coffee with various amounts of grounds.

Sadly, the Instant Solo is a losing proposition all the way around. Very disappointing as I love my Instant Pot pressure cookers so much.

Update #1:
We ended up using this Instant Solo 2-in-1 Coffee Maker in my daughter‚Äôs room, where we had set up a coffee station for her. She used this for one cup of coffee per day and after about two weeks, it started dying. The pump was very, very loud and the water barely trickled out. This has only been used with filtered water, so that shouldn‚Äôt be an issue. And one cup per day should not tax any machine. Very frustrated, as I thought Instant would be a good brand after how good my Instant Pot pressure cookers are. Replacing this with a different brand. Too bad, because when it worked, it worked really well.

Original review:
This Instant Solo 2-in1 Coffee Maker works great. It got hot so fast and made coffee so quickly. It‚Äôs faster than our Keurig and very easy to use; it also seemed to get hotter than our Keurig. The k-cup pod works fantastically; not one iota of grounds sneaked out, and it held just the right amount of coffee. Overall, more than pleased with this Instant Solo. Definitely a step up from our Keurigs.

As the parent of kiddos with autism, there are causes near and dear to my heart. Let Amazon donate to your favorite charity! Use Amazon Smile (smile.amazon.com) when you order and Amazon will donate to the charity of your choice when you make a qualifying purchase. Check out how Amazon Smile works at https://smile.amazon.com/gp/chpf/about/ref=smi_se_rspo_laas_aas. My shopping is donating to my favorite charity, Canine Companions for Independence (CCI) at no cost to me. Awesome!

Absolutely love! First of all I love Instant‚Äôs brand. This coffee maker is so cute, doesn‚Äôt take up much space, and just is perfect for what I need. It heats up quick, the coffee is hot, and it‚Äôs easy to clean since it‚Äôs so small. 10/10 would recommend.

review name: Great single cup brewer, but read on for its fatal flaw
review text:
UPDATE 2/2/22: as much as I otherwise liked this, I did end up returning it. I took inventory of my k-cups and about 1/3 are the filter type pod so I just wasn‚Äôt comfortable using a brewer that wouldn‚Äôt fully close. I do hope they modify future versions of this to be compatible with such k-cups, as I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to purchase an ‚ÄúInstant Solo 2‚Äù if I could properly fit my SF Bay pods in it!

This was an impulse buy one morning and I really don‚Äôt know what compelled me to purchase it, aside from it being $80 at the time. But I‚Äôm so glad I did! I actually have a Bunn MCU, which also brews K-cups or grounds and has a bold setting as well. So they‚Äôre similar in those ways. But I like that the Instant Solo has a smaller footprint, and I like the large tank (with the Bunn, it has a small internal tank to always have hot water, but unfortunately once you fill it, it‚Äôs never able to be emptied‚Ä¶as someone who likes to switch up brew methods and may not use a brewer for a few months, this is a big downside for me). I also like that this just has one small insert if you want to use grounds, vs the bulky ‚Äúdrawers‚Äù the Bunn has for each type of coffee/tea. Aesthetically, the Instant Solo looks modern and the touch screen gives it a sleek look. As for the most important thing, the liquid gold itself‚Ä¶that‚Äôs what surprised me the most. It truly holds its own with the Bunn. My husband loves a cup of joe that looks like motor oil, and even a medium roast on the bold setting can accomplish that for him with the Instant Solo.

Now for that caveat‚Ä¶it unfortunately won‚Äôt close all the way if you use a filter type pod, such as SF Bay! It does brew them (which surprises me that apparently there‚Äôs not a sensor that keeps it from brewing without the device head being latched), but it does make me a little nervous brewing pods without it being fully closed. There‚Äôs a lip on the pods and it‚Äôs longer on the filter style, and the ‚Äúseat‚Äù for the lip is obviously designed to only fit the cup style. This is a pretty big downside to me because I really enjoy SF Bay and using compostable pods, and seems like a pretty big oversight by the folks at the Instant brand because it‚Äôs not future-proof (although that may be intentional; with as many Instant Pot models they release, they may want you to have to keep upgrading), with other K-cup brands expressing intentions to go fully compostable in the future.

Despite this caveat, it has still become my new everyday single serve coffeemaker, at least until the end of my return period when I decide if I can live with the ‚Äúflaw‚Äù. If so, the Bunn (which overall, I DO like; despite the slight misgivings I‚Äôve mentioned, it does brew stellar coffee) will be relegated to our travel brewer.

I love my Instant Pots...yes, pots. I have more two. When I decided I wanted a small single-serve coffee maker in my home office (I'm too lazy to walk downstairs), I purchased this one. It's really nice and quiet. It heats up and brews one cup (I prefer 12oz) fairly quickly. I like that it has a water reservoir so I don't have to fill it up every time I want a cup. It's a great purchase for a fat lazy gal.

Coming from Vietnamese filters, this coffee machine is a God-send.

The machine has a small footprint, is easy to use, the tank is easy to remove, or easy to pour water directly into; the coffee is rich and very hot (even too hot). The filter cup for the grounds is easy to use as a scoop or otherwise, and it's easy to empty and clean. I'm very happy I purchased the Instant machine. Now the world of K cups is in my hands as well.

That said, if you're a fan of Dunkin Donut's decaf medium ground coffee then you'll know how slowly water filters through which means the machine here will leak a bit as the water overflows.

Every other mediums ground I've used from Dunkin Donuts and one other brand, has given me no leak issues. It's just the Decaf, which water passes through slowly, which I've noticed even when using a simple gravity filter devices like the Vietnamese filters.

This machine is good. I'm impressed. I threw away the box. It's a keeper.

High quality, simple to use, produces great coffee, slim design. I am so happy with this produce! I've used it to make coffee with a pod and with ground coffee, and it does an excellent job. I tried to go the really cheap route, and ordered another coffee maker, only to return it after one day. This one was more expensive, but worth every penny and more. Buy this coffee maker - you won't regret it!

I‚Äôm enjoying coffee again thanks to this little Instant Pot Single Serve Solo coffee maker. I‚Äôve been using my Keurig for years now and had been noticing something was off. I kelp trying different coffee flavor pods thinking it was the coffee. So when my Keurig started leaking I decided to try another brand of coffee makers. And Boy-oh-Boy am I glad I did. Instant Pot brought back my love of coffee again. The flavors are amazing. The unit is small so it fits under my cabinet easily even while lifting top for a pod. It has a 40 oz. water reservoir and 3 brew sizes. Lots of features for such a small unit. Read description for yourself and buy it. Price is even better. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. I‚Äôm not. So, So happy!

I like this simple to use machine. You can choose how many ounces for your cup with the push of a button. No digital crap, so everyone can have their cup their way without having to change anything back for the next person.

My last Keurig just broke and I was tired of having to replace it every few years. Was looking for other options and came across this one.
Using some of the K cups I have and the coffee definitely taste better. More flavorful and rich.
Unit is small, wish it feel a little bit more solid but so far so good.

review name: Small footprint and better then Keurig
review text: Very convenient and easy to use. Without pressing the bold button the coffee is stronger and hotter then Keurig brewers of which I have owned 4 of. I much prefer the result of this one. Easy to refill the smaller water capacity. Easy to clean It stays in place nicely with a bottom that does not slip. 8-10-12 Oz size coffee with a bold button too. No timer. No grinder. You press the buttons very lightly. I got sick and tired of the Keurigs breaking down and the ones now are not as good as their first Keurigs. I‚Äôm VERY happy with it.

I never write reviews but for the Instant Solo Coffee Maker I had to. It's easy to use, tank holds 40 oz. so no refilling with every cup. The other feature I love is the choice of 8, 10 or 12 oz cups. I love that the 10 oz. fills my coffee mug perfectly. I would definitely recommend this coffee maker to family and friends.

review name: Either overheats or underheats. UNIT DEAD IN 3 days.
review text: I was very much looking forward to this K-cup brewer from Instapot, but only after three days the unit is either underheating, or overheating the coffee. Today my coffee was like MAGMA and there was an entire cup full of coffee grains in my cup. It's like the machine sandblasted the insides of the K-cup and pushed into my cup. I'd expect this out of a cheapo no-name brand unit, but not from Instapot.

So far I‚Äôm enjoying my new coffee maker. I love the red color, I love that it turns itself off, and it‚Äôs ready to go quickly when turned back on, makes coffee quickly, I‚Äôve used Keurig type pods and used the reusable coffee cup that comes with, both make a great cup of coffee. I‚Äôm hoping this is going to last a long time, I‚Äôve replaced 2 single serve coffee makers in the last year and a half

I ordered this because I travel frequently and wanted a portable k-cup/combination coffee maker. I‚Äôm super impressed and it makes a delicious cup of coffee! I take this with me to have coffee in my hotel, air B and B without having to deal with making 12 cups at a time! I‚Äôm so pleased I ordered this multi functional grounds or k-cup
Coffee maker. Easy to set up and clean!
Finally, a single cup coffee maker designed by someone who actually uses one. Very intuitive, and makes a great, quick, super hot cup. Well worth the cost.

Compared to my previous single-cup coffeemaker, this is FANTASTIC! The water receptacle holds alot and is VERY easy to fill! It doesn't take up much counter space. The operation buttons are SO simple to use. After using this coffeemaker for a few weeks now, I would have paid twice the price if I'd known how great it is!

This machine is great. I wanted a single cup styled K cup machine with a reservoir that holds water for multiple cups, for convenience sake. This fits that perfectly. Love it. I buy the K Cups here as well, for an amazing price. You cannot go wrong here. 3 size options available. I prefer the 8 ounce
Best pod coffee maker we‚Äôve ever had! I hope it lasts a long time!

I love this little coffee maker! I can use any kcup which you can't do with the other brand! The water is hotter and is twice as fast!! Easy to clean and to fill the tank. My only wish is that the water tank to be a little bigger. Definitely recommend and would buy again!
Works fine. Has lasted longer than my last Keurig, so that is a bonus. (and it didn't cost as much)

The first one over heated. The replacement showed up quickly but I have to drive this old one across town so I wanted to write a review which causes an inconvenience to this company much like the inconvenience I get to experience this afternoon.
My Tea is hot and wonderful everyday thanks to my new Instant Solo Single-Serve 2-in-1 Coffee Maker for Ground Coffee and K-Cup¬ÆPod.
So easy to use and such a space saver as well. I just used it for the first time and it couldn't be easier or taste better. I highly recommend it
What a great find this was. Hot water is ready as soon as you turn it on. Brew time is great also. Not one complaint.

review name: This is the best coffee maker I‚Äôve ever had !

People reported the pod cup can‚Äôt be closed when inserted, i found it can, you just have to give it a little extra push
Makes a nice cup of coffee. I do get a few grains, but it is significantly less money than buying the pods.

review name: Perfecta y justo lo que necesitaba.
review text: Pues hago la cantidad exacta del caf√© que voy a consumir y sin desperdicio ningun. La recomiendo totalmente.

review name: Tried several, this is the best!
review text: I‚Äôve been disappointed after spending big dollars on others like Cuisinart, that didn‚Äôt work well. With Cuisinart customer service never even responding. This Instant Solo is awesome! Easy to use, great coffee, no mess, great design!!
Brews in seconds, no loud noises, coffee comes out HOT! instapot brand is wonderful

review name: coffee splashes out of mug as it's filling
review text: I really like this coffee maker but really want to love it! Not sure if this is normal but I get little splashes to big splashes of coffee all over my countertop as my mug is filling. After every brewed cup I have to wipe up. Not sure if I can deal with this, as I like everything else about this coffee maker. Return or keep, that is the question.
Just as good as a Kurig . Great taste ! Kurig pods or my own ground . Overall very pleased .

I received mine a few days ago and love it! I was throwing away so much brewed coffee from my regular coffee pot that this will pay for itself. It makes great coffee, although I prefer the flavor of the pods over using the refillable cup. It will also make tea from bags, just add the bag to the mug and run plain water through, let it steep for a few minutes and you're good to go. It's also great for making instant cup a soup, put the contents of the packet in the mug and set it for 8 ounces . You can check out 'Just a Dad' videos on YouTube...he has great reviews and instructional videos that should help you out if you have any questions..

After trying one of the unknown brands of low-profile coffee makers, and having to return it because it leaked water all over the counter, I was very hesitant to buy something similar again. I took a chance, because I was familiar with the quality of Instant brands. I‚Äôm so glad that I did as this is one great little coffee maker! The coffee itself brews fast, hot, and tastes fantastic. As a lot of people do, I have a ton of mis-matched, different-sized mugs. With the different size cup and boldness options, I can have a great cup of coffee no matter what. I love the size too. It holds a decent amount of water, but doesn‚Äôt take up a ton of space on my counter.
Good
Love it

My Keurig died right after Christmas and I needed a new coffee maker stat! I wanted a slim profile and one without all the various options because I never use them. I couldn‚Äôt find a Keurig in stock anywhere. I guess everyone got one for Christmas. Because I didn‚Äôt want to wait I decided to try this one from Instapot. It‚Äôs ok. It does what it should and works as I‚Äôd expect it to.
Two issues‚Ä¶1. The brew time is much slower. Not enough to be a deal breaker but definitely noticeable. 2. Because of the distance between the brewer and where an average size mug sits there is a lot of splashing. Coffee splashed out of the mug during the entire brew cycle. It‚Äôs not that big of a deal but it is annoying.
I did get mine on sale so it cost a lot less than a Keurig so bonus points for that. It‚Äôs decent, works, the way it should but I think I like my old Keurig better.
we are in awe of this coffee maker! we can‚Äôt believe how easy it is to make a delicious cup of coffee.

I missed my large Kureg coffee maker. However, with my limited countertop I figured I was destined to use a single cup brewer. Well, I gave that away as soon as this arrived! It comes with a reusable screened K cup that one can add loose coffee to if they wish. I use my regular K cups and have put away the reusable one for the day I may need it. I like the back reservoir as opposed to adding a cup of water to brew a cup of coffee. I use my "to go" mug to keep my coffee warm throughout the morning around the house here and I can fill it probably 4 times before refilling the reservoir with my filtered water. I highly recommend this small coffee maker.

My keurig lasted a little more than a year

very easy to put in you ground coffee in the morning.Instant pot solo is the beat cartridge on the market way better then Keurig.Keurig is going down hill.Stay with Instant pot-solo

After using for more than a month, I can say that I don't like this coffee maker. I was planning to return it, but my return window has closed. I'll likely give it away or donate it. 1) When using a standard height mug, you get a lot of splash on the surface behind the cup and also on the counter around the machine. 2) Eco friendly pods do not fit. 3) No pod I've tried produces a good flavor. This serves as an excellent additional pod for the Instant Solo. When making several cups, it eliminates wait time, allowing for the next cycle to start immediately while cleaning out the first basket. The handle is great and prevents the need to grab a still hot pod for removal. We love our machine and appreciate now having a backup pod to speed things up when brewing multiples.

review name: Makes a quick cup of coffee
review text: We decided in favor of this pod coffee maker because of the good reviews, and we‚Äôre so glad we did. It makes a great cup of coffee, at least as quickly as a Keurig. The ‚Äúsmall‚Äù and ‚Äúmedium‚Äù cups are larger than those by other makers, too. My only criticism is that the reservoir depletes quickly‚Ä¶though, we might be drinking more coffee now!
Plan on bone broth
It's a great 1 cup coffee maker.
Compact size frees up countertop space. Easy to use. I can make 3 cups of coffee before refilling reservoir. Since I am limited to one cup a day that works well for me.

review name: Using the pod with ground coffee not the greatest
review text:
* Update: after 14 months of using: I found and use filters which work well. The past couple of months it does brew slower- now it steams from lid. It was leaking from lid but I noticed the red thing became loose- once I cleaned it and took off and put back on, no leak after but still a lot of steam from lid.

I still refuse to use a K-cup so in the end I am happy there are other options.
Need to fill more frequently, but that is not a big deal what so ever
Love this coffee maker. Easy to use fast too

Fast coffee. Used both cuos and grounds and worked perfectly. It will be great for loose tea and hot chocolate pods too.
Slender and easy to find space for

review name: Better than the keurig it replaced.
review text: Fast and easy to clean. Love the water tank. Always ready

I had a HB single cup drip coffee maker, and the coffee was ok- but I knew it could be better. (I use Dunkin Donuts coffee. This coffee brewer is wonderful! The flavor is great! I‚Äôve gone from 1 cup in the morning to 2 cups. I like that the water caraffe holds 40oz and the unit is slim. Also, even though I use ground coffee with the adapter, I can also use the K-cups. 100% live this coffee brewer!

Love it!! Fill up your tank once and get 4 to 6 cups of coffee. It‚Äôs beautiful, it‚Äôs sleek and you even get a bold button on top if you want extra boldness flavor. It‚Äôs quicker than my single serving Keurig! How exciting is that?! I recommend.. PS I love using the little filter that is included.!

review text: We liked this coffee maker so much that my wife bought another one for her mom! You can choose between three sizes of cups and regular or bold. It's nice being able to fill this with your own ground coffee and not having to buy overpriced pods. It can even accommodate slightly larger sized mugs as you can see in my picture, which is nice. The whole maker is fairly small and narrow, and we are able to fit in on our countertop easily.

After having the last two keurig coffee makers break down in less than 6 months I decided to try something different. I chose the instant coffee maker and so far I‚Äôm loving it. It takes up much less space on our counter and is working great. I would recommend it
I really like how easy is to use and that it brews just one cup at the time. The taste is amazing with any kind of creamer or milk. Just place the pod of your liking and voila!

advantage of a keurig is this one seems like it's instantly hot versus having to wait on a keurig., i had read it splashes though and it does a little but no big deal. we love this machine. great price on sale after our Keurig died.

After having the last two keurig coffee makers break down in less than 6 months I decided to try something different. I chose the instant coffee maker and so far I‚Äôm loving it. It takes up much less space on our counter and is working great. I would recommend it

review text: I saw this and thought I'd try it. IT IS AMAZING!!! It gives you hot coffee in seconds. Not a forever heat up like the keurig. review text: No refillable kcups for this machine found anywhere. The only reason I wouldn‚Äôt buy it again.

We love this k-cup single coffee maker. It's small and slim, perfect for our counter. Perfect for when we want just one cup of coffee and don't need to make a whole pot, plus it doesn't take up much space.

My overall opinion is that this is a very good product. It's very easy to use and to clean. I like that it came with a reusable coffee pod! Also I really like that you can fit a full sized travel mug to brew directly into it (not brewing in a cup and then transferring to mug). My only complaint, and this is just a matter of opinion I'm sure, is that the water tank is in the back. I have to pull the whole machine out to fill it. If the tank was on the side it would be better. If counter space is a concern then this is a good idea.

This replaced my Keurig, I love the little sounds it makes when buttons are pushed. Not only is it fast. I can also have my coffee regular or bold ( the strength of my coffee is adjustable) . I've had it for about 3 months so far no problems. I would buy it again.

review name: Best coffee maker I've ever had.
review text:
I love this coffee maker. I use my own grounds in the provided little basket cup and it makes a very good cup of drip coffee. The water is not forced through quickly like a Keurig (I never liked the coffee from the Keurig style machines ... and the pods are at least $1 each).

It takes up very little room on the countertop, too. The water reservoir is easy to fill. I've had no problems with this coffee maker. I use a find coffee ground and fill the little basket slightly over 3/4 full. I don't tamp it down. Yummy. It gets me up in the morning. Oh, and a splash of milk doesn't cool down the whole cup of hot coffee.
Purchased as an extra pod for my coffee maker. Love the idea of brewing a single cup of coffee without the waste of the single serve pod.
I have downsized my coffee consumption so I went to a single use..came with a basket to use regular ground coffee‚Ä¶great for that evening cup of tea!

I love this machine because it takes the guess work out of using it. It is so simple to use. The machine does everything itself. No parts to move around or adjust. Makes a great cup of coffee instantly and it‚Äôs hot. Better than any other out there. Nice sleek design.

I got this to replace my ninja coffee bar when it quit working. I like that it will dispense up to 12 ounces, one cup at a time. Although it will use the k cups, it also comes with a reusable ‚Äúk cup‚Äù.

I like it, it's easy to use and it is not difficult to clean afterwards. I will say, if you're someone that has a hard time seeing, you may struggle to see the notch in the pod where you insert the lip of the lid. But other than that, I don't really have any negative feedback.

review name: Wow amazing!!! No more ‚ÄúK‚Äù machine for me!!!
review text: Ok, I‚Äôm not a fanboy, but I‚Äôm about to sound like it‚Ä¶ this instapot craze my wife has been on is fully justified! What a great thin profile and larger tank piece of tech. The bold function works great! It lets you know if your low on water and beeps to communicate with you. I love this thing and will only get other like it. The coffee filter that comes with it is awesome too! Just get it and quit searching, your search is seriously over :)
Easy to use
I bought this for a backup for when the unit that came with the coffee maker gives out‚Ä¶.was very happy to find it here because I read many reviews asking for it.
Overall I like it. The only thing I'm unhappy with is that the smallest cup is 8 ounces. My wife would prefer 6 ounces or less.

Done with Keurig coffee makers, they don't last like they should. Had 3 Keurig before I decided no more. This coffee maker works great. Small footprint. Quick. On sale, so great price Nice tasting coffee that's brewed with coffee maker.

review name: Flavor, ease of use, well made.
review text: Received this today and I am very satisfied. Well made unit. Simple controls. Love the smooth control panel that requires just a light touch to activate. Brews very fast. Had a Cuisinart that died, then I purchased a Greekcho machine from Amazon that was defective. It is not as well made as this machine.
