review name: Fast & Hot mawnin' cup o' joe!!
review text:
Pros: All in all so far this coffee maker is excellent. Quiet and very quick to brew your morning hot cup of Joe. Experimented using the reusable pod, it worked just fine. I have their Instant Pot Duo 6 quart. It‚Äôs near two years old and works wonderfully. The ‚ÄúInstant‚Äù company in my opinion sure does focus on making quality products. To conclude I had two (competitor brand) solo coffee makers. Due to the inadequacy of the cleaning system they both burned out and made it to the trash.

Cons: I won‚Äôt call these cons, maybe a simple fix to the design of the coffee maker which I hope the manufacture reads.
Someone mentioned the rubber feet on the bottom of the unit making it difficult to slide the coffee maker on the countertop. Simplest solution a nice thin piece of fabric, a doily or a folded piece of paper towel. When it gets sloppy swap it out.
Someone also suggested using a 4‚Äù x 2‚Äù mini cake pan or a ramekin upside down for short coffee cups to prevent splash while brewing, love that idea. Or just simply use a taller cup.
Best thing I bought for my office - ever. Brews perfectly and it's quiet. I love it!
Great one person coffee maker. Comes with a reusable pod to be more sustainable.

review name: Barely a month old and malfunctioning
review text: The first few weeks were fantastic! I loved it. In the last few days it‚Äôs been making squealing noises during brewing with steam coming out of the brewing/steeping area continuing after brew has completed. A month is far too soon for any coffee maker to malfunction. I‚Äôll be contacting InstantPot about a replacement or refund.

review name: Best single cup coffee maker I‚Äôve ever purchased!
review text:
This coffee maker is quality made-coffee is HOT and comes out quickly which is perfect when I‚Äôm trying to get out the door in the morning!!
Coffee is flavorful and the mechanism of filling the water in back is ingenious! Fits great on my counter and can use with either pods or able to use regular canister coffee! Great buy!

review name: Works great! Size buttons deliver same amount every time.
review text: We love the quality of our Instant Pot cooker, so I decided to try this coffee maker. Very happy with it. Fill sizes are right on and flavor stays consistent because of it. We'll see if it lasts longer than the Keurig at avg. of 1 year. I'm betting it will.

After several other-rig brands failing, I decided to try the Insta-Pot brand despite the reviews. I live my Insta-Pot, so trying this was a brand performance testing, for me. Love it! Hot coffee, big water carafe, slow brew which makes a great cup of coffee. No pod and I can draw hot water for tea or hot chocolate. Other reviews complained about the machine leaking. It isn't the machine malfunctioning, it is the carafe not properly seated after filling with water. It happened to me and I was bummed . . . until I realized it was operator error.
I bought this to take on vacation with me and it‚Äôs the perfect small size and makes great coffee. I love it!

Ok, this is an annoying pot. It drips EVERY TIME; no matter what... leave the cup for an entire minute. I got it on a deal for $60 whatever including tax. I am simply sick of returns. I am simply sick of pots that just do NOT work; no matter what brand/model... cheap, expensive. I put in for a return; not sure if I am going to follow thru; because no matter what-like I said; I cannot find even a decent coffee maker. The coffee I have made so far-4 cups; have not been strong enough even with lotsa coffee and the bold button on. I find the cleaning of the pod holder annoying too! I will never use a pod; I grind my own coffee.
The pro's: nice big water tank; works sorta fast. I did get the white; it was on sale. Not thrilled about that since it leaks. So ya have to keep taking the bottom off and cleaning it; cleaning the pod-wish they would give you 2 of those.
It looks nice. Buttons work fine. Like I said; I hate returns and I have some now... so I might just ignore the return and keep it. Because: I cannot cannot find a pot: that doesn't leak, have wayyyy too much condensation... and I know how to USE a coffee pot. And if it has those funky cone filters- absolutely a no-go!
Do I recommend this? Yes, if you get a non-leaker! And one that brews strong enough...
Doesn‚Äôt take up too much counter space. Use it everyday.
Easy to use, three oz sizes, Bold flavor option. Highly recommend.
Easy to use

I bought this coffee maker because my Nespresso Virtuo was being really hard on my wallet to sustain. I was tired of Keurig. I wanted something different. I made the right choice. Taste of the coffee is pretty good. This has nothing to do with the taste of coffee but I really like the ‚Äúscreen‚Äù and the cutest little sound it makes when your coffee is ready:) I wasn‚Äôt too crazy about the reusable filter design but the handle actually became quite handy to prevent getting your fingers burned and it makes it easy to rinse the coffee grind off of the filter. If you are looking for a Keurig alternative, this is itüëç

What I appreciate most is the addition of a water reservoir with the subtraction of footprint over the K-named ‚Äúmini‚Äù brewer it replaced. It‚Äôs easy to use and works faster than the previous brewer as well. The included reusable basket is hit-or-miss; it usually works fine, save for the occasional fluke and dribble. The ‚Äúbold‚Äù button is helpful and slows down the speed of brew, which sometimes tempers the splashing a little (depending on height of receiving vessel). Temperature is suitably hot-I need to wait a couple of minutes before I can drink what got dispensed. I can perceive what quibbles some write about this coffee brewer, but nowhere near the point of dealbreaker. I‚Äôve only used standard prepacked K-cups (which seem distortedly shorter after use in this thingü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è) and the included reusable basket. Within that criteria, this works consistently well and is reasonably priced. I do wish I could find paper filter liners for the reusable basket that actually fit well. I‚Äôd then avoid the few grounds that sometimes show up in the mug and easily toss into the compost.

Instant Brands has offered other appliances to popular effect-I couldn‚Äôt see how they‚Äôd brain fart on making a coffee brewer. I hope this has better durability than the other brand. The need for K-maker replacement clocks in for me at every 18 months. I‚Äôm only one month in with this-so far, so good.

After my Keurig of 6 years died, I couldn't justify the price of a replacement so I ordered this and I'm so glad I did! It is so easy to use, and brews way hotter than my Keurig ever did! It takes up way less space on the counter and I love the 40oz dispenser capacity. My only complaint is that it splatters...... A LOT. during the brewing process, it dribbles then pushes gushes out before regulating the stream coming out. So just be prepared to clean up around it every brew.

review name: Super early start to the AM...and so easy!
review text: The headline says it all...

When it comes to coffee makers that is. It‚Äôs simple I need a machine that is simple because at 4:30-5am I am in no mood to fuss with some tiny silver button that matches the machines color that I will only change the clock (whoops) and not make coffee.
I took the leap and bought this, and in the color blue. I in no way wanted another Kerig. Bland brewing and will succumb to descaling and never make ‚Äúmarginal Bland coffee again‚Äù. I also don‚Äôt need a giant coffee maker, and not going to buy a cheap 1 cup maker that will prolly only work for 3 months and then die.
This Coffee maker, is stylish - blue. The lid is also the touch screen, where the button is below glass. Power, 3 fill levels and a ‚Äúbold‚Äù setting are what there is to press in the am.
Bold - it will pre moisten the grounds before brewing. It adds maybe 20 seconds more to the brewing process.
I love the Bold setting, it makes my coffee stand out.
Before this machine I had a single cup French press for 4 years. It finally broke and I decided to try something new, instead of buying another 4 cup machine that wil break in 5 months.
It‚Äôs value is excellent, a 1 cup with barely a water reservoir from Kerig and other brands will set u back around the same amount or more.
Style and footprint on the counter are perfect too.
Ease to clean and no descaling are huge bonuses.
The fact that it comes with a coffee pod for your own grounds was the ‚Äúbuy now‚Äù option I selected. As most make you buy those separately, and on those u have to touch the hot cup after, this one has a handle built onto it so u can immediately prepare and make another cup ( say if u had a friend over and needed 2 cup‚Äôs or whatever of coffee)

In conclusion the company on obviously sat and brainstormed and thought this completely though.

Great little blue coffee maker one of my favorite kitchen appliance purchases of late.

I have spent hundreds of dollars on different brand name one cup coffee makers. What a waste. This coffee maker beats them all hands down. It makes great coffee and it comes out hot, unlike othet brewers that the coffee comes out warm. Love, love my new coffee maker.

It would only make 6oz of coffee and most of it was water and took FOREVER! The company took forever to respond and let me know what they were doing. They finally sent me a new one. It‚Äôs now stopped working in the exact same way as the other one after only a month! A MONTH!!! I‚Äôm so disappointed and pissed I spent this money to not have coffee. I want my money back

This single serve coffee maker is great. It's very easy to use. The water heats up fast and brewing time is quick. I like that it has a water reservoir as well. It takes K cups, and it comes with a resuable cup. Overall satisfied! 5 stars.

I've been wanting one of these for months, had no clue the white one was cheaper for some reason so I chose that one. I love how quickly it brews my coffee, I've used both k-cups as well as the reusable cup and it works great with both! I'd say definitely worth the money, but I still waited for it to go on sale because I'm cheap lol.

This has replaced a 5 mo old top model keurig and even though Keurig is sending me a new one I decided I needed to try another make and have a backup. This is far more simple to operate than the keurig and it brews hotter coffee. It has less features and offers less cup sizes but I find 8,10 &12oz sizes is all I need and would use. The flavour using McCafe is not quite as good as the keurig but not enough difference to make me return it. Build quality is on par plus amazon has a 90 return or replace warranty on it and after that the manufactures 1yr warranty. That's excellent because most problems arise within those 90days. One major difference that gives this 5 stars is that it puts no coffee grinds in the cup of coffee. The keurig did unless you cleaned it out after every use. That was unacceptable this is the first of out 4 Keurigs that did that. I phoned them and they said that is normal because of the multiple punctures it makes in the pod. Maybe I had a bad machine because it died within 5mos. I no longer trust them so time will tell if Instant pot solo will prove to outlast and out perform over the next weeks and months. I just got it today so these are my initial impressions so I will update if I have any issues with it. I do recommend it.
This machine is really well made and it is fast and quiet, the water reservoir hold a good amount. It's really well made and doesn't take up much of my counter space.

Works as promised. Greatly reduces waste versus a pour-over filter (50% or more).

Reusable filters work (unlike after market reusables I once bought for Keurig). Better coffee with fresh rather than pre-filled pods.

Easy to clean. Highly recommended.

This machine started out amazing, but unfortunately ours broke down within 3 months. We had to dig out our old Keurig machine to have coffee -- which has lasted 4 years. As such, I cannot recommend this coffee maker over Keurig. I hope this helps someone make a decision when looking for a coffee maker.
